encodingDesc.p: The following text is encoded in accordance with EpiDoc standards and with the CTS/CITE Architecture.

div.p:
The Vocabulary gives the meanings of all words found in the text of this edition of the first four books of the Anabasis. Since it is not a dictionary of the whole Anabasis, a Multiplicity of citations, which tend only to confuse the pupil, has been avoided. The principal parts of all verbs, except those which offer no opportunity for error, are given in full. A hyphen prefixed to any word indicates that it is used only in compounds, The parts of compound verbs are given only when the simple verb is not listed in this vocabulary. In explaining derivations, simplicity and clearness have been the aim. Many cognate and borrowed words have been given both from English and Latin; some of the borrowed words, however, are not borrowed directly from the Greek words under which they are placed (cp. baptize under βάπτω), The editors have seen in their own teaching that observation of related words not only quickens a pupil's interest in Greek, but also aids him greatly in learning the meanings of words. For assistance in understanding Greek, Latin, and English cognate forms, which vary in their mutes (or stops) according to principles stated in the last century by Jakob Grimm, the chief features of Grimm’s Law are here given. Vowel changes follow no fixed law, and in fact there are numerous exceptions to the law of mute changes. error, are given in full. GREEK LATIN ENGLISH π (πούς) =p (pes) =f (foot) κ (κύων) =c (canis) =h (hound) (mr) ᾿ς (ree _ (mothe )
μήτηρ ~ mater — mother β (τύρβη) ΞΞ ὁ (turba) =p (thorp) Ὕ (γένος) =g (genus) = (kin) δ (δύο) =d (duo) =f (two) φ (φέρω) =f (fero) =6 (bear) χ (χόρτο) =A (hortus) =g (garden) θ (θύρα) =f Cforis) =d (door) All Greek words used in explaining derivations are translated, unless they are defined in the vocabulary immediately above or below. If a word used in explaining derivations is preceded by the abbreviation "cp.," the vocabulary-word is not derived from it, but both are from the same root; for example, ἀγνοέω is not derived from γιγνώσκω, but both come from the root γωνο. It has seemed best not to introduce forms which are merely assumed in order to account for derivations, as ἄγνοος, which is implied by ἀγνοέω, but is not found in actual use in Greek authors.

div.head: A ἀ-
div.p: a prefix of two uses: (1) Called alpha privative [cogn., Lat. in-, not (as in incertus, uncertain), Eng. un-; bor., Eng. a-, an-, as in atheist, anonymous], usually having the older form ἀν- before vowels, and giving neg. force to the word to which it is prefixed; see ἄβατος, ἀνάριστος, (2) Called alpha copulative, having in some words its older form ἀ-, and signifying with or together (like Lat. con-, as in confero, bring together) ; see ἀκόλουθος, ἅπας.

div.head: ἄβατος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., βαίνω, go (not to be trodden], impassable. Ἀβροκόμᾶς, -α (Doric gen.), Abrocomas, one of the four generals of Artaxerxes, satrap of Phoenicia, and a personal enemy of Cyrus. Ἀβυδος, -ου, ἡ Abydos, a city on the Asiatic side of the Hellespont, the site of Xerxes’ bridge. The strait at this point is hardly a mile wide. The poet Byron swam across in a little over an hour.

div.head: ἀγαθός
div.p: -ή, -όν [bor., Eng. Agatha], good, upright, brave, fertile; useful, serviceable; of dreams, favorable, καλὸς καὶ ἀγαθός, a possessor of all noble qualities, gentleman, noble and good man. Neut. as subst., a good, favor, advantage, blessing, pl., good things, resources, supplies, blessings, ἀγαθόν τι ποιεῖν τινα, do one a good turn.

div.head: ἀγάλλομαι
div.p: only in pres. and impf., glory or take delight in, with dat. or ἐπί and dat.

div.head: ἄγαμαι
div.p: ἠγάσθην, admire.

div.head: ἀγαπάω
div.p: ἀγαπήσω, etc. [ἀγάπη, love], love, esteem.

div.head: Ἀγασίας
div.p: -ου, Agasias, a captain in the Greek army.

div.head: ἀγαστός
div.p: -ή, -όν (verbal of ἄγαμαι), admirable, praiseworthy.

div.head: ἀγγελία
div.p: -ας [ἀγγέλλω], news, message.

div.head: ἀγγέλλω
div.p: ἀγγελῶ, ἤγγειλα, ἤγγελκα, ἤγγελμαι, ἠγγέλθην, announce, report, with dat. or πρός and acc. of the person, with ptc. in indir. disc. of the message.

div.head: ἄγγελος
div.p: -ου [ἀγγέλλω; bor., Lat. angelus, angel, Eng. angel, evangelist], messenger.

div.head: ἀγείρω
div.p: ἤγειρα, collect, assemble.

div.head: ἀγένειος
div.p: -ον (ἀ-priv., γένειος, beard ), beardless.

div.head: Ἀγίας
div.p: -ου, Agias, one of the Greek generals entrapped at the Zapatas.

div.head: ἄγκος
div.p: -ους, τό [from cogn. words were bor. Eng. angle, ankle] (der, ollow), valley, glen.

div.head: ἄγκυρα
div.p: -ας [cp. ἄγκος; bor, Lat. ancora, anchor, Eng. anchor], anchor.

div.head: ἀγνοέω
div.p: ἀγνοήσω, etc. [ἀ-priv., cp. γιγνώσκω, know], not know or understand, Lat. ignoro.

div.head: ἀγνωμοσύνη
div.p: -ης [ἀγνώμων, without knowledge; cp. ἀγνοέω], want of knowledge; pl., misunderstandings.

div.head: ἀγορά
div.p: -ᾶς [ἀγείρω], assembly, place of assembly, market place, market, ἀγορὰ πλήθουσα, the time of full market, middle of the forenoon, when the market place was thronged with buyers; ἀγορὰν παρέχειν, provide a market, offer provisions for sale.

div.head: ἀγοράζω
div.p: ἀγοράσω, etc. [ἀγορά], be tn the market place, buy.

div.head: ἄγριος
div.p:
-a, -ov [ἀγρός, field; cogn.,
Lat. ager, field, Eng. acre, acorn (fruit of the feld)], of the fields, wild.

div.head: ἄγω
div.p: ἄξω, ἤγαγον, ἦχα, ἦγμαι, ἤχθην [cogn., Lat. ago, drive; bor., Eng. demagogue, pedagogue, synagogue], set going, lead, lead up; bring, carry, without obj. expressed, lead the way, advance; intr., of roads, lead, go, of troops, march; φέρειν καὶ ἄγειν, Lat. ferre et agere, plunder, φέρειν applying to things carried, ἄγειν to men and beasts; ἄγειν ἐπὶ γάμῳ, take home as one’s wife, εἰρήνην or ἡσυχίαν ἄγειν, lead a peaceful life, live at ease; ἄγε δή, come now !

div.head: ἀγών
div.p: ἀγῶνος, ὁ [ἄγω ; bor., Eng. agony ], assembly, esp. at the games; athletic contest, games, struggle, contest.

div.head: ἀγωνίζομαι
div.p: ἀγωνιοῦμαι, etc. [ἀγών ; bor. Eng. antagonize], contend, strive, fight, with cogn. acc. of the contest, contend in, compete in.

div.head: ἀγωνοθέτης
div.p: -ου [ἀγών, τίθημι, hold, see 58, 21 ]. director of a contest, umpire.

div.head: ἄδειπνος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., δεῖπνον, dinner ], dinnerless.

div.head: ἀδελφός
div.p: -οὔ [ἀ-copulative, δελφύς, womb, bor, Eng, Philadelphia, Adelphi], brother.

div.head: ἀδεῶς
div.p: [ἀδεής (ἀ-priv., δείδω, fear), fearless], adv., fearlessly.

div.head: ἀδιάβατος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., διαβαίνω, cross], not to be crossed without boats, unfordadble.

div.head: ἀδικέω
div.p: ἀδικήσω, etc. [ἄδικος], be unjust, be in the wrong, do wrong, wrong, harm, abs., with acc. of the person, cogn. acc. of the injury; pass., be wronged, suffer wrong.

div.head: ἀδικία
div.p: -ας [ἄδικος], injustice, wrongdoing.

div.head: ἄδικος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., δίκη, right], unjust, unprincipled. As subst., masc., wrongdoer, neut., ἐκ τοῦ ἀδίκου, by unjust means.

div.head: ἀδόλως
div.p: [ἄδολος (ἀ- priv., δόλος, trick), without trickery], adv., without treachery.

div.head: ἀδύνατος
div.p: -ov (ἀ-priv., δύναμαι, be able), impossible, impracticable.

div.head: ᾄδω
div.p: ᾄσομαι, ᾔσα, ᾔσθην, sing.

div.head: ἀεί
div.p: [cogn., Eng. age], adv., always, incessantly, on each occasion, in succession.

div.head: ἄθεος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., θεός, god, bor., Eng. atheist], godless, impious.

div.head: Ἀθῆναι
div.p: -ῶν [Ἀθηνά, Athena, patron goddess of Athens], Athens, the most important city of Greece, both in ancient and modern times. Although defeated by Sparta in the Peloponnesian War (431-404 B.C.), it soon regained a leading position in the Greek world.

div.head: Ἀθηναῖος
div.p: -ου [Ἀθῆναι], Athenian, a citizen of Athens.

div.head: Ἀθήνησι
div.p: [locative of Ἀθῆναι], adv., at Athens.

div.head: ἆθλον
div.p: -ου [cp. ἆθλος, contest ; bor., Eng. athlete], prize of a contest, prize.

div.head: ἀθροίζω
div.p: ἁθροίσω, etc. [ἁθρόος], gather together, collect; mid., muster.

div.head: ἁθρόος
div.p: -α, -ον [ἁ-copulative, root θρο, hold] (holding together), close together, in close array, all together, in a mass.

div.head: ἀθυμέω
div.p: ἀθυμήσω, etc. [ἄθυμος], to be discouraged, dispirited, dejected. ἀθυμητέον (verbal of ἀθυμέω), impers., must be discouraged.

div.head: ἀθυμία
div.p: -ας [ἄθυμος], discouragement, despondency, dejection.

div.head: ἄθυμος
div.p:
-ον [ἀ-priv., θυμός, spirit, courage], discouraged, faint-hearted. ἀθύμως [ἄθυμος], adv., despondently,
dejectedly; ἀθύμως ἔχειν, be despondent or dejected.

div.head: Αἰγύπτιος
div.p: -α, -ov [Αἴγυπτος], Egyptian. As subst., Egyptian, a native of Egypt.

div.head: Αἴγυπτος
div.p: -ου, ἡ, Egypt, subdued by Cambyses in 525 B.C. and for many years subject to Persia, but independent at the time of the events described in the Anabasis.

div.head: αἰδέομαι
div.p: αἰδέσομαι, ἤδεσμαι, ἡδέσθην [αἰδώς], reverence, respect.

div.head: αἰδήμων
div.p: -ον, sup. αἰδημονέστατος [αἰδέομαι], respectful.

div.head: αἰδοῖα
div.p: -ων, τά [αἰδώς], private parts, groin.

div.head: αἰδώς
div.p: -οῦς, ἡ, shame, reverence, respect.

div.head: αἰετός
div.p: -οῦ, eagle.

div.head: αἴθω
div.p: [cogn., Lat. aestus, seething of heat or waves, aestas, summer], only pres. and impf., poetic (=καίω), burn.

div.head: αἰκίζω
div.p: rare in act.; as deponent, αἱκίζομαι, αἰκιοῦμαι, ἢκισάμην, ἥκισμαι, maltreat, torture, mutilate.

div.head: Αἰνείας
div.p: -ου, Aenéas, a captain in the Greek army. Αἰνιᾶν, -ἂνος, ὁ, Aentanian, an inhabitant of Aeniania, a district in southern Thessaly.

div.head: αἴξ
div.p: αἰγός, ἡ, goat.

div.head: αἱρετέος
div.p: -α, -ον (verbal of αἱρέω), must be taken.

div.head: αἱρετός
div.p: -ή, -όν (verbal-of αἱρέω), taken, chosen. Masc. as subst., deputy, delegate.

div.head: αἱρέω
div.p: αἱρήσω, εἶλον, ἥρηκα, ἤρημαι, ἡρέθην [bor., Eng. heresy, heretic ], take, catch, capture, mid., take for oneself, choose, prefer, elect; pass., be taken, chosen, elected.

div.head: αἴρω
div.p: ἀρῶ, ἦρα, ἦρκα, ἧρμαι, ἤρθην, raise, lift up.

div.head: αἰσθάνομαι
div.p: αἰσθήσομαι, ἡσθόμην, ἤσθημαι [bor., Eng. aesthetic, anaesthetic], perceive, see, hear, learn, with acc., or with ὅτι or ptc. in indir. disc.

div.head: αἴσθησις
div.p: -εως, ἡ [αἰσθάνομαι], perception; αἴσθησιν παρέχειν, be perceived.

div.head: Αἰσχίνης
div.p: -ου, Aeschines, a leader of peltasts in the Greek army.

div.head: αἰσχρός
div.p: -ἅ, -ὁν [αἶσχος, shame, disgrace], shameful, disgraceful, base. αἰσχρῶς [αἰσχρός], adv., shamefully, ignominiously.

div.head: αἰσχύνη
div.p: -ης [0Ρ. αἰσχρός], shame, disgrace; with obj. gen., a feeling of shame before.

div.head: αἰσχύνω
div.p: αἰσχυνῶ, ἤσχυνα, ἡσχύνθην (cp. αἰσχρός), act. rare, dishonor, put to shame, as pass. deponent, be ashamed, feel ashamed, with acc. of the person, be ashamed before, stand in awe of.

div.head: αἰτέω
div.p: αἰτήσω, etc., ask, ask for, demand, with acc. of thing or of person, with two accs. (person and thing), with acc. of thing and παρά with gen. of person; mid., make a request of, beg, with inf. and παρά with gen. of person.

div.head: αἰτιάομαι
div.p: αἰτιάσομαι, ἡτιασάμην, ἡτίαμαι, ἡτιάθην [αἰτία, accusation, blame], accuse, with inf. of the charge; blame, reproach, with ὅτι and causal clause.

div.head: αἴτιος
div.p: -α, -ον, causing, responsible, abs. or with obj. gen, Neut. as subst., cause.

div.head: αἰχμάλωτος
div.p: -ον [αἰχμή, spear, ἁλίσκομαι], taken by the spear, captured, As subst., οἱ αἰχμάλωτοι, the captives, prisoners; τὰ αἰχμάλωτα, the booty, both persons and things.

div.head: Ἀκαρνάν
div.p:
-ᾶνος, ὁ, Acarnanian, a
native of Acarnania, on the west coast of Greece.

div.head: ἄκαυστος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., καίω, burn], unburned.

div.head: ἀκήρυκτος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., κηρύττω, proclaim] (not proclaimed ), of a war in which no truce is proclaimed, truceless, trreconctlable.

div.head: ἀκινάκης
div.p: -ου (Persian word), short sword of the Persians. It was suspended from a belt over the right hip. See Fig. 3, p. 20.

div.head: ἀκινδύνως
div.p: [ἀκίνδυνος (ἀ-priv., κίνδυνος, danger), without danger ], adv., without danger.

div.head: ἀκμάζω
div.p: ἀκμάσω [ἀκμή], be at the highest point of strength and ability, be in one’s prime.

div.head: ἀκμή
div.p: -ῆς [cp. ἄκρος; cogn., Lat. acer, sharp, acies, sharp edge or point, acus, needle, Eng. edge; bor., Eng. acme], point, highest point. Acc. as adv., at the point of, just.

div.head: ἀκόλαστος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., κολάζω, punish], unpunished, undisciplined.

div.head: ἀκόλουθος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-copulative, κέλευθος, path; bor., anacoluthon] (going the same way), consistent.

div.head: ἀκοντίζω
div.p: etc, etc. [ἀκόντιον], throw the javelin, throw a javelin at, hit with a javelin, hit.

div.head: ἀκόντιον
div.p: -ου [diminutive of ἄκων, javelin, cp. ἀκμή], javelin, a light spear for hurling. See Fig. 62, p. 196, and Introd. § 59.

div.head: ἀκόντισις
div.p: -εως, [ἀκοντίζω], throwing the javelin. See Fig. 62, p. 196.

div.head: ἀκοντιστής
div.p: -οῦ [ἀκοντίζω], javelin thrower. See Introd. §§ 57, 59.

div.head: ἀκούω
div.p: ἀκούσομαι, ἤκουσα, ἀκήκοα, ἠκούσθην [bor., Eng. acoustic], hear, with acc. or gen. of thing heard, gen. of source, inf. and subject acc., ὅτι, or ptc. in indir. disc.; hear of or about, with acc. and sometimes a gen. of source; give heed to, obey, with gen.

div.head: ἄκρατος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., κεράννυμι, mix], unmixed, strong, of wine or beer taken clear.

div.head: ἀκροβολίζομαι
div.p: ἠκροβολισάμην [ἀκροβόλος (ἄκρος, βάλλω, throw), thrower from a height or a distance, skirmisher], skirmish, as opposed to fighting hand to hand.

div.head: ἀκροβόλισις
div.p: -εως, ἡ [ἀκροβολίζομαι], skirmishing, skirmish.

div.head: ἀκρόπολις
div.p: -εως, ἡ [ἄκρος, πόλις, city, bor., Eng. acropolis ], the hill around which a Greek city was usually built, upper city, citadel. Being fortified, it afforded refuge for the inhabitants in time of danger, and in conquered cities whatever garrison was needed to maintain order was quartered there.

div.head: ἄκρος
div.p: -α, -oν [cp. ἀκμή ; bor., Eng. acrobat, acrostic], at the point, highest, Neut. as subst., summit, top; pl., heights.

div.head: ἀκρωνυχία
div.p: -ας [ἄκρος, ὄνυξ (whence is bor. Eng. onyx), claw] (point of a claw), spur of a mountain. ἄκων, ἄκουσα, ἆκον [contraction of

div.head: ἀέκων
div.p: (ἀ-priv. + ἑκών, willing)], unwilling, often to be translated as an adv., unwillingly, unintentionally, in gen. abs., ἄκοντος Κύρου, against the will of Cyrus.

div.head: ἀλαλάζω
div.p: ἀλαλάξομαι, ἠλάλαξα [ἀλαλή, battle cry], chiefly poetic, raise the battle cry. Cp. ἐλελίξω.

div.head: ἀλεεινός
div.p: -ή, -όν, warming. Neut. as subst., source of warmth.

div.head: ἀλέξομαι
div.p:
ἀλέξομαι, ἠλεξάμην, defend oneself; ward off, defend oneself
against, with acc.; requite, return like for like.

div.head: ἀλέτης
div.p: -ου [ἀλέω, grind], grinder, ὄνος ἀλέτης, upper millstone (see ὄνος).

div.head: ἄλευρα
div.p: -ων, τά [ἀλέω, grind], wheaten flour.

div.head: ἀλήθεια
div.p: -ας [ἀληθής], truth, truthfulmess.

div.head: ἀληθεύω
div.p: ἀληθεύσω, etc. [ἀληθής ], tell the truth; with acc., report truthfully.

div.head: ἀληθής
div.p: -ἐς [ἀ-priv. λήθω (=λανθάνω), escape notice] (not concealed), true, truthful. Neut. as subst., τὸ ἀληθές, truthfulness ; ἀληθῆ, the truth.

div.head: ἀληθινός
div.p: -ή, -όν [ἀληθής], real, genuine, worthy of the name.

div.head: ἁλίζω
div.p: ἥλισα, ἡλίσθην, Ionic word, collect, assemble.

div.head: ἁλίσκομαι
div.p: ἁλώσομαι, ἑάλων and ἥλων, ἑάλωκα and ἤλωκα, used as pass. of αἱρέω, be taken, caught, captured.

div.head: ἄλκιμος
div.p: -ον [ἀλκή, strength], chiefly poetic, valiant, brave.

div.head: ἀλλά
div.p: [acc. pl. neut. of ἄλλος, with accent changed; lit., otherwise], adversative conj., stronger than δέ, but, on the other hand, sometimes with a second question, or, 129, 6; introducing an idea opposed to a preceding question, rather, 213, 7; at the beginning of a speech, well, 84, 19; in apodosis, yet, still, 129,14; ἀλλὰ γάρ, but really; ἀλλὰ μήν, in fact, but still; ἀλλ᾽ ἤ except.

div.head: ἄλλῃ
div.p: [ἄλλος], adv., elsewhere, in another place, by another way; ἄλλος ἄλλῃ, one one way, another another.

div.head: ἀλλήλων
div.p: [ἄλλος doubled; bor., Eng. parallel], reciprocal pron., found only in gen., dat., and acc., one another, each other.

div.head: ἄλλοθεν
div.p: [ἄλλος + -θεν, from], adv., from another place; ἄλλοι ἄλλοθεν, some from one point, others from another.

div.head: ἅλλομαι
div.p: ἁλοῦμαι, ἡλάμην and ἡλόμὴν [cogn., Lat. salio, leap, bor., Eng. halma], leap, jump.

div.head: ἄλλος
div.p: -η, -ο [cogn., Lat. alius, other, alter, the other of two, Eng. else ; bor., Eng. allegory, allopathy], other, another, else, Lat. alius; with article, the other, the others, the rest, the rest of, the remaining, Lat. reliquus, τὸ ἄλλο στράτευμα, the rest of the army, τὰ ἄλλα, adverbially, in all other respects ; distributively, ἄλλος ἄλλα, one one thing, another another (cp. Lat. alius ... alius, one... another); ἄλλοι ἄλλως, some in one way, others in another ; in enumerations, bestdes, 76, 23; ἄλλο τι ἤ (= Lat. nonne), is it anything else than? 1s it not true that? εἴ τις καὶ ἄλλος, tf any one, 74, 1. In τῇ ἄλλῃ (sc. ἡμέρᾳ), on the next day, ἄλλος is equiv. to Lat. alter, the other of two.

div.head: ἄλλοτε
div.p: [ἄλλος], adv., af another time, at other times; ἄλλοτε καὶ ἄλλοτε, now and then, from time to time.

div.head: ἀλλότριος
div.p: -α, -ον [ἄλλος], another's, belonging to others, Lat. alienus. ἄλλως [ἄλλος], adv., in another way, otherwise; ἄλλοι ἄλλως, some in one way, others in another; ἄλλως πως, in any other way.

div.head: ἀλόγιστος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., λογίζομαι, consider], inconsiderate, thoughtless, unreasonable.

div.head: ἄλφιτα
div.p: -ων, rd [cogn., Lat. albus, white] (white meal), barley mead,

div.head: ἅμα
div.p: [cogn, Lat. simul, at the same time, Eng. same; bor., Eng. hamadryad, hamamelis], adv., at the same time, at the same time with, together with, abs. or with dat.; ἅμα τῇ ἡμέρᾳ, ἅμα ὄρθρῳ, at daybreak; ἅμα τῇ ἐπιούσῃ ἡμέρᾳ, as the next day was breaking; ἅμα ἡλίῳ ἀνέχοντι or ἀνατέλλοντι, at sunrise, ἅμα ἡλίῳ δύνοντι, at sunset, closely connected with a ptc., which may be translated as a verb, as soon as; ἅμα μὲν... ἅμα δέ, not only... but also.

div.head: Ἀμαζών
div.p: -όνος, ἡ, Amazon, one of a mythical race of women warriors, whose home, at first of indefinite location in the far north or east, was commonly placed in classical times about the Thermodon River on the south shore of the Black Sea (see map, frontispiece). Their exploits, including their assistance to King Priam under their queen Penthesiléa (Virgil, Aeneid 1. 491) in the Trojan War, and their battles with Bellerophon, Hercules, and Theseus, were the subjects of many legends. As types of female strength and beauty they were often represented in painting and sculpture, sometimes with a crescent-shaped shield, helmet, quiver, bow and arrows, and spear or double-edged battle-ax (σάγαρις). The Amazon River in South America received its name from the report of the Spanish discoverers that they found a race of warlike women living there. See Fig. 64, p. 200.

div.head: ἅμαξα
div.p: -ης [ἅμα, ἄξων, axle; cogn., Eng. axle] (vehicle having two axles united), four-wheeled wagon ; wagonload, The ἅμαξα was used for carrying burdens, not for pleasure ; Greek travelers journeyed afoot or on horseback.

div.head: ἁμαξιαῖος
div.p: -α, -ov [ἅμαξα], enough for a wagonload.

div.head: ἁμαξιτός
div.p: -όν [ἅμαξα, εἶμι, go], passable for wagons; ὁδὸς ἁμαξιτός, wagon road.

div.head: ἁμαρτάνω
div.p: ἁμαρτήσομαι, ἥμαρτον, ἡμάρτηκα, ἡμάρτημαι, ἡμαρτήθην, fail to hit, miss, with gen.; of failure in conduct, make a mistake, do wrong, with cogn. acc. and περέ with acc. of person.

div.head: ἀμαχεί
div.p: [ἄμαχος (ἀ-priv., μάχη, battle), without battle], adv., without fighting, without opposition.

div.head: ἀμαχητί
div.p: [ἀμάχητος (a-priv., μάχομαι, fight), not having fought], adv., without fighting.

div.head: ἀμείνων
div.p: -ον,, gen. ἀμείνονος (used as comp. of ἀγαθός), better, braver. Neut. as adv., better.

div.head: ἀμέλεια
div.p: -ᾶς [ἀμελής, careless], carelessness, carelessness in guarding.

div.head: ἀμελέω
div.p: ἀμελήσω, etc. [ἀμελής, careless], be careless, be neglectful of, with gen.

div.head: ἄμετρος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., μέτρον, measure], measureless, countless.

div.head: ἀμήχανος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., μηχανή, machine, contrivance], without means of help, resourceless, helpless; in pass. sense, not to be helped, impracticable, impossible ; πολλὰ καὶ ἀμήχανα, many difficulties.

div.head: ἁμιλλάομαι
div.p: ἁμιλλήσομαι, ἡμίλλημαι, ἡμιλλήθην [ἅμιλλα, contest], compete; with ἐπί or πρός and acc, race for, strive for.

div.head: ἄμπελος
div.p: -ου, ἡ, vine.

div.head: Ἀμπρακιώτης
div.p: -ου, Ambraciot, a citizen of Ambracia in Epirus.

div.head: ἀμυγδάλινος
div.p:
-η, -ον [ἀμυγδάλη,
almond; bor. Eng. almond], of almonds.

div.head: ἀμύνω
div.p: ἀμυνῶ, ἤμυνα [cogn., Lat. minio, fortify], ward off; mid., defend oneself, defend oneself against, with acc.

div.head: ἀμφί
div.p: [cp. ἄμφω; cogn., Lat. ambi-, amb-, as in ambitio, going round (esp. canvassing for votes); bor., Eng. amphibious, amphitheater], prep. with gen. (very rarely) or acc., originally on doth sides, hence about. With gen., of cause, about, concerning. - With acc., of place, time, or occupation with a thing, round, about, on; τὰ ἀμφὶ τάξεις, tactics,; with numerals preceded by the article, about; οἱ ἀμφί with an acc. of a person generally denotes that person and his companions (cp. περί), as οἱ ἀμφὶ Ἀριαῖον, Ariaeus and his followers, but occasionally the context shows that only the companions are meant, as in 88, 1. In cpds., on both sides, round, cp. Eng. words (see above) beginning with amphi-.

div.head: ἀμφιγνοέω
div.p: impf. ἠμφεγνόουν, ἠμφεγνόησα, ἠμφεγνοήθην [ἀμφί, cp. γιγνώσκω, know] (think on both sides), be in doubt.

div.head: Ἀμφίδημος
div.p: -ου, Amphidémus, an Athenian.

div.head: Ἀμφικράτης
div.p: -ους, ὁ, Amphicrates, a captain in the Greek army.

div.head: ἀμφιλέγω
div.p: [ἀμφί, λέγω, say, speak] (speak on both sides), dispute.

div.head: Ἀμφιπολίτης
div.p: -ου, Amphipolitan, a citizen of Amphipolis, a colony of Athens in Eastern Macedonia.

div.head: ἀμφότερος
div.p: -α, -ου [ἄμφω], usually in dual or pl., in pred. position, both. pl. as subst., both parties.

div.head: ἀμφοτέρωθεν
div.p: [ἀμφότερος + -θεν, 7, from], adv., from or on both sides, abs. or with gen.

div.head: ἄμφω
div.p: gen. and dat. ἀμφοῖν [cp. ἀμφί; cogn., Lat. ambo, both, and (with the second syllable) Eng. both], both.

div.head: ἄν
div.p: postpositive adv., having three uses : (1) In conditional, relative, temporal, and sometimes (as in 129, 1) final clauses, with the subj., being closely joined to the introductory word and often combined with it, as in ἐάν, ἐπάν, ἐπειδάν, etc.; it is not translatable. (2) In apodoses and potential clauses, with the impf. or aor. indic., the opt., or an inf. or ptc. representing the indic. or opt.; generally translated by would, should, could, or might, (3) In clauses expressing customary or repeated action, with the impf. or aor. indic.; translated would, see 98, 9.

div.head: ἀνά
div.p: [cogn., Eng. on; bor. Eng. anachronism, analysis, anatomy], prep. with acc., up; up among, 178, 1. Idiomatic uses: ἀνὰ κράτος, at full speed (up to the limit); with numerals, distributively, at the rate of (up to), ἀνὰ ἑκατόν, of a hundred each. In cpds., cp, back, again, cp. Eng. words (see above) beginning with ana-.

div.head: ἀναβαίνω
div.p: [βαίνω, go], go up; march inland; mount a horse.

div.head: ἀναβάλλω
div.p: [βάλλω, throw], throw up; lift up, help to mount.

div.head: ἀνάβασις
div.p:
-εως, ἡ [ἀναβαίνω], a going
up, ascent, journey to the interior, esp. the expedition of Cyrus against Artaxerxes.

div.head: ἀναβιβάζω
div.p: [βμιβάζω, -βιβάσω or βιβῶ, -εβίβασα, causative of βαίνω, used mosily in cpds., cause to go], lead up.

div.head: ἀναγιγνώσκω
div.p: [γιγνώσκω, know], know again, recognise, of written characters, read.

div.head: ἀναγκάζω
div.p: ἀναγκάσω, etc. [ἀνάγκη], force, compel, necessttate.

div.head: ἀναγκαῖος
div.p: -α, -ον [ἀνάγκη], necessary, indispensable, inevitable, ἀναγκαῖόν τι, some necessity, As subst., οἱ ἀναγκαῖοι, relatives, Lat. mecessdrii.

div.head: ἀνάγκη
div.p: -ης, force, necessity; ἀνάγκη (with or without ἐστί), if is necessary, it ts inevitable, abs., with inf., or with inf. and dat. or acc.

div.head: ἀνάγω
div.p: [ἄγω, lead], lead up, take up.

div.head: ἀναζεύγνυμι
div.p: [ζεύγνυμι, yoke], yoke up beasts of burden, used of an army breaking camp.

div.head: ἀναιρέω
div.p: [αἱρέω, take], take up the dead; of a god, take up a matter in which advice is asked, tell, direct.

div.head: ἀνακαίω
div.p: [καίω, set fire to], light up, kindle.

div.head: ἀνακαλέω
div.p: [καλέω, call], call back; mid. with τῇ σάλπιγγι, sound the retreat, Lat. receptui canere.

div.head: ἀνακοινόω
div.p: [κοινόω, κοινώσω, etc. (κοιvos, common), communicate], communicate with, consult; mid., confer with, in both voices with dat. of person.

div.head: ἀνακομίζω
div.p: [κομίζω, carry], carry up, mid., carry up for oneself, store up.

div.head: ἀνακράζω
div.p: [κράζω, fut. pf. κεκράξομαι, ἔκραγον, κέκραγα, scream], raise a shout.

div.head: ἀναλαλάζω
div.p: [ἀλαλάζω], raise the battle cry.

div.head: ἀναλαμβάνω
div.p: [λαμβάνω, dake], cake up, take along, pick up.

div.head: ἀναλίσκω
div.p: ἀναλώσω, ἀνήλωσα, ἀνήλωκα, ἀνήλωμαι, ἀνηλώθην, use up, squander, waste.

div.head: ἀναμείγνυμι
div.p: [μείγνυμι, μείξω, ἔμειξα, μέμειγμαι, ἐμείχθην and ἐμίγην, mix], mix up, pass., mingle.

div.head: ἀναμένω
div.p: [ μένω, remain], wait for.

div.head: ἀναμιμνῄσκω
div.p: [μιμνῄσκω, remind], remind, with two accs.

div.head: ἄνανδρος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., ἀνήρ, man], unmanly, weak, cowardly.

div.head: ἀναξυρίδες
div.p: -ων, αἱ (Persian word), trousers, worn by Persians. See Figs. 1, 3, pp. 13, 20.

div.head: ἀναπαύω
div.p: [παύω, make to cease], make to cease; mid., rest, go to rest. For ἀνά, cp. colloquial ‘rest up.’

div.head: ἀναπείθω
div.p: [πείθω, persuade], persuade, with acc. and obj. inf.

div.head: ἀναπνέω
div.p: [πνέω, blow] (breathe up), catch one’s breath, have breathing space.

div.head: ἀναπτύσσω
div.p: [πτύσσω, πτύξω, ἔπτυξα, ἔπτυγμαι, ἐπτύχθην, fold], unfold, fold back; as a military term, fold back a line of battle, so that it shall stand at right angles to its previous position.

div.head: ἀναρίθμητος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., ἀριθμέω (ἀριθμός, number), count, bor, Eng. arithmetic], countless.

div.head: ἀνάριστος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., ἄριστον, breakfast], without breakfast.

div.head: ἀναρπάζω
div.p: [ ἁρπάζω, seize], snatch up, seize, gain by plunder.

div.head: ἀναρχία
div.p: -ας [ἄναρχος (α-priv., ἀρχή, rule), without a ruler; bor. Eng. anarchy], lack of a ruler, lawlessness.

div.head: ἀνασταυρόω
div.p: [σταυρόω, σταυρώσω, etc. (σταυρός, stake), fence with stakes], fasten up on a stake, impale.

div.head: ἀναστρέφω
div.p: [στρέφω, turn, bor., Eng. anastrophe], turn back or about, intr., turn back, retire, face about, rally; pass., be turned about, face about, rally ; conduct oneself, behave, Lat. versor.

div.head: ἀναταράττω
div.p: [ταράττω, trouble], stir up, pf. pass., be 21 confusion.

div.head: ἀνατείνω
div.p: [τείνω, stretch], stretch up, hold aloft; hold up the hand, the simplest method of voting, used in the Athenian legislature.

div.head: ἀνατέλλω
div.p: [τέλλω, ἔτειλα, -τέταλμαι, make to rise, rise, poetic], rise, of the sun.

div.head: ἀνατίθημι
div.p: [τίθημι, put, bor., Eng. anathema], put upon; mid., put the packs on, of a votive offering, set up, dedicate.

div.head: ἀνατρέφω
div.p: [τρέφω, nourish], fatten. For ἀνά, cp. colloquial ‘fat up.’

div.head: ἀναφρονέω
div.p: [φρονέω, have understanding], come back to one’s senses.

div.head: ἀναχάζω
div.p: [χάζω, make retire, epic], act. as intr., or mid., retreat, draw back.

div.head: ἀναχωρέω
div.p: [χωρέω, give way, retire; bor., Eng. anchoret, anchorite], go back, retire.

div.head: ἀνδράποδον
div.p: -ου [ἀνήρ, πούς, foot], a captive in war serving as a slave, captive, slave.

div.head: ἀνδρίζω
div.p: ἀνδρίσω [ἀνήρ], make α man of; mid. play the man, act bravely.

div.head: ἀνεγείρω
div.p: [ἐγείρω, wake, rouse], rouse up, wake up, pass., wake up, awake.

div.head: ἀνεῖπον
div.p: [εἶπον, tell], aor. (speak up), proclaim, announce.

div.head: ἄνεμος
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. anima, breath, animus, soul; bor., Eng. anemograph, anemometer, anemone], wind.

div.head: ἀνερωτάω
div.p: [ἐρωτάω, ask], ask, inquire.

div.head: ἄνευ
div.p: [akin to ἀ-priv.], improper prep. with gen., without.

div.head: ἀνέχω
div.p: [ἔχω, have, hold], double augment in impf. and aor. mid. (see 94, 7), hold up, intr., rise, of the sun ; mid., hold oneself up, hold out, control oneself, endure, stand, tolerate.

div.head: ἀνήκεστος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., ἀκέομαι, cure, bor., Eng. panacea], incurable, irreparable.

div.head: ἀνήρ
div.p: ἀνδρός, ὁ [bor., Eng. Andrew, polyandry], man as opposed to woman or child, Lat. vir , usually a more respectful appellation than ἄνθρωπος, which = man as a human being, opposed to a god or a beast, cp. 83, 23, with 22, and with 84,1; husband, 206, 22. Pl. used frequently like Eng. men = soldiers ; sometimes of the enemy, as in 145, 2. In formal address, ὦ ἄνδρες or simply ἄνδρες, gentle:nen; ἄνδρες Ἕλληνες, men of Greece; ἄνδρες στρατιῶται, fellow-soldiers ; ὦ ἄνδρες στρατηγοί, fellow-generals, but merely generals, 147, 2; ἄνδρες φίλοι, friends, my friends. Sometimes, esp. with adjs. of nationality, ἀνήρ is best omitted in translation, as in 62, 4.

div.head: ἀνθρώπινος
div.p: -η, -ον [ἄνθρωπος], human. Neut. pl. as subst., human things, human agenctes.

div.head: ἄνθρωπος
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. anthropoid, anthropology, philanhropy], man, human being, Lat. homo, Sometimes less respectful than ἀνήρ, cp. 83, 23, with 22, and with 84, 1; below, 145, 20. Occasionally, like ἀνήρ, of soldiers or of the enemy. Collectively, ἄνθρωποι, man, mankind.

div.head: ἀνιάω
div.p: ἀνιάσω, ἠνίασα, ἡνιάθην [ἀνία, trouble], annoy, trouble, pass., and fut. mid. as pass., be troubled, be dtstressed, be hurt.

div.head: ἀνιμάω
div.p: impf. ἀνίμων [ἱμάς, strap], plentiful up with a strap, pull up.

div.head: ἀνίστημι
div.p: [ἴστημι, cause to stand], make rise, start up birds; intr., in pres., impf., and fut. mid., 2 aor., and pf. act., rise, stand up, get up; recover from sickness.

div.head: ἄνοδος
div.p: -ου, ἡ [ὁδός, way], way up, journey to the interior ; see ἀνάβασις.

div.head: ἄνοδος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., ὁδός, way], impassable.

div.head: ἀνόητος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., νοέω, Perceive], senseless, foolish.

div.head: ἀνταγοράζω
div.p: [ἀγοράζω, buy], buy in exchange.

div.head: ἀντακούω
div.p: [ἀκούω, hear], listen in turn, hear a reply, ἀντεμπίμπλημι [ἐμπίμπλημι, fill full], fill full as compensation.

div.head: ἀντεπιμελέομαι
div.p: [ἐπιμελέομαι, take care], take care in return, take counter-precautions.

div.head: ἀντί
div.p: by elision and euphony ἀντ᾽ or ἀνθ᾽ [cogn., Lat. ante, defore ; bor., Eng. antifat, antislavery], prep. with gen., facing, opposite to, over Idiomatic uses: instead of, in place of; to serve as, for, in return for; αἱρεῖσθαι... ἀντί, prefer one thing to another ; ἀνθ᾽ ὧν ἑστηκότες, standing behind (and facing) which, 215, 26. In cpds., instead, in return, against; cp. Eng. words beginning with anti-, as anticlimax, antipathy, antipodes, Antichrist, also see above.

div.head: ἀντιδίδωμι
div.p: [δίδωμι, give, bor., Eng. antidote], give instead or in exchange.

div.head: ἀντικαθίστημι
div.p: [καθίστημι, establish, appoint], appoint instead.

div.head: ἀντιλέγω
div.p: [λέγω, say], say or speak in opposition, object, with dat. of the person, and ὡς, or μή and inf., of the objection.

div.head: ἀντίος
div.p: -α, -ov [ἀντί], poetic = ἐναντίος, often in the pred., where Eng. requires an adv., face to face, opposite; ἀντίοι ἰέναι, go fo meet, advance against, with dat. As subst., οἱ ἀντίοι, the adversaries; ἐκ τοῦ ἀντίου, from the opposite side.

div.head: ἀντιπαραθέω
div.p: [παραθέω, to run by], run along the line to oppose an enemy.

div.head: ἀντιπαρασκευάζομαι
div.p: [παρασκευάζω, prepare], make preparations in turn.

div.head: ἀντιπαρατάττομαι
div.p: [παρατάττω, draw up in battle array], draw up against.

div.head: ἀντιπάρειμι
div.p: [πάρειμι, go by], march along opposite on the other side of a river.

div.head: ἀντιπάσχω
div.p: [πάσχω, suffer], suffer in return.

div.head: ἀντιπέραν
div.p: or ἀντιπέρας [πέραν, on the other side], adv., over against, opposite, preceded by κατά and followed by the gen.

div.head: ἀντιποιέω
div.p:
[ποιέω, do], do in return,
retaliate; mid., contend with one (dat.) for, be rivals in, with gen.

div.head: ἀντίπορος
div.p: -ον [πόρος, way] (on the opposite way), opposite, with dat. ; poetic, cp. ἀντίος.

div.head: ἀντιστασιάζω
div.p: [στασιάζω, form a faction], form a faction against, vie with.

div.head: ἀντιστασιώτης
div.p: -οὐ [ἀντιστασιάζω], polttical opponent.

div.head: ἀντιτάττω
div.p: [τάττω, draw up], array against, match against; mid. or pass., array oneself against.

div.head: ἀντιτοξεύω
div.p: [τοξεύω, shoot with a bow], shoot back.

div.head: ἀντιφυλάττω
div.p: [φυλάττω, guard], guard in turn, mid., be on one’s guard in turn.

div.head: ἄντρον
div.p: -ου [bor., Lat. antrum, cave], cave.

div.head: ἀντρώδης
div.p: -ες [ἄντρον, εἶδος, form], cave-like.

div.head: ἀνυστός
div.p: -ή, -όν (verbal of ἁνύω, accomplish), that can be accomplished, practicable; σιγῇ ὡς ἁνυστόν, as silently as possible.

div.head: ἄνω
div.p: [ἀνά, up], adv., up, upward, inland; above, abs. or with gen. ; comp. ἀνωτέρω, with gen., higher than. Attributively, ἡ ἄνω ὁδός, the journey inland, οἱ ἄνω πολέμιοι, the enemy above ; τὸ ἄνω, the division above, τὰ ἄνω, the heights.

div.head: ἄνωθεν
div.p: [ἄνω], adv., from above.

div.head: ἀξίνη
div.p: -ης [cogn., Eng. ax], ax.

div.head: ἄξιος
div.p: -α, -ον [ἄγω in meaning of weigh] (weighing as much as, worth), worthy, fitting, seemly; worthy of, with gen.; πολλοῦ ἄξιος, worth much, very valuable ; πλείονος

div.head: ἄξιος
div.p: more valuable ; πλείστου ἄξιος, most valuable, most effictent.

div.head: ἀξιοστράτηγος
div.p: -ον [ἄξιος, στρατηγός, general], worthy of being general.

div.head: ἀξιόω
div.p: ἀξιώσω, etc. [ἄξιος, bor., Eng. axiom], think worthy, with gen. ; think fitting or proper ; demand (as a right), expect, ask, pass., be thought worthy, with inf.

div.head: ἄξων
div.p: -ονος, ὁ [cogn., Eng. axle], axe. Cp. ἅμαξα.

div.head: ἀπαγγέλλω
div.p: [ἀγγέλλω, announce], bring back tidings, report, give an answer or decision.

div.head: ἀπαγορεύω
div.p: [ἀγορεύω, speak], only in pres. and impf., ἀπεῖπον and ἀπείρηκα supplying the aor. and pf., forbid, intr., renounce, give up; give out, become exhausted, tire, pf. be tired.

div.head: ἀπάγω
div.p: [ἄγω, lead], lead back, lead home ; intr., march back.

div.head: ἀπαίδευτος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., παιδεύω, educate], uneducated, untrained.

div.head: ἀπαιτέω
div.p: [αἰτέω, ask], ask from, ask back, ask what is due (cp. ἀποδίδωμι), demand, with acc. of thing, or two accs. of person and thing.

div.head: ἀπαλλάττω
div.p: [ἀλλάττω, ἀλλάξω, ἤλλαξα, -ήλλαχα, ἤλλαγμαι, ἠλλάχθην and ἠλλάγην, change], abandon; pass., be freed from, be rid of ; come off, withdraw.

div.head: ἁπαλός
div.p: -ή, -όν, tender, delicate.

div.head: ἀπαμείβομαι
div.p: [ἀμείβω, ἀμείψω, ἤμειψα, -ημείφθην, change, exchange, poetic], poetic, reply, answer.

div.head: ἀπαντάω
div.p: ἀπαντήσομαι, ἀπήντησα, ἀπήντηκα [ἀντάω, meet, poetic], meet, encounter, with dat.

div.head: ἅπαξ
div.p: numeral adv., once.

div.head: ἀπαρασκεύαστος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., παρα

div.head: σκευάζω
div.p: prepare], unprepared.

div.head: ἀπαράσκευος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., παρασκευή, preparation ], unprepared.

div.head: ἅπας
div.p: ἅπασα, ἅπαν [ἁ-copulative +

div.head: πᾶς
div.p:
all], in pred. position when used with the article, all together,
all, whole: πεδίον ἅπαν, an unbroken plain.

div.head: ἀπειθέω
div.p: ἀπειθήσω [ἀπειθής (ἀ-priv., πείθομαι, obey), disobedient ], be disobedient, be insubordinate. Cp. ἀπιστέω.

div.head: ἄπειμι
div.p: [εἰμί, be], be absent, be away.

div.head: ἄπειμι
div.p: [εἶμι, go], for pres. with fut. meaning, see εἶμι; go away, depart, go back, go back home, retreat, go over, desert.

div.head: ἄπειρος
div.p: -ον [ἀ- priv., πεῖρα, trial], without experience, abs, or with gen.

div.head: ἀπελαύνω
div.p: [ἐλαύνω, drive], drive off, expel; intr., march off, ride away, ride back.

div.head: ἀπέρχομαι
div.p: [ἔρχομαι, come, go], go away, go back; go over, desert.

div.head: ἄπειμι
div.p: serves as the fut.

div.head: ἀπεχθάνομαι
div.p: ἀπεχθήσομαι, ἀπηχθόμην, ἀπήχθημαι [ἔχθω, hate], incur one’s hatred, offend, with dat.

div.head: ἀπέχω
div.p: [ἔχω, hold], hold off; intr., be away, be distant; mid., keep one’s hands off, with gen.

div.head: ἀπιστέω
div.p: ἀπιστήσω [ἄπιστος], distrust; disobey; in both meanings with dat. Cp. ἀπειθέω.

div.head: ἀπιστία
div.p: -ας [ἄπιστος], distrust, faithlessness, treachery.

div.head: ἄπιστος
div.p: -ον [ἀ- priv., πιστός, faithful], faithless, untrustworthy.

div.head: ἄπλετος
div.p: -ον [ἀ- priv., πίμπλημι, fill] (not to be filled), immense; χιὼν

div.head: ἄπλετος
div.p: an immense amount of snow.

div.head: ἁπλοῦς
div.p: -ῆ, -οῦν, contracted from ἁπλόος, -η, -ον, simple, straightforward, frank, Neut. as subst., straightforwardness, sincerity.

div.head: ἀπό
div.p: by elision and euphony ἀπ᾽ or ἀφ᾽ [cogn., Lat. ab, eway from, Eng. off, of; bor., Eng. apology, apothecary ], prep. with gen., from, away from, off, Lat. ab (cp. with ἐκ in 78, 20f.). Idiomatic uses: of means, regarded as source, at, with, by means of; ἀπὸ ἵππου, on horseback (indicating that weapons were thrown from the horse); ἀπὸ τούτου, from this time on, 134, 273 ἀφ᾽ οὗ, since, 153, 2. In cpds., from, away, off, back, sometimes equiv. to a neg. or to an intensive; cp. Eng. words beginning with apo-, as apocalypse, apocrypha, apodosis, apogee, apostle, also see above.

div.head: ἀποβάλλω
div.p: [βάλλω, throw], throw away, lose.

div.head: ἀποβιβάζω
div.p: [βιβάζω, -βιβάσω or -βιβῶ, -εβίβασα, causative βαίνω, used mostly in cpds., cause to go] (cause to go off), disembark, put on shore.

div.head: ἀποβλέπω
div.p: [βλέπω, look], look off or away towards something, with εἰς and acc.

div.head: ἀπογιγνώσκω
div.p: [γιγνώσκω, show, think], give up the thought or idea of, with gen.

div.head: ἀποδείκνυμι
div.p: [δείκνυμι, show], point out, show, direct, with inf.; appoint, with two accs.

div.head: ἀποδέρω
div.p:
[δέρω, δερῶ, ἔδειρα, δέδαρμαι,
ἐδάρην, flay, cogn., Eng. tear], take the skin off, flay. Cp. ἐκδέρω.

div.head: ἀποδιδράσκω
div.p: [-διδράσκω, -δράσομαι, -έδραν, -δεδρᾶκα, run], run away to parts unknown, escape by stealth. Cp. ἀποφεύγω.

div.head: ἀποδίδωμι
div.p: [δίδωμι, give], give back, pay what is due (cp. ἀποθύω); pay or give what has been promised ; χάριν ἀποδιδόναι, return a favor.

div.head: ἀποδοκεῖ
div.p: [ δοκεῖ, it seems best], impers., not seem best, seem best not to. For ἀπό, cp. ἀποψηφίζομαι.

div.head: ἀποδύω
div.p: [δύω, enter, (of clothes) put on ], strip off from another ; mid. and 2 aor. act., strip oneself. Cp. ἐκδύω. ἀποθνησκω [θνῄσκω, die], die off, die ; often used as pass. of ἀποκτείνω, be put to death, be killed, fall in battle ; οἱ ἀποθανόντες, the dead.

div.head: ἀποθύω
div.p: [θύω, sacrifice], sacrifice what is due (cp. ἀποδίδωμι), pay a vow.

div.head: ἀποικία
div.p: -ας [ἄποικος (οἶκος, home), away from home], colony.

div.head: ἀποκαίω
div.p: [καίω, burn], burn off; of severe cold, freeze off, blast, Lat. urd, burn, is also used of cold; cp. Eng. ‘stinging cold.’ A piece of ice and a hot coal cause similar sensations for a moment.

div.head: ἀποκάμνω
div.p: [κάμνω, be tired], grow tired.

div.head: ἀπόκειμαι
div.p: [κεῖμαι, be laid], be laid away, be stored up, used as pass. of ἀποτίθημι.

div.head: ἀποκλείω
div.p: [κλείω, κλείσω, ἔκλεισα, κέκλεικα, κέκλειμαι, ἐκλείσθην, shut], shut off, cut off.

div.head: ἀποκλίνω
div.p: [κλίνω, κλινῶ, ἔκλινα, κέκλιμαι, ἐκλίθην and -εκλίνην, bend. cogn., Lat. inclino, bend, Eng. lean; bor., Eng. clime, clinic, enclitic], intr., turn aside.

div.head: ἀποκόπτω
div.p: [κόπτω, cut; bor., Eng. apocope ], cut off; beat off. ἀποκρίνομαι [κρίνω, divide, decide] (give a decision), answer, reply.

div.head: ἀποκρύπτω
div.p: [κρύπτω, conceal, bor., Eng. apocrypha], hide away, conceal, mid., hide away for oneself.

div.head: ἀποκτείνω
div.p: [κτείνω, kill], kill off, kill, put to death. The pass. is supplied by ἀποθνῄσκω.

div.head: ἀποκωλύω
div.p: [κωλύω, hinder], hinder from, prevent from.

div.head: ἀπολαμβάνω
div.p: [λαμβάνω, take], take back, receive back, esp. what is one’s own or one’s due (cp. ἀποδίδωμι) ; cut off.

div.head: ἀπολείπω
div.p: [λείπω, leave], leave behind, abandon, desert, pass. be left behind, fall behind.

div.head: ἀπόλεκτος
div.p: -ον [ἀπολέγω, pick our], picked, selected, chotce.

div.head: ἀπόλλυμι
div.p: [ὄλλυμι, ὀλῶ, ὥλεσα, ὠλόμην, ὀλώλεκα, ὄλωλα, destroy, poetic ; bor., Eng. Apollyon], destroy utlerly, put to death, lose ; mid., with 2 pf. and pipf. act., perish, be destroyed, be lost.

div.head: Ἀπόλλων
div.p: -ωνος, acc. Ἀπόλλωνα and Ἀπόλλω, ὁ, Apollo, twin brother of Artémis; the god of poetry, music (in which he defeated the Phrygian satyr Marsyas), prophecy, etc.

div.head: Ἀπολλωνίδης
div.p: -ου, Apollonides, a captain in the Greek army, expelled as an impostor and coward.

div.head: ἀπόμαχος
div.p: -ον [μάχη, battle], away from battle. Masc. as subst., non-combatant,

div.head: ἀπονοστέω
div.p: [νοστέω (νόστος, a return home), return home], return home.

div.head: ἀποπέμπω
div.p: [πέμπω, send], send away, send back ; so also mid., of sending from one’s presence ; of money, send what is due (cp. ἀποδίδωμι), remit.

div.head: ἀποπηδάω
div.p: [πηδάω, πηδήσομαι, ἐπήδησα, -πεπήδηκα, leap, spring], spring away.

div.head: ἀποπλέω
div.p: [πλέω, sail], sail away, sail home.

div.head: ἀπορέω
div.p: ἀπορήσω, etc. [ἄπορος], be without ways and means, be in want of, be at a loss for, lack, with gen. ; be perplexed, abs. or with dat.

div.head: ἀπορία
div.p: -ας [ἄπορος], lack of ways and means, want, scarcity; difficulty, impracticability, perplexity, embarrassment.

div.head: ἄπορος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., πόρος, way], without ways and means, destitute of resources, helpless; impassable ; impracticable, Neut. as subst., obstacle.

div.head: ἀπόρρητος
div.p: -ον [ῥητός (verbal of εἴρω, say), may be spoken], not to be spoken, secret.

div.head: ἀποσήπω
div.p: [σήπω, σήψω, σέσηπα, ἐσάπην, make rot, bor., Eng. antiseptic], make rot off; pass. and 2 pf. act., rot off, mortify,; οἱ τοὺς δακτύλους τῶν ποδῶν ἀποσεσηπότες, those who had had their toes mortify, 204, 11.

div.head: ἀποσκάπτω
div.p: [σκάπτω, σκάψω, ἔσκαψα, ἔσκαφα, ἔσκαμμαι, ἐσκάφην, die], cut off by a trench. ἀποσικεδάννυμι [σκεδάννυμι, scatter], scatter in different directions , mid. and pass., stray, straggle.

div.head: ἀποσκηνόω
div.p: [σκηνόω, encamp], encamp away from, with gen.

div.head: ἀποσπάω
div.p: [σπάω, draw], draw away, withdraw , intr., get away, with gen.

div.head: ἀποστέλλω
div.p: [στέλλω, send; bor., Eng. apostle], send away, send back.

div.head: ἀποστρατοπεδεύομαι
div.p: [στρατοπεδεύω, encamp], encamp away from, with gen.

div.head: ἀποστρέφω
div.p: [στρέφω, turn], turn back, recall, turn round.

div.head: ἀποστροφή
div.p: -ῆς [ἀποστρέφω ; bor., Eng, apostrophe], a terning back; place of refuge.

div.head: ἀποσυλάω
div.p: [συλάω, συλήσω, etc., strip], strip, rob one of something, with two accs.

div.head: ἀποσῴζω
div.p: [σῴζω, save], take back safely.

div.head: ἀποτείνω
div.p: [τείνω, stretch], extend; pass., stretch out, project.

div.head: ἀποτειχίζω
div.p: [τειχίζω (τεῖχος, wall), wall, fortify], wall off.

div.head: ἀποτέμνω
div.p: [τέμνω, τεμῶ, ἔτεμον and ἔταμον, τέτμηκα, τέτμημαι, ἐτμήθην, cut; bor, Eng. anatomy, atom, epitome ], cut off; οτέμνεσθαι τὴν κεφαλήν, be beheaded; of military movements, cut off.

div.head: ἀποτίθημι
div.p: [τίθημι, put,; bor., Eng. apothecary], put away, store up.

div.head: ἀποτίνω
div.p: [τίνω, τείσω, ἔτεισα, τέτεικα, τέτεισμαι, ἐτείσθην, pay], pay back, pay what is due (cp. ἀποδίδωμι) ; mid., require payment of one, requite.

div.head: ἀπότομος
div.p: -ον [ἀποτέμνω] (cut off), steep, precipitous.

div.head: ἀποτρέπω
div.p: [τρέπω, turn], turn off; intr. in the mid.

div.head: ἀποφαίνω
div.p: [φαίνω, show], show forth ; mid., declare.

div.head: ἀποφεύγω
div.p:
[φεύγω, flee], flee away out
of reach, escape, abs. or with acc. Cp. ἀποδιδράσκω.

div.head: ἀπόφραξις
div.p: -εως, ἡ [ἀποφράττω, fence off, block up], blockade.

div.head: ἀποχωρέω
div.p: [χωρέω, give way], go away or back, withdraw, retreat.

div.head: ἀποψηφίζομαι
div.p: [ψηφίζομαι, vote], reject a proposal, vote no. For ἀπό, cp. ἀποδοκεῖ.

div.head: ἀπροσδόκητος
div.p: -ον [ἀ- priv., προσδοκάω, expect], unexpected; ἐξ ἀπροσδοκήτου, unexpectedly, Lat. ex improviso. ἀπροφασίστως [ἀπροφάσιστος (ἀ-priv., προφασίζομαι, give excuses), not making excuses], adv., without excuses, without hesitation.

div.head: ἅπτω
div.p: ἅψω, ἥψα, ἥμμαι, ἤφθην, fasten ; mid., cling to, touch, with gen.

div.head: ἄρα
div.p: post-positive inferential adv., then, in that case, it seems, as it proves or proved; with el, really, after all.

div.head: ἆρα
div.p: [ἦ, really, + ἄρα], interrogative adv., really, certainly ; ἆρα πὐ expects the answer yes, Lat. nonne.

div.head: Ἀραβία
div.p: -ας, Arabia, including modern Arabia and also certain districts to the northward, extending into Mesopotamia.

div.head: Ἀράξης
div.p: -ου, Araxes, a tributary of the Euphrates.

div.head: Ἀρβάκης
div.p: -ου, Arbaces, one of the four generals of Artaxerxes.

div.head: Ἀργεῖος
div.p: -ου, Avgive, a native of Argos, an important city in the Peloponnésus.

div.head: ἀργός
div.p: -όν [ἀ-priv., ἔργον, work ], without work, in idleness.

div.head: ἀργύριον
div.p: -ου [diminutive of ἄργυρος, silver], silver ; coined silver, money.

div.head: ἀργυρόπους
div.p: gen. -ποδος [ἄργυρος, silver, πούς, foot], adj., silver-footed.

div.head: ἀργυροῦς
div.p: -ᾶ, -οῦν, contracted from ἀργύρεος, -α, -ov [ἄργυρος, silver], of stlver, silver.

div.head: ἄρδω
div.p: only pres. and impf. in Attic prose, water, irrigate.

div.head: ἀρέσκω
div.p: ἀρέσω, ἤρεσα, please, with dat.

div.head: ἀρετή
div.p: -ῆς, excellence, valor, Lat. virtus. magnanimity , good service.

div.head: ἀρήγω
div.p: ἀρήξω, chiefly poetic, help, bring aid.

div.head: Ἀριαῖος
div.p: -ου, Ariaeus, commander of the barbarian force of Cyrus.

div.head: ἀριθμός
div.p: -οῦ [bor., Eng. arithmetic], number, numbering, enumeration.

div.head: ἀριστάω
div.p: ἀριστήσω, εἰς. [ἄριστον], take breakfast, breakfast.

div.head: Ἀριστέας
div.p: -ου, Aristéas, an officer in the Greek army.

div.head: ἀριστερός
div.p: -ά, -όν, left, Lat. sinister ;

div.head: ἐν
div.p: ἀριστερᾷ (sc. χειρί) or ἐξ ἀριστερᾶς (sc. χειρός), on the left. Cp. εὐώνυμος

div.head: Ἀρίστιππος.
div.p: -ου, Aristippus, a Thessalian noble, friend of Cyrus.

div.head: ἄριστον
div.p: -ου [ἦρι early], breakfast, eaten in Xenophon’s time about eleven o’clock in the forenoon; in earlier times it was taken upon rising; ἐκ τοῦ ἀρίστου, after breakfast. See Introd. § 64.

div.head: ἀριστοποιέομαι
div.p: [ἄριστον, ποιέω, make], get breakfast for oneself.

div.head: ἄριστος
div.p: -η, -ον [bor., Eng. aristocrat] (used as sup. of ἀγαθός), best, bravest, noblest, most advantageous, excellent. Neut. acc. pl. as adv., best, most successfully.

div.head: Ἀριστώνυμος
div.p: -ου, Aristonimus, a captain in the Greek army.

div.head: Ἀρκαδικός
div.p: -ή, -όν [Ἀρκάς], Arcadian. Neut. as subst., the Arcadian division.

div.head: Ἀρκάς
div.p:
-άδος, ὁ, Arcadian, a native of Arcadia, an inland state of the Peloponnésus, famous for the ruggedness
of the country and the simplicity and bravery of its inhabitants.

div.head: ἀρκέω
div.p: ἀρκέσω, ἤρκεσα [cogn., Lat. arceo, keep off], ward off (cp. Eng. ‘be enough for’ anybody); is enough, suffice.

div.head: ἄρκτος
div.p: -ου, ἡ [bor., Eng. Arctic, Antarctic], bear; the Great Bear, the north.

div.head: ἅρμα
div.p: -ατος, τό, chariot, esp. war chariot. See Figs. 28, 33, pp. 87, 92.

div.head: ἁρμάμαξα
div.p: -ης [ἅρμα, ἅμαξα, wagon], covered or closed carriage, used principally by women in Asia Minor. See Fig. 17, p. 61.

div.head: Ἀρμενία
div.p: -ας, Armenia, a mountainous country along the upper Tigris and Euphrates, containing the mountains of Ararat, on which Noah’s Ark is said to have rested. The mode of living there has changed but little since Xenophon’s time.

div.head: Ἀρμένιος
div.p: -α, -ον, Armenian. Masc. as subst., Armenian.

div.head: ἄρνειος
div.p: -α, -ον [gen. ἀρνός (no nom. is known), of a lamb], of lamb; κρέα ἄρνεια, lambs’ flesh, lamd.

div.head: ἁρπαγή
div.p: -ῆς [ἅρπαξ, rapacious; cp. ἁρπάζω], seizing, plundering; καθ᾽ ἁρπαγήν, for plundering.

div.head: ἁρπάζω
div.p: ἁρπάσω and ἁρπάσομαι, ἥρπασα, ἥρπακα, ἥρπασμαι, ἡρπάσθην [cogn., Lat. rapid, seize, Eng. bereave, rob; bor. Eng. harpy, harpoon], snatch, seize, carry off, plunder ; capture a hill; of a river, sweep away.

div.head: Ἅρπασος
div.p: -ου, Harpasus, a river of northeastern Asia Minor, the exact location of which is uncertain.

div.head: Ἀρταγέρσης
div.p: -ου, Artagerses, commander of the cavalry which composed the bodyguard of Artaxerxes at Cunaxa.

div.head: Ἀρταξέρξης
div.p: -ου, Artaxerxes, the name of several Persian monarchs ; in the Anabasis always Artaxerxes II, son of Darius II, and elder brother of Cyrus the younger. See Introd. § 1 ff.

div.head: Ἀρτάοζος
div.p: -ου, Artaozus, a trusted friend of Cyrus, who transferred his allegiance to the king after the battle of Cunaxa.

div.head: Ἀρταπάτης
div.p: -ου, Artapates, a trusty noble of Cyrus, who died on the latter’s body at Cunaxa.

div.head: ἀρτάω
div.p: ἀρτήσω, etc., fasten fo.

div.head: Ἄρτεμις
div.p: -ίδος, ἡ, Artémis, identified with the Roman Diana, twin sister of Apollo, goddess especially of hunting and the moon. An Asiatic deity, identified with her, had a noted temple at Ephésus. See Acts 19. 27 f.

div.head: ἄρτι
div.p: adv., just, just then.

div.head: ἀρτοκόπος
div.p: -ου [ἄρτος], baker.

div.head: ἄρτος
div.p: -ου, loaf of bread. See Fig. 36, p. 99.

div.head: Ἀρτούχας
div.p: -α (Doric gen.), Artuchas, an officer of the Persian king.

div.head: Ἀρχαγόρας
div.p: -α (Doric gen.) or ου, Archagoras, a captain in the Greek army.

div.head: ἀρχαῖος
div.p: -α, -ον [ἀρχή; bor., Eng. archaic, archaeology], from the beginning, ancient, old; Κῦρος ὁ ἀρχαῖος, Cyrus the elder (Cyrus the Great). Neut. acc. as adv., τὸ ἀρχαῖον, formerly.

div.head: ἀρχή
div.p: -ῆς [ἄρχω], beginning, first place, sovereignty; realm, province.

div.head: ἀρχηγός
div.p: -οῦ [ἀρχή, ἄγω, lead], leader.

div.head: ἀρχικός
div.p: -ή, -όν [ἀρχή], fit fo command.

div.head: ἄρχω
div.p:
ἄρξω, ἦρξα, ἦργμαι, ἤρχθην [bor., Eng. archbishop, monarch ], act., be first, rule, command, abs. or with gen.; act. and mid., begin, abs. or
with gen. ; pass., be ruled, submit to rule, obey orders; πρὸς ἄλλον ἀρξομένους (mid. as pass.) ἀπιέναι, go away into another's service, Ptc. as subst., ἄρχων, ruler, commander, governor ; ὁ ἄρξας, the former ruler; οἱ ἀρχόμενοι, those under command.

div.head: ἄρωμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [bor., Eng. aroma], spice, fragrant herb.

div.head: ἀσέβεια
div.p: -ἂς [ἀσεβής], impiety.

div.head: ἀσεβής
div.p: -ἐς [ἀ-priv., σέβομαι, worship; cogn., Lat. severus, stern, severe], impious, ungodly.

div.head: ἀσθενέω
div.p: ἀσθενήσω, ἠσθένησα [ἀσθενής, bor., Eng. neurasthenia], be weak, be ill or sick.

div.head: ἀσθενής
div.p: -ἐς [ἀ-priv., c0évos, strength], without strength, weak.

div.head: ἀσινῶς
div.p: [ἀσινής (ἀ-priv., σίνομαι, harm), doing no harm], adv., without doing harm, ὡς ἂν δυνώμεθα ἀσινέστατα, doing as little harm as possible.

div.head: ἄσιτος
div.p: -ον [σῖτος, food], without food.

div.head: ἀσκέω
div.p: ἀσκήσω, etc. [bor., Eng. ascetic], practice.

div.head: ἀσκός
div.p: -οῦ, skin bag, used for wine, or, when inflated, as a float. See Figs. 25, 42, pp. 78, 125.

div.head: ἄσμενος
div.p: -ἡ, -ον, glad, pleased; always with a verb, and to be translated as an adv., gladly, with pleasure.

div.head: Ἀσπένδιος
div.p: -ου, Aspendian, an inhabitant of Aspendus, a Greek colony in Pamphylia.

div.head: ἀσπίς
div.p: -ίδος, ἡ, shield, properly the round shield of the hoplite, but also used for shields of other shapes ; ἀσπὶς μυρία, 10,000 shield (= hoplites), 85, 15; παρ᾽ ἀσπίδα, to the left, since the shield was carried on the left arm. See Introd. § 58, and Figs. 11, 16, 57, pp. 55, 61, 174. Cp. γέρρον, πέλτη.

div.head: ἀσταφίς
div.p: -ίδος, ἡ, dried grape, raisin.

div.head: ἀστράπτω
div.p: aor. ἤστραψα, flash, gleam.

div.head: ἀσφαλής
div.p: -ές, comp. ἀσφαλέστερος, sup. ἀσφαλέστατος [ἀ- priv., σφάλλω, trip up], not apt to be tripped, secure, safe; ἐν τῷ ἀσφαλεῖ, in a safe place;

div.head: ἐν
div.p: ἀσφαλεστέρῳ, in greater security ;

div.head: ἐν
div.p: ἀσφαλεστάτῳ, in the greatest security.

div.head: ἄσφαλτος
div.p: -ου, ἡ [bor., Eng. asphalt], asphalt, bitumen.

div.head: ἀσφαλῶς
div.p: sup. ἀσφαλέστατα [ἀσφαλής], adv., safely, in security.

div.head: ἄτακτος
div.p: -ον [ἀ- priv., τάττω, arrange, draw up], not in battle order, in disorder.

div.head: ἀταξία
div.p: -ᾶς [ἄτακτος; bor., Eng. ataxia], disorder, lack of discipline.

div.head: ἀτάρ
div.p: adversative conj., stronger than δέ, but weaker than ἀλλά, chiefly poetic, but, yet.

div.head: ἀτασθαλία
div.p: -ᾶς, chiefly poetic, reckless folly, wantonness.

div.head: ἅτε
div.p: [acc. pl. neut. of ὅστε, who], adv., inasmuch as, generally used with a causal ptc. to state the cause as a fact on the authority of the writer or speaker. Cp. ὡς.

div.head: ἀτέλεια
div.p: -ας [ἀτελής (ἀ- priv., τέλος, tax), exempt from tax], exemption, first from taxation, then from any duty or service.

div.head: ἀτιμάζω
div.p: ἀτιμάσω, etc. [ἄτιμος (ἀ-priv., τιμή, honour.), without honour], dishonor, disgrace.

div.head: ἀτμίζω
div.p: ἀτμίσω [ἄτμος, steam], steam.

div.head: ἀτριβής
div.p: -ἐς [ἀ- priv., τριβή, rubbing] (not rubbed), unused, untrodden.

div.head: Ἀττικός
div.p: -ή, -όν, of Attica, Attic, Athenian.

div.head: αὖ
div.p:
postpositive adv., again, adversative, sometimes preceded by δέ, on the other hand, in turn, for his
(our, etc.) part, furthermore, besides, moreover.

div.head: αὐαίνω
div.p: αὐανῶ, ηὔηνα, ηὐάνθην [αὖος, dry], dry, pass., dry up, wither.

div.head: αὐθημερόν
div.p: [acc. neut., with changed accent, of αὐθήμερος (αὐτός, ἡμέρα, day), done on the very day], adv., on the same day.

div.head: αὖθις
div.p: [αὖ], adv., again, a second time, in the second place, in turn.

div.head: αὐλίζομαι
div.p: ηὐλισάμην and (always in Xenophon) ηὐλίσθην [ αὐλή, court open to the air], lie tn the open air, bivouac, pass the night.

div.head: αὐλών
div.p: -ῶνος, ὁ, canal.

div.head: αὔριον
div.p: adv., to-morrow.

div.head: αὐτίκα
div.p: [αὐτός], adv. (at the very moment), at once, immediately ; αὐτίκα μάλα, instantly.

div.head: αὐτόθεν
div.p: [αὐτός + -θεν, from]; adv. (from the very place), from there, thence.

div.head: αὐτόθι
div.p: [αὐτός + -θι, at], adv. (at the very place), there.

div.head: αὐτοκέλευστος
div.p: -ον [αὐτός, κελεύω, order], self-bidden, of one’s own accord.

div.head: αὐτόματος
div.p: -η, -ον [αὐτός ; bor., Eng. automaton], self-impelled, of one’s own accord, ard or ἐκ τοῦ αὐτομάτου, voluntarily, of one’s own accord.

div.head: αὐτομολέω
div.p: αὐτομολήσω, ηὐτομόλησα [αὐτόμολος], desert.

div.head: αὐτόμολος
div.p: -ου [αὐτός, 2 aor, ἔμολον, go] (one who goes of himself without orders), deserter.

div.head: αὐτός
div.p: -ή, -ό [bor., Eng. autobiography, automobile, etc.], intensive pron,, self, very, Lat. ipse. In attributive position, same, Lat. idem, with dat., same as; ἐν τῷ αὐτῷ, in the same place. Without the article, in oblique cases it is usually an unemphatic pers. pron. of the third person, him, her, it, them, Lat. is, sometimes intensive, so always in the nom.

div.head: αὐτόσε
div.p: [αὐτός + -σε, to], adv. (to the very place), thither, there.

div.head: αὐτοῦ
div.p: [gen. of αὐτός], adv. (in the very place), there, here.

div.head: ἀφαιρέω
div.p: [αἱρέω take; bor. Eng. aphaeresis], take away; mid., take away for one’s own use or advantage, deprive, rob, with acc. of thing, and acc. or gen. of person.

div.head: ἀφανής
div.p: -ἐς [ἀ- priv., φαίνω, show], unseen, out of sight; unknown, doubtful.

div.head: ἀφανίζω
div.p: ἀφανιῶ, ἠφάνισα, ἠφάνικα [ἀφανής] (make unseen), hide, blot out, annihilate.

div.head: ἀφειδῶς
div.p: sup. ἀφειδέστατα [ἀφειδής, unsparing], adv., unsparingly, mercilessly.

div.head: ἀφθονία
div.p: -ας [ἄφθονος], plenty, abundance.

div.head: ἄφθονος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., φθόνος, envy] (not grudging), abundant. Neut. pl. as subst., abundance, plenty.

div.head: ἀφίημι
div.p: [ἴημι, send], send away, let go; let go free, give up, let loose an animal; let flow, of water; let down an anchor.

div.head: ἀφικνέομαι
div.p: ἀφίξομαι, ἀφικόμην, ἀφῖγμαι (the simple verb is rare in prose), arrive at, come to, reach, arrive,

div.head: ἀφιππεύω
div.p: [ἱππεύω, ἱππεύσω (ἱππεύς, horseman), ride], ride back.

div.head: ἀφίστημι
div.p: [ἴστημι, cause to stand, set], set aside, remove, intr., in mid., and in 2 aor., pf., plpf., and fut. pf. act., go away, withdraw, revolt, desert, go over.

div.head: ἄφοδος
div.p: -ου, ἡ [ὁδός, way], way of escape.

div.head: ἄφρων
div.p: -ον, gen. Adpovos [ἀ- priv., φρήν, mind ], out of one’s head, delirious.

div.head: ἀφύλακτος
div.p: -ον [ἀ- priv., φυλάττω, guard], unguarded, unwatched.

div.head: Ἀχαιός
div.p: -οῦ, Achaean, a native of Achaea, a state in the northern part of the Peloponnésus.

div.head: ἀχάριστος
div.p: -ον [ἀ-priv., χαρίζομαι, do a favor), ungracious, without grace; οὐκ ἀχάριστα ironically, prettily enough, 108, 8; ungrateful; unrewarded.

div.head: ἀχαρίστως
div.p: [ἀχάριστος], adv., ungrateful; ἀχαρίστως ἔχειν, ὁέ α thankless task.

div.head: ἄχθομαι
div.p: ἀχθέσομαι, ἠχθέσθην [ἄχθος, burden], be burdened, esp. with grief or distress, be vexed, be troubled; with cogn. acc., be troubled about.

div.head: ἀχρεῖος
div.p: -ον [ἀ- priv., xpela, use], useless.

div.head: ἄχρηστος
div.p: -ον [ἀ- priv., χρηστός, useful], useless.

div.head: ἄχρι
div.p: temporal conj., seldom found in Attic, etd.

div.head: ἀψίνθιον
div.p: -ου [bor., French and Eng. absinthe], wormwood.

div.head: Βαβυλών
div.p: -ῶνος, ἡ, Babylon, a city situated on the lower Euphrates, capital of the Persian empire.

div.head: Βαβυλωνία
div.p: -ας [fem. of Βαβυλώνιος], Babylonia, the district in which Babylon was situated.

div.head: Βαβυλώνιος
div.p: -α, -ον [Βαβυλών], of Babylon, Babylonian.

div.head: βάδην
div.p: [βαίνω], adv., at a walk (i.e. slowly); βάδην ταχύ, at a fast walk.

div.head: βάθος
div.p: -ους, τό [cp. βαθύς ; bor., Eng. bathos], depth.

div.head: βαθύς
div.p: -εῖα, -ύ [cp. βάθος], deep.

div.head: βαίνω
div.p: βήσομαι, ἔβην, βέβηκα, -βέβαμαι, -εβάθην [cogn., Lat. venio, come, Eng. come; bor., Eng. base, basis], in prose generally used in cpds., step, go, pf., have stepped, stand.

div.head: βακτηρία
div.p: -aς [cogn., Lat. baculum, staff; bor., Eng. bacterium], walking stick, cane, 1n common use among the Greeks, both old and young.

div.head: βάλανος
div.p: -ου, ἡ, acorn; also any small acorn-shaped fruit, date.

div.head: βάλλω
div.p: βαλῶ, ἔβαλον, βέβληκα, βέβλημαι, ἐβλήθην [bor., Lat. ballista, hurling engine, Eng. ballistics, hyperbole, problem, parable, symbol], throw throw at, throw missiles, pelt, stone; οἱ ἐκ χειρὸς βάλλοντες ἀκοντισταί, 162, 3; pass. βαλλόμενοι, exposed to missiles, under fire.

div.head: βάπτω
div.p: βάψω, ἔβαψα, βέβαμμαι, ἐβάφην [bor., Eng. baptize], dip, dip in.

div.head: βαρβαρικός
div.p: -ή, -ὁν [βάρβαρος ; bor., Eng. barbaric], foreign (not Greek), barbaric, barbarian; τὸ βαρβαρικόν (sc. στράτευμα), the barbarian (Persian) force of Cyrus.

div.head: βαρβαρικῶς
div.p: [βαρβαρικός ], adv., in the barbarian language, in Persian.

div.head: βάρβαρος
div.p: -ον [bor., Eng. barbarous, Barbary], foreign (not Greek), darbarian. Masc. as subst., foreigner, barbarian, applied to all who were not Greeks, esp. to Persians,

div.head: βαρέως
div.p: [βαρύς, heavy; cogn., Lat. gravis, heavy, bor, Eng. barytone], adv., heavily, with anger, with displeasure; βαρέως φέρω, be heavy at heart, Lat. graviter fero.

div.head: Βασίας
div.p: -ου, Basias, an Arcadian.

div.head: βασιλεία
div.p: -ας [βασιλεύω], kingdom, royal power.

div.head: βασίλειος
div.p: -ον [βασιλεύς], of a king, royal, Neut. (usually pl.) as subst., royal dwelling, palace.

div.head: βασιλεύς
div.p: -έως, ὁ [bor Eng. Basil, basilisk], king, when used of the king of Persia it generally appears without the article, being treated as a proper name; cp. the familiar use of Eng. doctor, as ‘Doctor (for the doctor or Doctor A.) has come’ ; παρὰ βασιλεῖ, at court.

div.head: βασιλεύω
div.p: βασιλεύσω [βασιλεύς], be king, reign.

div.head: βασιλικός
div.p: -ἡ, -όν [βασιλεύς ; bor., Eng. basilica], of a king, king’s, royal.

div.head: βάσιμος
div.p: -ον [βαίνω], passable.

div.head: βατός
div.p: -ἡ, -όν (verbal of βαίνω), passable.

div.head: βέβαιος
div.p: -α, -ον [βαίνω], firm, steadfast, reliable.

div.head: Βέλεσυς
div.p: -υος, ὁ, Belésys, satrap of Syria.

div.head: βέλος
div.p: -ους, τό [βάλλω], missile of any sort; ἔξω βελῶν, out of range.

div.head: βέλτιστος
div.p: -η, -ον [cp. βούλομαι, wish] (most desirable; used as sup. of ἀγαθός), best, bravest, most advantageous.

div.head: βελτίων
div.p: -ον [cp. βούλομαι, wish] (more desirable ; used as comp. of

div.head: ἀγαθός)
div.p: better, braver, of higher rank, more advantageous.

div.head: βῆμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [βαίνω], step.

div.head: βία
div.p: βίας, force, violence; βίᾳ, by force, by storm.

div.head: βιάζομαι
div.p: βιάσομαι, ἐβιασάμην, βεβίασμαι: [βία], force, compel, overpower.

div.head: βιαίως
div.p: [βίαιος, violent], adv., violently, with great force.

div.head: βῖκος
div.p: -ου, jar, wine jar.

div.head: βίος
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. vivus, alive, Eng. quick (‘the quick and the dead,’ ‘cut to the quick’); bor., Eng. biography, biology, microbe ], life.

div.head: βιοτεύω
div.p: βιοτεύσω [ βίοτος, poetic = βίος], live, pass one’s life.

div.head: βλάβη
div.p: -ης, [βλάπτω], injury, disadvantage.

div.head: βλακεύω
div.p: [βλάξ, slack], shirk, be soldiering.

div.head: βλάπτω
div.p: βλάψω, ἔβλαψα, βέβλαφα, βέβλαμμαι, ἐβλάφθην and ἐβλάβην, injure, damage.

div.head: βλέπω
div.p: βλέψομαι, ἔβλεψα, look; of things, he pointed towards.

div.head: βοάω
div.p: βοήσομαι, ἐβόησα [βοή], call out, shout.

div.head: βοή
div.p: -ῆς, shout, shouting.

div.head: βοήθεια
div.p: -ας [cp. βοηθέω], aid, assistance, rescue.

div.head: βοηθέω
div.p: βοηθήσω, etc. [βοηθός (βοή, θέω, run), running to aid at a cry for help], come to the aid, go to the rescue, abs. or with dat.

div.head: βόθρος
div.p: -ου, pit, hole.

div.head: Βοιωτία
div.p: -ας, Boeotia, a country of Greece, north of Attica.

div.head: βοιωτιάζω
div.p:
[Βοιώτιος], imitate the Boeotians; with τῇ φωνῇ, speak in Boeotian dialect. The Boeootian speech, which was an unrefined branch of the Aeolic dialect, seemed to the Athenians harsh and uncultivated. It had broad vowel sounds, and threw the accent of many words farther back than Attic; the smooth breathing was used, too, in many
common words which in Attic had the rough breathing.

div.head: Βοιώτιος
div.p: -ου [Βοιωτός, Boeotian], Boeotian, a native of Boeotia.

div.head: βορρᾶς
div.p: -οῦ, contracted from βορέας, -ου, Boreas, the north wind.

div.head: βόσκημα
div.p: -ατος, τό [βόσκω, feed], a fed animal, pl., cattle.

div.head: βουλεύω
div.p: βουλεύσω, etc. [βουλή (βούλομαι), Plan], plan, usually mid., take counsel with oneself, ponder, deliberate, consider, plan.

div.head: βουλιμιάω
div.p: ἐβουλιμίασα [ βουλιμία (βοῦς, λιμός, hunger), faintness from hunger, cp. Eng. ‘hungry as an ox’; bor., Eng. bulimy], be faint from hunger, have bulimy. βοῦς 15 used here and in a few other words to denote size or coarseness. Eng. ‘horse’ has an equiv. use in some words, as ‘horse-radish,’ ‘horse-laugh,’ ‘ horseplay.’

div.head: βούλομαι
div.p: βουλήσομαι, βεβούλημαι, ἐβουλήθην, will, wish, prefer, be willing.

div.head: βοῦς
div.p: βοός, ὁ, ἡ [cogn., Lat. bos, ox, cow, bor., Eng. bucolic, butter], ox, cow, pl. often cattle; fem. sometimes oxhide. βραδέως [βραδύς, slow], adv., slowly.

div.head: βραχύς
div.p: -εῖα, -ύ [cogn., Lat. brevis, short; bor., Eng. brachycephalic, brachylogy], short; ἐπὶ βραχὺ ἐξικνεῖσθαι, have a short range. Neut. acc. as adv. a short distance; βραχύτερα ἢ ὡς ἐξικνεῖσθαι, too short a distance to reach.

div.head: βρέχω
div.p: ἔβρεξα, βέβρεγμαι, ἐβρέχθην, wet, pass., get wet.

div.head: βροντή
div.p: -ῆς [βρέμω, roar, cogn., Lat. fremo, roar], thunder, clap of thunder.

div.head: βρωτός
div.p: -ή, -όν (verbal of βιβρώσκω, eat, cogn., Lat. voro, devour), eatable.

div.head: βωμός
div.p: -οῦ, raised place, esp. altar.

div.head: γαμέω
div.p: γαμῶ, ἔγημα, γεγάμηκα, γεγάμημαι [γάμος], marry, act. of the man, mid. and pass. of the woman.

div.head: γάμος
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. bigamy, polygamy, cryptogamic], marriage; ἄγειν ἐπὶ γάμῳ, take home as wife.

div.head: γάρ
div.p: [γέ - ἄρα, then], post positive adv. or conj. : (1) As conj., for. (2) As confirmatory adv., verily, indeed, in fact; so in questions and answers, 82, 14; 85, 10 ; emotional, why! 129, 33, 133, 23; introducing details promised in the preceding clause, to be omitted in translation or rendered now, namely, 84, 53 127, 23; 156, 143; for example, 99, 6; καὶ γάρ, and in fact, and to be sure, often best translated for, 52, 18; 66, 19; καὶ γὰρ οὖν, like οιγαροῦν, and so of course, and so naturally, 96,15; ἀλλὰ γάρ, but really, 155, 14.

div.head: γαστήρ
div.p: γαστρός, ἡ [bor., Eng. gastric, gastronomy, gastritis], belly.

div.head: Γαυλίτης
div.p: -του, Caulites, a friend of Cyrus.

div.head: γέ
div.p:
enclitic adv. : (1) Intensive, to be sure, surely, certainly , often translated by merely emphasizing the preceding word ; followed frequently by another adv., each having its full force, as ἀλλ᾽ εὖ γε μέντοι ἐπιστάσθων, but let them know full (γε) well nevertheless (μέντοι), 71, 5 ; γε μέντοι, yet surely, 145, 21, but however, though (γε being rendered only by emphasizing the important word), 97, 13; 116, 2;
so μέντοι... γε, 115, 26; γε μήν, 97, 22; 98,14; μὴν. . .γε, 101,4. (2) Restrictive, at least.

div.head: γείτων
div.p: -ovos, 6 [γῆ], netghbor.

div.head: γελάω
div.p: γελάσομαι, ἐγέλασα, ἐγελάσθην, laugh.

div.head: γέλως
div.p: -ωτος, ὁ [γελάω], laughter.

div.head: γέμω
div.p: only in pres. and impf., be full.

div.head: γενεά
div.p: -ᾶς [γίγνομαι; bor., Eng. genealogy], birth, time of births ἀπὸ γενεᾶς, from birth, of age.

div.head: γενειάω
div.p: [γένειον, beard, cogn., Lat. genae, checks, Eng. chin], have a beard, be bearded.

div.head: γένος
div.p: -συς, τό [γίγνομαι ; cogn., Lat. genus, family, Eng. kin, kind], race, family.

div.head: γέρρον
div.p: -ου, wicker shield, carried by Asiatics, not by Greeks. See Fig. 37, p. 106. Cp. ἀσπίς, πέλτη.

div.head: γερροφόρος
div.p: -ου [γέρρον, φέρω, carry, bear], bearer of a wicker shield, pl., troops armed with wicker shields.

div.head: γέρων
div.p: -οντος, ὁ, old man.

div.head: γεύω
div.p: γεύσω, ἔγευσα, γέγευμαι [cogn., Lat. gusto, taste, Eng. choose], give a taste of; mid., taste, with gen.

div.head: γέφυρα
div.p: -ας, bridge ; γέφυρα ἐζευγμένη πλοίοις, bridge of boats, pontoon bridge.

div.head: γῆ
div.p: γῆς [bor., Eng. geology, geography, George, apogee], earth, ground, land, country ; κατὰ γῆν, by land ; εἰς γῆν, towards the ground, 90, 5.

div.head: γήλοφος
div.p: -ου [γῆ, λόφος, crest], hill, hillock.

div.head: γῆρας
div.p: γήρως, τό [cp. γέρων], old age.

div.head: γίγνομαι
div.p: γενήσομαι, ἔγενόμην, γέγονα and γεγένημαι [cogn., Lat. gigno, be born, géns, nation, genus, family, Eng. kin, kind ; bor., Eng. genesis, oxygen], be born, with gen. of source. Idiomatic uses: descend from, with ἀπό and gen. ; become, be, get; take place, happen, turn out, prove oneself, with pred. nom.; of time, get to be, dawn, come on, of tribute, become due, accrue; of numbers, amount to, of a trial, be conducted ; of pledges, peace, etc., be given, be made, of troops, be organized; of omens, be favorable; with inf. as subject, be possible, τῶν μετὰ Κῦρον γενομένων, of those who lived (were born) after Cyrus, οἱ εἰς τριάκοντα ἔτη γεγονότες, men who were about (up to) thirty years old, ἐν ἑαυτῷ γίγνεσθαι, come to his senses.

div.head: γιγνώσκω
div.p: γνώσομαι, ἔγνων, ἔγνωκα, ἔγνωσμαι, ἐγνώσθην [cogn., Lat. (g)nosco, learn, Eng. know; bor., Eng. agnostic, diagnosis], know, perceive, realize, think ; discover, learn ; recognize, understand.

div.head: Γλοῦς
div.p: -οῦ, Glus, an Egyptian officer of Cyrus, son of Tamos.

div.head: γνώμη
div.p: -ης [γιγνώσκω; bor., Eng. gnome, gnomic], knowledge, consent, judgment, opinion ; intention, purpose ; desire, expectation ; γνώμῃ, on principle, 135, 213; οὕτω τὴν γνώμην ἔχετε, make up your minds to this, ἔχειν τὴν γνώμην πρός τινα, be devoted to one.

div.head: γονεύς
div.p: -έως, ὁ [γίγνομαι], father ; pl., parents.

div.head: γόνυ
div.p: γόνατος, τό [cogn., Lat. gent, knee, Eng. knee], knee ; joint, knot.

div.head: Γοργίας
div.p:
-ου, Gorgias, of Leontini in Sicily, a famous rhetorician of the fifth century B.C. He came to Athens in 427, and earned large
fees by his teaching, Proxenus being among his pupils. He maintained that ‘nothing exists; if anything does exist, it cannot be known; even if it can be known, the knowledge of it cannot be made clear to others.’

div.head: γοῦν
div.p: [γέ+ οὖν, at any rate], post-positive restrictive adv., at any rate, at all events.

div.head: γράφω
div.p: γράψω, ἔγραψα, γέγραφα, γέγραμμαι, ἐγράφην [bor., Eng. graphic, geography, telegraph, phonograph ], write.

div.head: γυμνάζω
div.p: γυμνάσω, etc. [γυμνός ; bor., Eng. gymnast, gymnasium], train naked, exercise. The Greeks took their gymnastic exercise naked.

div.head: γυμνής
div.p: -τος, ὁ [γυμνός], light-armed foot soldier ; as adj., light-armed, 183, 19. See Introd. § 57.

div.head: Γυμνιάς
div.p: -άδος, Gymnias, a city of the Scythéni, near Trapezus. Its exact location is not known.

div.head: γυμνικός
div.p: -ἡ, -όν [γυμνός], athletic, gymnastic. The Greeks exercised naked.

div.head: γυμνός
div.p: -ἡ, -όν, naked, lightly clad, wearing only the tunic (see x:Twv) ; exposed, with πρός ἀπά δος.

div.head: γυνή
div.p: γυναικός, ἡ [cog., Eng. queen ; bor., Eng. misogynist ], woman, wife ; chief wife of the Persian king as distinguished from the rest of his harem.

div.head: Γωβρύας
div.p: -α (Doric gen.) or -ου, Gobryas, one of the four generals of Artaxerxes.

div.head: δάκνω
div.p: δήξομαι, ἔδακον, δέδηγμαι, ἐδήχθην, bite.

div.head: δακρύω
div.p: δακρύσω, ἐδάκρῦσα, δεδάκρῦμαι [δάκρυ, tear; cogn., Lat. lacrima (old lacruma), tear, Eng. tear], weep.

div.head: δακτύλιος
div.p: -ου [δάκτυλος], finger ring, ring, the commonest ornament worn by Greeks. Rings usually had a seal (see Fig. 74, p. 220) and were thus useful for attesting the genuineness of letters, wills, and other sealed documents.

div.head: δάκτυλος
div.p: -ου [cp. δέχομαι, receive, take; cogn., Lat. digitus, finger, toe, bor. Eng. dactyl], finger;

div.head: δάκτυλος
div.p: τῶν ποδῶν, toe.

div.head: Δαμάρατος
div.p: -ου, Demaratus, King of Sparta, who on being dethroned by his colleague, Cleoménes I, in 491 B.C. fled to the Persian king and received from him cities in Teuthrania.

div.head: Δάνα
div.p: τά, Dana, an important city of Cappadocia.

div.head: δαπανάω
div.p: δαπανήσω, etc. [δαπάνη, expense], spend, make expenditures, with ἀμφί or εἰς and acc.

div.head: δάπεδον
div.p: -ου, ground.

div.head: Δαρδανεύς
div.p: -έως, ὁ, Dardanian, a native of Dardanus, a city on the Hellespont.

div.head: Δάρδας
div.p: -ατος, ὁ, Dardas, a small Syrian river, west of Thapsacus. Its exact course is not known.

div.head: δαρεικός
div.p: -ου [Δαρεῖος], properly an adj. with στατήρ understood, stater of Parius, daric (unless it be connected with the Babylonian word dariku, weight, measure), a Persian gold coin equivalent to about $5.40, but having a purchasing power several times greater. It passed as the equivalent of 20 Attic drachmas, as is seen from 87, 1-6, where a bet of 10 talents (60,000 drachmas) is, paid with 3000 darics. See Fig. 10, p. 53

div.head: Δαρεῖος
div.p: -ου, Darius, the name of several Persian kings; in the Anabasis, Darius Nothus, who was the father of Artaxerxes Mnémon and Cyrus the Younger. He reigned 425-405 B.C.

div.head: δασμός
div.p: -οῦ [δαίομαι, divide], division, tribute, tax, payment of which was divided among subject states.

div.head: δασύς
div.p: -εῖα, -ύ [cogn., Lat. dénsus, thick], thick, thickly wooded, bushy; of hides, shaggy. Neut. as subst., grove.

div.head: δαψιλής
div.p: -ές, plentiful, abundant.

div.head: δέ
div.p: postpositive conj., δέ, often used where the adversative force is not natural to Eng., best translated and. It frequently answers to μέν in the preceding clause, μέν ... δέ being sometimes translatable on the one hand ...on the other, while... yet, not only ... but also, etc., though more often to be rendered only by emphasis on the words before them ; in καὶ... δέ, and furthermore, and too, δέ is the connective and καὶ intensive, 51, 6; καὶ πάντες δέ, and all alike, and in fact all.

div.head: δείδω
div.p: δείσομαι, ἔδεισα, δέδοικα and δέδια (pres. and fut. Homeric; in Attic, the pf. is used with pres. meaning), fear, be afraid.

div.head: δείκνυμι
div.p: δείξω, ἔδειξα, δέδειχα, δέδειγμαι, ἐδείχθην [cogn., Lat. dico, say, tell, Eng. teach], show, show by signs, point out.

div.head: δείλη
div.p: -ης, afternoon, usually late afternoon; ἀμφὶ δείλην, towards evening, 112, 25 (cp. ὀψὲ ἦν, 113, 11). As with Eng. ‘afternoon,’ the context or a limiting word always shows whether early (as in 89, 11) or late afternoon is meant. Cp. the use of ‘evening’ in our southern states, where ‘good evening’ is a common salutation any time after noon.

div.head: δειλός
div.p: -ή, -όν [δείδω], cowardly.

div.head: δεινός
div.p: -ή, -ὀν [δείδω], terrible, fearful, dreadful ; clever, skillful (cp. colloquial Eng. ‘awfully clever’). Neut. as subst., danger.

div.head: δειπνέω
div.p: δειπνήσω, ἐδείπνησα, δεδείπνηκα [δεῖπνον], take dinner, dine.

div.head: δεῖπνον
div.p: -ου, the chief meal, dinner, Lat. céna. It was commonly eaten late in the day; see Introd. § 64.

div.head: δέκα
div.p: [cogn., Lat. decem, ten, Eng. ten; bor., Eng. decade, decalogue], indecl., ten.

div.head: Δελφοί
div.p: -ῶν, Delphi, a city of central Greece, famed for the oracle of Apollo, which was consulted on all sorts of matters by both Greeks and foreigners. The importance of the oracle was diminished in Roman times, and shortly before 400 A.D. it was abolished by the emperor Theodosius the Great. In 1892 the French began excavations there, the village of Kastri, which covered the site, having been removed. Among the discoveries are the foundations of the temple of Apollo.

div.head: δένδρον
div.p: -ου, dat. pl. δένδροις and (more commonly) δένδρεσι [bor., Eng. rhododendron ], tree.

div.head: δεξιός
div.p:
-ά, -όν [cogn., Lat. dexter, right], right, on the right hand. Fem. as subst. (sc. χείρ, cp. Lat. dextra, right hand), right hand;
the right hand as a pledge, pledge, assurance; ἐν δεξιᾷ, on the right; ὑπὲρ δεξιῶν, above on the right. Neut. as subst. (sc. κέρας, cp. 83, 14), right wing of an army; τὰ δεξιὰ (55. μέρη) τοῦ κέρατος, the right of the wing.

div.head: δέρμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [δέρω, flay; bor., Eng. taxidermy, dermatology, epidermis], skin, hide.

div.head: δεσμός
div.p: -οὔ [δέω, bind], band, girth.

div.head: δεσπότης
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. despot, despotism], master.

div.head: δεῦρο
div.p: adv., hither, here.

div.head: δεύτερος
div.p: -α, -ov [cp. dvo, two, bor., Eng. Deuteronomy ], second. Neut. acc. as adv., with or without τό, the second time, a second time.

div.head: δέχομαι
div.p: δέξομαι, ἐδεξάμην, δέδεγμαι, ἐδέχθην, receive, accept, approve, receive hospitality ; meet an attack.

div.head: δέω
div.p: δήσω, ἔδησα, δέδεκα, δέδεμαι, ἐδέθην [bor., Eng. asyndeton, diadem ], bind, fasten, tie, tether.

div.head: δέω
div.p: δεήσω, ἐδέησα, δεδέηκα, δεδέημαι, ἐδεήθην, lack, want, in the act. rarely pers.; ὀλίγου δεῖν, with inf., lack little of, barely escape, 80, 1; commonly impers., δεῖ, δέῃ, δέον, etc., it is mecessary or needful, it is proper, translated personally as must, ought, with inf. or acc. and inf.; there is need of, with gen.; αὐτὸ τὸ δέον, just what is wanted; τὰ δέοντα, the necessary measures ; εἰς τὸ δέον, all right, properly. Mid., lack, want, need, desire, ask, beg, with gen., acc. of neut. pron., acc. and inf., or gen. and inf.

div.head: δή
div.p: [cp. δῆλος], postpositive adv., adding definiteness to an emphatic word, which, as a rule, it immediately follows ; in particular, 66, 25; 77,13; very, 98, 17; ὥσπερ δή, just as, 146, 1; often best rendered by merely emphasizing the word which it strengthens, 77, 19; 98, 22; frequently used to put the hearer into the mental attitude of the narrator, of course, naturally, 65,1; so, accordingly, 110, 13 καὶ δή, already, 103, 13; ἄγε δή, come now, τί δή, why, pray?

div.head: δῆλος
div.p: -η, -ον, plain, clear, evident; with εἰμί and a ptc. (with or without ὡς) it may be rendered by an adv. or by an impers. constr., δῆλος ἦν ἀνιώμενος, he was plainly troubled or it was plain that he was troubled ; δῆλον ὅτι (it ts plain that) is often used as an adv., plainly, evidently.

div.head: δηλόω
div.p: δηλώσω, etc. [δῆλος], make plain, show.

div.head: Δημοκράτης
div.p: -ου, Democrates, a scout in the Greek army.

div.head: δημόσιος
div.p: -α, -ον [δῆμος, people ; bor., Eng. democrat, epidemic], belonging to the people, public, τὰ δημόσια, the public funds.

div.head: δήπου
div.p: [δή - πού, I suppose], intensive adv., surely, to be sure.

div.head: διά
div.p:
[cp. δύο, two, cogn., Lat. dis-, apart, bor., Eng. dialogue, diameter], prep. with gen. or acc., through. With gen., of place or means, through, by means of; of time, throughout, during; διὰ ταχέων, quickly (through quick measures) ; διὰ πίστεως, trustingly; διὰ φιλίας ἱέναι τινί, be on terms of friendship with one, διὰ παντὸς πολέμου ἰέναι τινί, be at out-and-out war with one. With acc., of cause, through, because of, on account of; διὰ φιλίαν, for friendship’s sake.
In cpds. διά means through, across, or denotes thoroughness, completion, continuance, or separation (Lat. dis-) ; cp. Eng. words beginning with dia-, as diadem, diagonal, dialect, also see above.

div.head: διαβαίνω
div.p: [βαίνω, go], go over, cross, stride (put the feet apart).

div.head: διαβάλλω
div.p: [βάλλω, throw], throw through; slander, accuse falsely (from διάβολος, slanderer, devil, are borrowed Eng. diabolic and French diable, devil).

div.head: διάβασις
div.p: -εως, ἡ [διαβαίνω], crossing, ford, means of crossing, bridge.

div.head: διαβατέος
div.p: -α, -ον (verbal of διαβαίνω), to be crossed, that must be crossed.

div.head: διαβατός
div.p: -η, -ον (verbal of διαβαίνω), that can be crossed, fordable, passable.

div.head: διαβιβάζω
div.p: [βιβάζω, -βιβάσω or βιβῶ, -εβίβασα, causative of βαίνω, used mostly in cpds., cause to go], take across, transport.

div.head: διαβολή
div.p: -ῆς [διαβάλλω], slander, false accusation.

div.head: διαγγέλλω
