div.p: -ων, Carduchi or Carduchians, an independent people east of the Tigris and south of Armenia, who fiercely opposed the passage of the Greeks through their country. Their race survives in the Kurds of Kurdistan, whose country is much larger than the ancient territory.

div.head: καρπόομαι
div.p: καρπώσομαι, ἑκαρπωσάμην, κεκάρπωμαι [καρπός], reap crops from, of an enemy, plunder.

div.head: καρπός
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. carpo, pluck], fruit of the earth or of trees, crops.

div.head: Κάρσος
div.p: -ου, Carsus, a small river which empties into the Mediterranean, and forms the boundary between Cilicia and Syria.

div.head: κάρφη
div.p: -ns [κάρφω, dry up], dry material; hay.

div.head: Καστωλός
div.p: -ου, Castolus, a place probably near Sardis; Καστωλοῦ πεδίον, Castolus Plain, the rendezvous of the military contingents of Lydia, Phrygia, and Cappadocia.

div.head: κατά
div.p: by elision and euphony κατ’ or καθ᾽ [bor., Eng. cataract, catarrh ], prep. with gen. or acc., down, along (keeping the course of ). With gen., down, down from, down over. . With acc., down along, often without any idea of ‘down’ (as in 186, 11), along, over; the idea of ‘along’ (following the course of) is usually clear even when a different translation is required; during, on, against; opposite, facing; at, in, by, according to; κατὰ γῆν, by land, κατ᾽ ἀντιπέρας, over against; καθ᾽ ἁρπαγήν, for plundering; κατὰ

div.head: κράτος
div.p: with all their might (but according to it, and so with some reserve of power; cp. ava κράτος), καθ᾽ ἡσυχίαν, at their ease; κατὰ τοῦτο, at this point; κατὰ μῆνα, monthly; καϑ᾿ ἕνα, one by one; τὸ κατὰ τοῦτον εἶναι, so far as this fellow is concerned. In cpds., down, against; completely, utterly, esp. of consuming, destroying, spending; cp. Eng. words beginning with cata-, as cataclysm, catacomb, catalogue, catastrophe, or cate-, as catechism, category, or cath-, as cathedral, catholic, see also above.

div.head: καταβαίνω
div.p: [βαίνω, go], go down, come down, descend; march down to the coast (cp. ἀναβαίνω); enter a contest, Lat. in harénam déscendo, 225, 15.

div.head: κατάβασις
div.p: -εως, ἡ [καταβαίνω], a going down, descent, place of descent.

div.head: καταγγέλλω
div.p: [ἀγγέλλω, announce], inform against, denounce.

div.head: κατάγειος
div.p: -ον [γῆ, earth], underground.

div.head: καταγελάω
div.p: [γελάω, laugh], laugh at, ridicule, make sport of, with gen.; laugh in derision or defiance.

div.head: κατάγνυμι
div.p: [ἄγνυμι, ἄξω, ἔαξα, ἔαγα, ἐάγην, break, poetic], break in pieces, break.

div.head: κατάγω
div.p: [ἄγω, lead], lead down, bring back from exile, restore; mid., arrive.

div.head: καταδαπανάω
div.p: [δαπανάω, spend), spend enitrely, entirely consume.

div.head: καταδιώκω
div.p: [διώκω, pursue], pursue closely, chase away.

div.head: καταδύω
div.p: [δύω, enter], make to go down, sink a ship; mid., intr., sink.

div.head: καταθεάομαι
div.p: [θεάομαι, look on], look down upon, take a survey.

div.head: καταθύω
div.p: [θύω, sacrifice], sacrifice.

div.head: καταισχύνω
div.p: [αἰσχύνω, dishonor], completely dishonor, disgrace.

div.head: κατακαίνω
div.p: [καίνω, ill], kill, down.

div.head: κατακαίω
div.p: [καίω, burn], burn down, burn completely, burn up.

div.head: κατάκειμαι
div.p: [κεῖμαι, lie], lie down, lie; lie idle.

div.head: κατακλείω
div.p: [κλείω, -κλείσω, ἔκλεισα, κέκλειμαι, ἐκλείσθην, shut], shut up, shut in.

div.head: κατακόπτω
div.p: [κόπτω, cut], cut down, cut to pieces, slay.

div.head: κατακτείνω
div.p: [κτείνω, kill], kill, murder.

div.head: καταλαμβάνω
div.p: [λαμβάνω, take; bor., Eng. catalepsy], capture, seize, occupy a place; overtake, catch, hit; come upon, find.

div.head: καταλέγω
div.p: [λέγω, tell; bor., Eng. catalogue], enumerate, count as.

div.head: καταλείπω
div.p: [λείπω, leave], leave, leave behind, abandon, pass., be left behind, stay behind.

div.head: καταλεύω
div.p:
[λεύω, -λεύσω, -έλευσα, ἐλεύσθην, stone, from λᾶας, a stone], stone to death,
καταλλάττω [ἀλλάττω, ἀλλάξω, ἤλλαξα, -}AAaxa, ἤλλαγμαι, ἠλλάχθην and ἠλλάγην, change], change, esp. from enmity to friendship, reconcile.

div.head: καταλύω
div.p: [λύω, loose], unyoke pack animals, halt; sc. πόλεμον, end hostilities, make peace.

div.head: καταμανθάνω
div.p: [μανθάνω, learn], learn thoroughly, observe well, see.

div.head: κατανοέω
div.p: [νοέω, perceive], observe carefully, percetve. καταπέμπω [πέμπω, send ], send down to the seacoast (cp. καταβαίνω).

div.head: καταπετρόω
div.p: [πετρόω, ἐπετρώθην (πέτpos, a stone), stone], stone to death.

div.head: καταπηδάω
div.p: [πηδάω, πηδήσομαι, ἐπήδησα, -πεπήδηκα, leap], leap down.

div.head: καταπίπτω
div.p: [πίπτω, fall], fall down or off.

div.head: καταπλήττω
div.p: [-πλήττω, -πλήξω, -έπληξα, πέπληγα, πέπληγμαι, ἐπλήγην and (regularly in cpds.) -επλάγην, strike], strike down, esp. with fear, terrify.

div.head: καταπράττω
div.p: [πράττω, do], do completely, accomplish.

div.head: κατασκέπτομαι
div.p: [σκέπτομαι, view], view closely or carefully, inspect.

div.head: κατασκευάζω
div.p: [σκευάζω, σκευάσω, ἐσκεύασα, ἐσκεύασμαι, -εσκευάσθην, prepare], prepare fully, equip, furnish; administer well, improve; mid., make careful preparations.

div.head: κατασκηνάω
div.p: [σκηνάω (σκηνή, tent), put under a tent ), encamp.

div.head: κατασκηνόω
div.p: [σκηνόω (σκηνή, tent), encamp ], encamp.

div.head: κατασπάω
div.p: [σπάω, draw], draw or drag down.

div.head: καταστρατοπεδεύω
div.p: [στρατοπεδεύομαι, mid., encamp ], settle down in camp, encamp.

div.head: καταστρέφω
div.p: [στρέφω, turn, bor., Eng. catastrophe], turn down, mid., overthrow, subdue.

div.head: κατασφάζω
div.p: [σφάζω, slaughter), cut down, hill.

div.head: κατατείνω
div.p: [τείνω, stretch], stretch tight; intr., stretch or strain oneself, strive earnestly, insist.

div.head: κατατέμνω
div.p: [τέμνω, cut], cut down into the ground, aig; cut up, cut to pleces.

div.head: κατατίθημι
div.p: [τίθημι, put], put or lay down; mid., for one’s own benefit, lay up or aside, store away, give into one’s keeping, deposit.

div.head: κατατιτρώσκω
div.p: [τιτρώσκω, wound ], wound severely, καταφαγεῖν, see κατεσθίω.

div.head: καταφανής
div.p: -ές, [φαίνω, show], tn sight, visible.

div.head: καταφεύγω
div.p: [φεύγω, flee], flee down, free for refuge.

div.head: καταφρονέω
div.p: [φρονέω, think] (think down on), look down on, despise.

div.head: κατεργάζομαι
div.p: [ἐργάζομαι, work], achieve, accomplish, bring to pass.

div.head: κατεσθίω
div.p: [ἐσθίω, eat], eat up. For

div.head: κατά
div.p: cp. Eng. ‘gobble down.’

div.head: κατέχω
div.p: [ἔχω, hold], hold down, hold fast, restrain; constrain, compel, hold, occupy a place; cover a space.

div.head: κατορύττω
div.p: [ὀρύττω, dig], dig down: bury, hide in the ground.

div.head: κάτω
div.p: [κατά], adv., down, downwards; below, τὸ κάτω, the lower part.

div.head: καῦμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [καίω, burn ], burning heat. Καΰστρου πεδίον, -ου, τό, Cayster Plain, Caysterfield (cp. Northfield, Springfield, etc.), a city of Phrygia.

div.head: κέγχρος
div.p: -ου, panic grass, related to millet, used as fodder; its seeds are also ground into meal.

div.head: κεῖμαι
div.p: κείσομαι, lie, lie outstretched, lie dead, lie in ruins; (used as a pf. pass. of τίθημι, have been put or laid; τὰ ὅπλα ἔκειντο, used as pass. of θέσθαι τὰ ὅπλα), the arms had been grounded or the troops were standing under arms.

div.head: Κελαιναί
div.p: -ῶν, αἱ, Celaenae, a city of southern Phrygia, situated at the sources of the Maeander and the Marsyas.

div.head: κελεύω
div.p: κελεύσω, ἐκέλευσα, κεκέλευκα, κεκέλευσμαι, ἐκελεύσθην, order, command, direct, bid, urge, advise.

div.head: κενός
div.p: -ή, -όν [bor., Eng. cenotaph], empty, vacant, unoccupied, without, with gen. of want; vain, groundless.

div.head: κεντέω
div.p: κεντήσω [cp. κέντρον, goad, center, bor., Eng. center], goad, torture.

div.head: Κεντρίτης
div.p: -ου, Centrites, a tributary of the Tigris, the boundary between Armenia and the Carduchian country.

div.head: κεραμεοῦς
div.p: -ᾶ, -οῦν [κέραμος, potter's clay; bor., Eng. ceramic], of clay, clay.

div.head: Κεράμων
div.p: ἀγορά, -ας, Ceramon Agora, Tilemarket (cp. Haymarket, Newmarket, etc.), a town of Phrygia.

div.head: κεράννυμι
div.p: ἐκέρασα, κέκραμαι, ἐκεράσθην, and ἐκράθην, mix, mingle.

div.head: κέρας
div.p: κέρᾶτος and κέρως, τό [cogn., Lat. cervus, acer, cornu, horn, Eng. hart, horn; bor., Eng. ceratoid, rhinoceros], horn, trumpet, wing of an army; κατὰ κέρας, 272 column, see Introd. § 62.

div.head: κερδαίνω
div.p: κερδανῶ, ἑκέρδανα, κεκέρδηκα [κέρδος], gain, make profit.

div.head: κερδαλέος
div.p: -α, -ον [κέρδος], profitable.

div.head: κέρδος
div.p: -ους, τό, gain, profit, wages.

div.head: κεφαλαλγής
div.p: -ές, [κεφαλή, ἄλγος (cp. neuralgia), pain], causing headache, apt to cause headache.

div.head: κεφαλή
div.p: -ῆς, [bor., Eng. cephalic, hydrocephalus], head.

div.head: κηδεμών
div.p: -όνος [κήδομαι, care for], protector, guardian.

div.head: κηρίον
div.p: -ου [κηρός, beeswax, Cogn, Lat. céra, wax], honeycomb.

div.head: κῆρυξ
div.p: -υκος, ὁ, herald, an officer who carried official messages not only to his fellow-soldiers but also to the enemy. When discharging his duties his person was inviolable, and he carried as badge of office the

div.head: κηρύκειον
div.p: a staff, which was represented in art with two intertwining serpents or shoots. See Fig. 40, p. 114.

div.head: κηρύττω
div.p: κηρύξω, ἐκήρυξα, -κεκήρυχα, κεκήρυγμαι, ἐκηρύχθην [κῆρυξ], proclaim as a herald or through a herald; command, with acc., or with inf.; ἐκήρυξε (sc. ὁ κῆρυξ), proclamation was made, 172, 22.

div.head: Κηφισόδωρος
div.p: -ου, Cephisodorus, a captain in the Greek army.

div.head: Κηφισοφών
div.p: -ῶντος, ὁ, Cephisophon, an Athenian.

div.head: Κιλικία
div.p:
-ας [Κίλιξ], Cilicia, a district of southeastern Asia Minor, bordering on the sea. As a reward
for submitting without opposition to Cyrus the Great, the kings of Cilicia were allowed to retain their province practically as Persian satraps.

div.head: Κίλιξ
div.p: -cxos, ὁ, Cilician, a native of Cilicia.

div.head: Κίλισσα
div.p: -ῆς [Κίλιξ], woman, Cilician queen.

div.head: κινδυνεύω
div.p: κινδυνεύσω, etc. [κίνδυνος], be in danger, encounter danger; ἐκινδύνευσεν ἂν διαφθαρῆναι, would have been in danger of utter destruction, 180, 21.

div.head: κίνδυνος
div.p: -ου, danger, peril; κίνδυνος (sc. ἐστί), there is danger, with inf. or μή.

div.head: κινέω
div.p: κινήσω, etc. [cogn., Lat. cieo, move, Eng. hie; bor., Eng. kinetic, cinematograph ], move; mid., move about.

div.head: Κλεάνωρ
div.p: -ορος, ὁ, Cleanor, elected a general in the Greek army.

div.head: Κλέαρχος
div.p: -ου, Clearchus, the foremost general in the Greek army of Cyrus, an exile from Sparta, captured by treachery and killed at the Zapatas River. See Introd. §§ 14, Cilician 18, 19.

div.head: κλέπτω
div.p: κλέψω, ἔκλεψα, κέκλοφα, κέκλεμμαι, ἐκλάπην [cogn., Lat. clepο, steal, bor., Eng. cleptomania ], steal, smuggle, seize stealthily.

div.head: κλῖμαξ
div.p: -ακος, ἡ [κλείνω, cause to lean, cp. κλίνη; bor., Eng. climax, clime], ladder (leaner).

div.head: κλίνη
div.p: -ης [κλίνω, cause to lean; cogn., Lat. inclino, incline, bend, Eng. lean; bor., Eng. clinic, enclitic], bed, couch, used like the modern bed and couch or sofa, also for reclining at meals and as a bier for the dead.See Fig. 65, p. 201.

div.head: κλοπή
div.p: -ῆς [κλέπτω], stealing.

div.head: κλώψ
div.p: κλωπός, ὁ [κλέπτω], thief, marauder.

div.head: κνέφας
div.p: -ους, τό, poetic, dusk, twilight.

div.head: κνημίς
div.p: -ῖδος, ἡ [κνήμη, leg between knee and ankle], greave, a plate of metal, fitted to the leg and padded for comfort. It was held in place partly by the spring of the metal, partly by straps or buckles behind. It might be compared to a football shin guard, but the greave inclosed the leg nearly all round. See Figs, 11, 15, pp. 55, 60.

div.head: κογχυλιάτης
div.p: -ου [κογχύλη = κόγχη (bor., Eng. conch), mussel, a shell-fish], adj., shelly.

div.head: κοιμάω
div.p: κοιμήσω, ἐκοίμῃσα, ἐκοιμήθην [cp. κεῖμαι, lie, bor., Eng. coma, cemetery], poetic in act., lull to sleep; mid. and pass., go fo sleep, go to bed.

div.head: κοινῇ
div.p: [dat. fem. of κοινός], adv., 27 common, together.

div.head: κοινός
div.p: -ή, -όν [bor., Eng. epicene, coenobium ], common, general, shared by all; ἀπὸ κοινοῦ, from the common store, that part of the booty which had not been divided among the soldiers.

div.head: κολάζω
div.p: κολάσω, ἐκόλασα, κεκόλασμαι, ἐκολάσθην, chastise, punish.

div.head: Κολοσσαί
div.p: -ῶν, αἱ, Colossae, a city of southwestern Phrygia, where in the first century A.D. was located the church to which Paul wrote his Epistle to the Colosstans.

div.head: Κολχίς
div.p: -ίδος, ἡ [Κόλχοι], a district along the eastern and southeastern coast of the Black Sea, best known as the country from which Jason, according to the myth, carried off the Golden Fleece.

div.head: Κόλχοι
div.p:
-ων, Colchians, people of Colchis, a tribe of whom appear to
have lived near Trapezus in Xenophon’s day.

div.head: κολωνός
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. collis, Eng. hill), mound (of stones), cairn.

div.head: κομίζω
div.p: κομιῶ, ἐκόμισα, κεκόμικα, κεκόμισμαι, ἐκομίσθην, care for, carry away so as to care for, carry, bring; mid., τρισὶ own possessions or things in which one is interested.

div.head: κονιατός
div.p: -ή, -όν (verbal of κονιάω,, plaster), plastered, cemented.

div.head: κονιορτός
div.p: -ου [κόνις, dust, ὄρνυμι, stir up], cloud of dust.

div.head: κόπρος
div.p: ου, ἡ, dung.

div.head: κόπτω
div.p: κόψω, ἔκοψα, -κέκοφα, κέκομμαι, ἐκόπην [bor., Eng. comma, syncopate, apocope ], cut, slash; cut down trees; kill.

div.head: κόρη
div.p: -ῆς [bor., Eng. Cora], girl, Lat. puella.

div.head: Κορσωτή
div.p: -ῆς, Corsoté, a large city situated on an island formed by the Euphrates and the Mascas canal, which was mistaken by Xenophon for a river.

div.head: κορυφή
div.p: -ῆς, top, summit.

div.head: κοσμέω
div.p: κοσμήσω, etc. [κόσμος; bor., Eng. cosmetic], arrange, marshal; adorn.

div.head: κόσμος
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. cosmopolitan, cosmic, microcosm], good order; adornment.

div.head: κοῦφος
div.p: -η, -ον, light; χόρτος κοῦφος, hay.

div.head: κράνος
div.p: -ους, τό [bor., Eng. cranium], helmet, commonly of metal, protecting the whole head and the neck behind, It was usually provided with a crest of horsehair. See Figs. 6, 7, 8, 11, pp. 40, 41, 55.

div.head: κρατέω
div.p: κρατήσω, etc. [κράτος; bor., Eng. autocracy, democracy], be strong, rule, have sway over, be victorious, conquer, abs. or with gen.

div.head: κρατήρ
div.p: -ῆρος, ὁ [κεράννυμι, mix; bor., Eng. crater], large bowl, used by the Greeks for mixing water with wine, which they never drank clear. See Fig. 69, p. 207. κράτιστος, -η, -ον [κράτος] (used as sup. of ἀγαθός, really sup. of old adj. κρατύς, strong), best, strongest, bravest, noblest. Neut. acc. pl. as adv., best, most bravely.

div.head: κράτος
div.p: -ους, τό, strength, power; ava

div.head: κράτος
div.p: at full speed, κατὰ κράτος, with all their might (according to their strength, hence with some reserve power).

div.head: κραυγή
div.p: -ῆς [cp. κράζω, cry], cry, shouting; uproar.

div.head: κρέας
div.p: κρέως, τό [bor., Eng. creosote], flesh; pl. meat, κρείττων, -ον, gen. -ονος [κράτος] (used as comp. of ἀγαθός, really comp. of old adj. κρατύς, strong), stronger, mightier; better, preferable, more valuable. κρέμαμαι, κρεμήσομαι [cp. κρεμάννυμι], intr., be suspended, hang.

div.head: κρεμάννυμι
div.p: κρεμῶ, ἐκρέμασα, ἐκρεμάσθην [cp. κρέμαμαι], transitive, hang, hang up.

div.head: κρήνη
div.p: -ῆς, spring, fountain.

div.head: κρηπίς
div.p: -ῖδος, ἡ, foundation.

div.head: Κρής
div.p: Κρητός, ὁ, Cretan, a native of Crete (in modern times also called Candia), an island south of the Peloponnésus, noted in antiquity for its archers.

div.head: κριθή
div.p: -ῆς, always pl. in the Anabasis, barleycorns, barley.

div.head: κρίθινος
div.p: -η, -ον [κριθή], of barley; οἶνος

div.head: κρίθινος
div.p: beer, which is still generally made with barley.

div.head: κρίνω
div.p:
κρινῶ, ἔκρινα, κέκρικα, κέκριμαι,
ἐκρίθην [cogn., Lat. cerno, separate, crimen, judgment, bor., Eng. critic, hypocrite], separate, pick out, choose; decide, judge, consider.

div.head: κριός
div.p: -οῦ, ram. |

div.head: κρίσις
div.p: -εως, ἡ [κρίνω bor., Eng. crisis ], decision, judgment, trial.

div.head: κρούω
div.p: κρούσω, ἔκρουσα, -κέκρουκα, -κέκρουμαι and -κέκρουσμαι, -εκρούσθην, strike, beat, rattle.

div.head: κρύπτω
div.p: κρύψω, ἔκρυψα, κέκρυμμαι, ἐκρύφθην [bor., Eng. crypt, cryptogram, grotto (through Italian) ], hide, conceal, keep secret, with two accs.

div.head: κτάομαι
div.p: κτήσομαι, ἐκτησάμην, κέκτημαι, ἐκτήθην, get, acquire, accomplish; pf., have acquired, hence, have, possess.

div.head: κτείνω
div.p: κτενῶ, ἔκτεινα, -έκτονα, kill, slay.

div.head: κτῆμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [κτάομαι], piece of property; pl. property.

div.head: κτῆνος
div.p: -ους, τό [κτάομαι], piece of property, consisting in early times chiefly of flocks and herds, hence domestic animal, pl., cattle, stock.

div.head: Κτησίας
div.p: -ου, Ctesias, a famous Greek physician and author, captured by the Persians in 415 B.C., and detained, though with high honor, as court physician to Darius II and his successor, Artaxerxes II. He wrote a history of Persia, known to us only through quotations by other writers.

div.head: Κύδνος
div.p: -ου, Cydnus, a stream flowing through Tarsus in Cilicia.

div.head: κύκλος
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. cycle, bicycle, cyclometer, cyclopedia], circle, ring, encircling wall; κύκλῳ, as adv., in a circle, round, all round.

div.head: κυκλόω
div.p: κυκλώσω, ἐκύκλωσα, κεκύκλωμαι, ἐκυκλώθην [κύκλος; bor., Eng. cyclone], encircle, surround.

div.head: κύκλωσις
div.p: -εως, ἡ [κυκλόω], an encircling; ὡς εἰς κύκλωσιν, with the intention of encircling them.

div.head: κυλινδέω
div.p: impf. ἐκυλίνδουν [bor., Eng. cylinder ], roll, roll down, pass., intr., roll.

div.head: Κύρειος
div.p: -α, -ον [Κῦρος], Cyréan, of or belonging to Cyrus. As subst., Cyréan, follower of Cyrus.

div.head: Κῦρος
div.p: -ου, Cyrus, (1) the founder of the Persian empire, Cyrus the Great, see Fig. 34, ἢ. (2) in the Anabasis commonly Cyrus the younger, son of Darius II, and brother of. Artaxerxes II, whom he tried to depose, leading against him a force of 100,000 Asiatics and 13,00Ὸ Greek mercenaries. His death at the battle of Cunaxa caused the failure of the expedition. See Introd. §§ 1-15.

div.head: κύων
div.p: κυνός, ὁ, ἡ [cogn., Lat. canis, dog, Eng. hound; bor., Eng. cynic, cynosure ], dog.

div.head: κωλύω
div.p: κωλύσω, etc., hinder, oppose, with inf. of action hindered; prevent or hinder from, with gen. of inf.; τὸ κωλῦον, as subst., the obstacle, the hindrance.

div.head: κώμαρχος
div.p: -ου [κώμη, ἄρχω, rule], village chief.

div.head: κώμη
div.p: -ῆς [cogn., Eng. home], unwalled village.

div.head: κωμήτης
div.p: -ου [κώμη], villager.

div.head: λαγχάνω
div.p: λήξομαι, ἔλαχον, εἴληχα, εἴληγμαι, ἐλήχθην, obtain by lot, obtain, get, with gen. or acc.

div.head: λαγώς
div.p: or λαγῶς, -ῶ or -ώ, ὁ, hare.

div.head: λάθρᾳ
div.p: [cp. λαθεῖν], adv., secretly, without the knowledve of, with gen.

div.head: Λακεδαιμόνιος
div.p: -α, -ον [Λακεδαίμων, Lacedaemon, Sparta], Lacedaemonian, Spartan. Masc. as subst., Spartan.

div.head: λάκκος
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. lacus, lake, whence is bor. Eng. lake], cistern, dug in the ground and plastered.

div.head: λακτίζω
div.p: λακτιῶ, ἐλάκτισα, λελάκτικα, ἐλακτίσθην, kick.

div.head: Λάκων
div.p: -ωνος, ὁ, Laconian, Spartan.

div.head: Λακωνικός
div.p: -ή, -όν [Λάκων; bor., Eng. laconic], Laconian, Spartan.

div.head: λαμβάνω
div.p: λήψομαι, ἔλαβον, εἴληφα, εἴλημμαι, ἐλήφθην [bor., Eng. catalepsy, epilepsy ], take, get, procure, receive, accept; find, catch, seize, capture, of want, befall, take part of or some of, with partit. gen.; take hold of, with acc. and partit. gen.; λαβών is often equiv. to ἔχων, with.

div.head: λαμπρότης
div.p: -τος, ἡ [λαμπρός, brilliant], brilliancy, splendor.

div.head: λάμπω
div.p: [bor., Eng. lamp], act. or mid., shine, blaze up.

div.head: λανθάνω
div.p: λήσω, ἔλαθον, λέληθα, λέλησμαι [bor., Eng. lethargy, Lethe], he hid, escape notice, be unseen, commonly used with a supplementary ptc., the ptc. being rendered by a finite verb, and λανθάνω by an adv. or phrase, as secretly, without attracting attention, τρεφόμενον ἐλάνθαvev, was secretly supported, 53, 26; with acc., λαθεῖν αὐτὸν ἀπελθών, to get away without his knowing it, 67, 26; ptc. λαθόντας, without being seen, 211, 18.

div.head: Λάρισα
div.p: -ης, Larisa, a ruined city on the Tigris, passed by the Ten Thousand; see on 164, 20. See Fig. 53, p. 165.

div.head: λέγω
div.p: λέξω, ἔλεξα, λέλεγμαι, ἐλέχθην; εἴρηκα (see εἴρω) is used for the pf, and εἶπον frequently for the aor.; say, speak, tell, report, abs. or with acc.; with dir. disc.; with indir. disc., commonly introduced by ὅτι or ὡς, sometimes expressed by inf.; mention, speak of, with acc., or acc. and ptc. with ὡς, 67, 11; act as spokesman, with dir. disc.; tell, bid, with inf.; in the pass. Greek prefers the pers. to the impers. constr., as λέγεται Ἀπόλλων ἐκδεῖραι, Apollo ts said to have flayed, though the impers. constr. occurs, as ἐλέγετο Κῦρον σνγγενέσθαι, it was said that Cyrus had intercourse; λεγόμενος, counted, reckoned, 80, 19.

div.head: λεῖος
div.p: -α, -ον [cogn., Lat. lévis, smooth], smooth; gently sloping.

div.head: λείπω
div.p: λείψω, ἔλιπον, λέλοιπα, λέλειμμαι, ἐλείφθην [cogn., Lat. linquo, leave, Eng. loan; bor., Eng. eclipse], leave, quit, abandon, Lat. relingud; pass., be left, remain, survive; be left behind.

div.head: Λεοντῖνος
div.p: -ου, Leontine, a native of Leontini, a city of eastern Sicily, the name of which survives in the modern Lentini.

div.head: λευκοθώραξ
div.p: -ᾶκος [λευκός, θώρᾶξ, corselet], adj., with white corselet.

div.head: λευκός
div.p: -ή, -όν [cogn., Lat. lux, Uighd, light, shine], bright, white.

div.head: Λεώνυμος
div.p: -ου, Leonymus, a private in the Greek army.

div.head: λήγω
div.p: λήξω, ἔληξα, end, abate.

div.head: λήζομαι
div.p: [λεία, booty], plunder, pillage.

div.head: λίθινος
div.p: -η, -ον [λίθος], of stone.

div.head: λίθος
div.p: -ον [bor., Eng. lithograph, monolith ], stone.

div.head: λιμός
div.p:
-ου, hunger, famine.
λινοῦς, -ῆ, -οῦν, contracted from λίνεος, -α, -ον [λίνον, linen, cogn., Lat. linum, flax], of linen.

div.head: λογίζομαι
div.p: λογιοῦμαι, ἐλογισάμην, λελόγισμαι, ἐλογίσθην [cp. λέγω], count, reckon, consider, suppose.

div.head: λόγος
div.p: -ου [λέγω; bor. Eng. logarithm, logomachy, theology, catalogue, dialogue], word, speech; debate, discussion, report, rumor; book, narrative, pl., words, conversation; εἰς λόγους ἔρχεσθαι, come to a conference, with dat. of person.

div.head: λόγχη
div.p: -ης, spear head, spear. See Introd. § 58, and Fig. 72, p. 218.

div.head: λοιδορέω
div.p: λοιδορήσω, etc. [λοίδορος, abusive], abuse, revile.

div.head: λοιπός
div.p: -ή, -όν [λείπω], left, remaining, λοιπόν μοι εἰπεῖν, it remains for me to say; ὁ λοιπός, the other; οἱ λοιποί, the rest, those who were left; τὴν λοιπὴν (sc. ὁδόν), the rest of the way; τὸ λοιπόν, as subst., the rest, as adv., the rest of the time, for the future.

div.head: Λουσιεύς
div.p: -έως, ὁ, Lusian, a native of Lusi, a town in northern Arcadia.

div.head: λόφος
div.p: -ου, crest, ridge, hill.

div.head: λοχαγία
div.p: -ας [λοχαγός], office of captain, captaincy.

div.head: λοχαγός
div.p: -ου [λόχος, ἄγω, lead], leader of a λόχος, captain. See Introd. § 56.

div.head: λόχος
div.p: -ου [cp. λέγω, in old meaning lay, mid., lie], ambush, men lying in ambush; company, normally, but not always, of 100 men. See Introd. § 56.

div.head: Λυδία
div.p: -ας, Lydia, a district in western Asia Minor, bordering on the Aegéan, part of the satrapy of Cyrus. Λύδιος, -α, -ον [Λυδός], of Lydia, Lydian.

div.head: Λυδός
div.p: -ου, Lydian, a native of Lydia.

div.head: Λύκαια
div.p: -ων, rd, the Lycaea, the festival of Lycaean Zeus, who was worshiped on Mt. Lycaeus, in the southwestern part of Arcadia. Athletic games were a feature of the festival.

div.head: Λυκάονες
div.p: -ων, οἱ, Lycainians, people of Lycania; they did not acknowledge the Persian sway and often raided the neighboring districts of the empire.

div.head: Λυκαονία
div.p: -ας, ἡ a district of Asia Minor, lying between Phrygia and Cilicia.

div.head: Λύκιος
div.p: -ου, Lycius, (1) a Syracusan; (2) an Athenian, chosen to command the cavalry of the Greeks on the retreat.

div.head: λυμαίνομαι
div.p: λυμανοῦμαι, ἐλυμηνάμην, λελύόμασμαι, ἐλυμάνθην [λύμη, outrage], outrage, ruin, spoil.

div.head: λυπέω
div.p: λυπήσω, etc. [λύπη], give pain to, grieve, annoy, harass.

div.head: λύπη
div.p: -ης, pain, grief.

div.head: λυπηρός
div.p: -ά, -ὁν [λύπη], painful, troublesome, annoying.

div.head: λύω
div.p: λύσω, ἔλυσα, λέλυκα, λέλυμαι, ἐλύθην [cogn., Lat. luo, loose, Eng. loose, lose; bor., Eng. analysis], loose, release, unbind, untie, break down, destroy, remove; break, violate; pay, be profitable (poetic use = λυσιτελεῖν), 172, 25.

div.head: λωτοφάγοι
div.p: -ων, of [λωτός, lotus, ἔφαγον, see ἐσθίω, eat], lotus eaters. The lotus, which may have been one of the jujube fruits still used in northern Africa, was said to be so delicious that all who ate it forgot home and friends.

div.head: λωφάω
div.p: λωφήσω, ἐλώφησα, λελώφηκα, abate, cease. λῴων, λῷον, gen. -ovos (used as comp. of ἀγαθός), better, preferable.

div.head: μά
div.p: (cp. μέν and μήν], intensive adv., surely, used in neg. oaths, with acc., μὰ τοὺς θεούς, no, by the gods}

div.head: Μαίανδρος
div.p: -ου [ bor., Eng. meander], Maeander, a river of οὗ Minor, entering the Aegean near Milétus; famous for its winding course.

div.head: μαίνομαι
div.p: μανοῦμαι, μέμηνα, éudvny [cp. μανία, madness, whence is borrowed Eng. mania], be mad or insane, aor., go mad.

div.head: μακαρίζω
div.p: ἐμακάρισα, ἐμακαρίσθην [μάκαρ, happy], count happy, consider fortunate.

div.head: μακαριστός
div.p: -ή, -όν [μακαρίζω], deemed happy, enviable, an object of envy.

div.head: μακρός
div.p: -ά, -όν [bor., Eng. macron, macrocosm], long; paxpdv μακράν (sc. ὁδόν), a long distance; similarly μακροτέραν, by a longer route, μακρὸν ἦν, it was too far, with inf.; μακρότερον, adv., farther.

div.head: Μάκρωνες
div.p: -ων, οἱ, Macrénes, a tribe south of Trapézus, the exact location of which is uncertain.

div.head: μάλα
div.p: by elision μάλ᾽, adv., very, very much, comp. μᾶλλον, more, rather, betters sup. μάλιστα, most, preeminently, specially, best, for the most part; ὡς μάλιστα, ws μάλιστα ἐδύνατο, ᾗ δυνατὸν μάλιστα, ὡς οἷόν τε μάλιστα, as much (as well) as possible; ὥς τις καὶ ἄλλος μάλιστα ἀνθρώπων, as well as anybody else in the world.

div.head: μανθάνω
div.p: μαθήσομαι, ἔμαθον, μεμάθηκα bor. Eng. mathematics, philomath], learn, find out.

div.head: μαντεία
div.p: -ας [cp. μάντις; bor., Eng. chiromancy, necromancy], prphecy, response.

div.head: μάντις
div.p: -εως, ὁ [μαίνομαι], ], one possessed or frenzied by divine power, prophet, seer, soothsayer, securing omens from the observation of the vitals of sacrificed victims. See Introd. p. 45, footnote.

div.head: Μάρδοι
div.p: -ων, οἱ, Mardi, a tribe in Armenia.

div.head: μάρσιπος
div.p: -ου [bor., Lat. marsupium, pouch, whence Eng. marsupial], pouch, bag.

div.head: Μαρσύας
div.p: -ου, Marsyas, (1) a Phrygian deity; according to the Greek story he was a Phrygian satyr, who was beaten by Apollo, the god of music, in a contest of musical skill, and flayed as a penalty for his presumption in venturing to vie with the god; see Fig. 12, p. 57; (2) a river emptying into the Maeander near Celaenae.

div.head: μαρτυρέω
div.p: μαρτυρήσω, etc. [μάρτυς, witness; bor., Eng. martyr], be a witness, testify.

div.head: μαρτύριον
div.p: -ου [μάρτυς, witness], evidence, proof.

div.head: Μάσκας
div.p: -α (Doric gen.), Mascas, a canal about Corsote; it seems to have been taken for a river by Xenophon, 76, 15.

div.head: μαστεύω
div.p: poetic, seek, strive. μαστίγόω, μαστιγώσω, ἐμαστιγώθην [μάστιξ], whip, flog.

div.head: μάστιξ
div.p: -ιγος, ἡ, whip, ὑπὸ μαστίγων, under the lash.

div.head: μαστός
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. mastodon], breast, nipple; round hill.

div.head: μάχαιρα
div.p: -ας [μάχομαι], cutlass, saber. See Introd. § 58, end, and Fig. 31, p. 89.

div.head: μαχαίριον
div.p: -ου [diminutive of μάχαιρα], knife, dirk.

div.head: μάχη
div.p: -ns [μάχομαι; bor., Eng. logomachy ], fight, battle.

div.head: μάχομαι
div.p: μαχοῦμαι, ἐμαχεσάμην, μεμάχημαι, fight, abs. or with dat.; fight in person, go into the battle, 85, 8. μεγαλοπρεπῶς [μεγαλοπρεπής (μέγας.

div.head: πρέπω
div.p: be fitting), befitting a great man, magnificent], adv., magnificently, with princely generosity. μεγάλως [μέγας], adv., greatly, grossly.

div.head: Μεγαρεύς
div.p: -éws, ὁ, Megarian, a citizen of Megara, the chief city of the state of Megaris, situated on the isthmus about midway between Corinth and Athens.

div.head: μέγας
div.p: μεγάλη, μέγα, comp. μείζων, sup. μέγιστος [cogn., Lat. magnus, great, Eng. much, mickle, muckle; bor., Eng. megacephalic, megalomania, megaphone ], greats, large. Idiomatic uses: weighty, important, valuable, fine; powerful, loud;

div.head: μέγας
div.p: βασιλεύς, the great king of Persia; μείζονα ἢ ὡς, too great to be; τὰ μεγάλα, affairs of state, τὰ μεγάλα εὖ ποιεῖν, do great services; βλάψαι μεγάλα, do great harm. Neut. acc. as adv., μέγα, greatly ,; sup. τὸ μέγιστον, chiefly; πρῶτον καὶ μέγιστον, first and foremost; οἱ μέγιστα δυνάμενοι, the most powerful; ὅσον ἐδύναντο μέγιστον, as loud as they could.

div.head: Μεγαφέρνης
div.p: -ου, Megaphernes, a Persian noble.

div.head: μέγεθος
div.p: -ους, τό [μέγας], greatness, size, width.

div.head: μεθίστημι
div.p: [ἴστημι, cause to stand, self], set elsewhere, remove; intr., 2 aor., withdraw, retire; mid., cause to withdraw.

div.head: Μεθυδριεύς
div.p: -έως, ὁ, Methydrian, a citizen of Methydrium, a little town in central Arcadia.

div.head: μεθύω
div.p: [μέθυ, wine; cogn., Eng. mead; bor., Eng. amethyst], be drunk.

div.head: μειράκιον
div.p: -ov [μεῖραξ, lass], lad, boy, of 14 to 20 years.

div.head: μείων
div.p: μεῖον, gen. μείονος [cogn., Lat. minuo, lessen, minor, /ess, bor., Eng. Miocene] (used as comp. of

div.head: μικρός
div.p: and ὀλίγος), smaller, less, fewer. Neut. acc. as adv., less; μεῖον ἔχειν, have the worst of it, be worsted.

div.head: μελανία
div.p: -ας [μέλας], blackness.

div.head: μέλας
div.p: μέλαινα, μέλαν [bor., Eng. melancholy, Melanesia ], black, dark.

div.head: μέλει
div.p: μελήσει, ἐμέλησε, μεμέληκε, impers., it is a care, it concerns, with dat.; ἐμοὶ μελήσει, I well take care, I will see to it, with ὅπως and fut. indic. or opt.

div.head: μελετάω
div.p: μελετήσω, ἐμελέτησα, μεμελέτηκα [μέλει], care for, practice.

div.head: μελετηρός
div.p: -ά, -όν [μελετάω], diligent or assiduous in practicing.

div.head: μελίνη
div.p: -ης, millet, a kind of grain; pl., millet fields.

div.head: μέλλω
div.p: μελλήσω, ἐμέλλησα, be about to, be going to, expect, intend, be likely to, with inf.; intend, with acc.; delay.

div.head: μέμφομαι
div.p: μέμψομαι, ἐμεμψάμην and ἐμέμφθην, blame, find fault with, with acc.

div.head: μέν
div.p:
(a weak form of μήν), postpositive adv., commonly correlative with a following δέ, or sometimes with ἀλλά, ἔπειτα, or μέντοι it may occasionally be rendered by on the one hand, and δέ by on the other, but
far more frequently it is to be translated only by emphasizing the word with which it belongs, Idiomatic uses: ὁ μὲν, ὁ δέ, one... the other, pl. some... others, see also ὁ; ἀλλὰ μέν, but in point of fact, οὐ μὲν δή, and yet of course ... not, ταῦτα μὲν δή, THIS then.

div.head: μέντοι
div.p: [μέν + τοί, you know), adv. and conj., (1) intensive, moreover, surely, (2) oftener adversative, however, though, yet, nevertheless.

div.head: μένω
div.p: μενῶ, ἔμεινα, μεμένηκα [cogn., Lat. maneo, remain], remain, stay, wait, Lat. waned, remain in force; transitive, wait for, Lat. αἴ.

div.head: Μένων
div.p: -ωνος, ὁ, Menon, a general in Cyrus’s Greek army.

div.head: μέρος
div.p: -ους, τό, part, portion, detachment; specimen, sample; ἐν τῷ μέρει, each in turn.

div.head: μεσημβρία
div.p: -ας [μέσος, ἡμέρα, day], midday; hence from the position of the sun at noon, the south.

div.head: μέσος
div.p: -η, -ον [cogn., Lat. medius, middle; bor., Eng. Mesopotamia, Mesozoic ], rarely in attributive position, middle, in the middle, at the center; commonly in pred. position, the middle of, the midst of; μέσαι νύκτες, midnight, Neut. as subst., with or without τό, the middle, the space between, the center of an army; μέσον ἡμέρας =

div.head: μεσημβρία
div.p: midday; ἐκ τοῦ μέσου, from between them, 80, 2; διὰ μέσου, ἐν μέσῳ, between, ἐν μέσῳ τῆς ὁδοῦ, flowing atrectly across thetr road, 140, 8; ἐν μέσῳ κεῖται «ον ... ἆθλα, are offered for competition as prises, 144, 22.

div.head: Μέσπιλα
div.p: Μespila, the modern Kuyunjik, part of the ruins of Ninéveh. See on οὐ 8.

div.head: μεστός
div.p: -ή, -όν, full, filled with, full of, with gen.

div.head: μετά
div.p: by elision and euphony μετ’ or μεθ᾽ [bor., Eng. metaphor, method], prep. with gen. or acc., among. With gen. (among), with, along with (Xenophon is the only Attic writer who employs μετά with the gen. less frequently than with the dat.); by means of, with the aid of. With acc. (to the midst of), after, next to; μεθ᾽ ἡμέραν, after daybreak, by day, In cpds. μετά usually denotes participation or change, more commonly the latter; cp. Eng. words beginning with met(a)-, as metal, metamorphosis, metaphysics, metempsychosis, meteor, metonymy, or meth-, as Methodist, also see above.

div.head: μεταγιγνώσκω
div.p: [γιγνώσκω, think], change one’s mind.

div.head: μεταδίδωμι
div.p: [δίδωμι, give], distribute among, share with, with dat. of person and gen. or acc. of thing.

div.head: μεταμέλει
div.p: [μέλει, it is a care], impers., it is a care afterwards, it repents one, one repents or is sorry, with dat.; μεταμέλει σοι, you are sorry.

div.head: μεταξύ
div.p: [μετά], adv., in the midst; μεταξὺ ὑπολαβών, interrupting; as prep. with gen., between.

div.head: μετάπεμπτος
div.p: -ον (verbal of

div.head: πέμπω)
div.p: μεταsent for, summoned.

div.head: μεταπέμπω
div.p: [πέμπω, send], send for or after; usually mid., send for to come to oneself, summon.

div.head: μέτεστι
div.p:
[εἰμί, be], impers., there is a
share, with dat. of person and gen. of thing; οὐδενὸς ἡμῖν μετείη, we had no share.

div.head: μετέωρος
div.p: -ον [ἀείρω, raise; bor., Eng. meteor], raised from the ground.

div.head: μετρέω
div.p: ἐμέτρησα, ἐμετρήθην [μέτρον], measure. μετρίως [μέτριος, moderate], adv., with moderation, moderately.

div.head: μέτρον
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. metior, measure, bor., Eng. meter, symmetry], measure.

div.head: μέχρι
div.p: (1) adv., up to, as far as, with another adv. or with gen.; μέχρι

div.head: οὗ
div.p: to where, (2) conj., until, with indic., or ἄν and subj.

div.head: μή
div.p: adv., not, the neg. in expressions of the will and thought, as οὐ is the neg. in statements of fact; consequently it is used in neg. commands or in exhortations; regularly with the inf., except in indir. disc. in expressions which would have

div.head: οὐ
div.p: in dir. disc.; with the inf. depending on a verb of escaping or hindering, from, in conditions and conditional rel. clauses and with circumstantial ptcs. implying condition; εἰ μή, tf not, except, unless; εἰ δὲ μή, otherwise; in clauses of purpose; after verbs of fearing, expressed or implied, that, lest, μὴ

div.head: οὐ
div.p: that not, οὐ μή with subj., as a strong fut. neg. 112, 153 μὴ

div.head: οὐ
div.p: with inf. after an expression of shame or in a question containing the idea of hindering, not, from, 116, 18; 143, 2. The same usages appear with the cpds. of οὗ

div.head: μηδαμῶς
div.p: [μηδαμός, not one], adv., by mo means, on no account.

div.head: μηδέ
div.p: [μή + δέ], conj. or adv., and not, but not, nor, not even, not either.

div.head: Μήδεια
div.p: -ας, Medea, wife of Astyages, last king of the Medes.

div.head: μηδείς
div.p: μηδεμία, μηδέν [μηδέ + εἷς, one], not one, no one, nobody, nothing.

div.head: μηδέποτε
div.p: [μηδέ + ποτέ, ever], adv., never.

div.head: Μηδία
div.p: Media, the name used by Xenophon for Assyria, the district lying along the Tigris above Babylon; it was conquered by the Medes about 606 B.C. τὸ Μηδίας τεῖχος, the wall of Media; its exact position cannot be determined from existing ruins. It ran from the Euphrates, near Pylae, northeast to the Tigris, and was built by the Babylonians perhaps early in the sixth century B.C., as a defense against the invading Medes. Μῆδοι, -ων, οἱ, of, Medes, inhabitants of Media.

div.head: μηκέτι
div.p: [μή + ἔτι, still, with κ inserted on the analogy of οὐκέτι], adv., not again, no longer.

div.head: μῆκος
div.p: -ους, τό [cp. μακρός, long], length.

div.head: μήν
div.p: [cp. μέν], intensive or adversative postpositive adv., surely, yet, however, though, sometimes with γέ, which is translated only by emphasis; καὶ μήν, and yet; ἀλλὰ why, but surely, but still, in fact, οὐδὲ why, and surely not; ἦ μήν, on one’s word of honor.

div.head: μείς
div.p: μηνός, ὁ [cogn, Lat. ménsis, month; Eng. moon, month ], month; κατὰ μῆνα, month by month, monthly.

div.head: μηνύω
div.p: μηνύσω, etc., reveal, inform against.

div.head: μήποτε
div.p: [μή + ποτέ, ever], adv., never.

div.head: μήπω
div.p: [μή + πώ, yet], adv., not yet.

div.head: μήτε
div.p:
[μή + τέ, and], conj., and not,
Lat. neque; μήτε... μήτε, neither ... nor, Lat. neque... neque, μήτε . τε, not only not... but also, Lat. aeque... et.

div.head: μήτηρ
div.p: μητρός, ἡ [cogn., Lat. mater, Eng. mother; bor., Eng. metropolis], mother.

div.head: μηχανάομαι
div.p: μηχανήσομαι, ἐμηχανησάμην, μεμηχάνημαι [μηχανή], contrive.

div.head: μηχανή
div.p: -ῆς [bor Lat. machina, machine (whence is bor. Eng. machine), Eng. mechanic], machine; contrivance, device, means.

div.head: Μίδας
div.p: -ου, Midas, a mythical king of Phrygia, proverbial for his ‘ golden touch,' which he gained as a reward for releasing the satyr Silénus after having entrapped him.

div.head: Μιθραδάτης
div.p: -ου, Mithridates, a trusted friend of Cyrus, who transferred his allegiance to Artaxerxes after the battle of Cunaxa.

div.head: μικρός
div.p: -άδη, -όν [cp. Eng. microscope, microphone, microbe ], small, little, weak, Neut. acc. as adv., barely, narrowly. Neut. as subst., a short distance, a little while.

div.head: Μιλήσιος
div.p: -α, -ον [Μίλητος], Milesian, of Miletus. As subst., masc. pl., Milesians; fem. sing., Milesian woman.

div.head: Μίλητος
div.p: -ου, ἡ, Miletus, a prominent Greek city of Ionia, south of Ephésus.

div.head: Μιλτοκύθης
div.p: -ου, Miltocythes, a Thracian cavalry commander, who deserted from the Greeks to the Persians after the battle of Cunaxa.

div.head: μιμέομαι
div.p: μιμήσομαι, ἐμιμησάμην, μεμίμημαι, ἐμιμήθην [μῖμος, actor; bor., Eng. mimic, pantomime ], imitate.

div.head: μιμνῄσκω
div.p: μνήσω, ἔμνησα, μέμνημαι, ἐμνήσθην [cogn., Lat. memini, remember, Eng. mind], act., remind, not used in prose, cp. ἀναμιμνῄσκω; mid. and pass., remind oneself, remember, the pf. μέμνημαι being used as pres., like Lat. memini, μεμνήσομαι as fut., and ἐμνήσθην as aor.

div.head: μισθοδοσία
div.p: -ας [μισθός, δίδωμι, give], payment of wages.

div.head: μισθοδότης
div.p: -ου [μισθός, δίδωμι, give], one who pays wages, paymaster.

div.head: μισθός
div.p: -ου, wages, pay, reward.

div.head: μισθοφόρος
div.p: -ον [μισθός, φέρω, dear], drawing wages. Masc. pl. as subst., mercenaries.

div.head: μισθόω
div.p: μισθώσω, etc. [molds], hire out, let, mid., hire; pass., be hired.

div.head: μνᾶ
div.p: μνᾶς, mina, a sum of money (not a coin), equiv. to 100 drachmas or about $18.

div.head: μνημονεύω
div.p: μνημονεύσω, etc. [μνήμων, mindful, cp. μιμνῄσκω; bor., Eng. mnemonic], recall, recollect, with gen.

div.head: μνησικακέω
div.p: μνησικακήσω, ἐμνησικάκησα [cp. μιμνῄσκω, κακός, wrong], remember past injuries against one, bear a grudge, with dat.

div.head: μόλις
div.p: adv., with difficulty.

div.head: μολυβδίς
div.p: -ίδος, ἡ [μόλυβδος], leaden ball, bullet for a sling. See Fig. 51, p. 163.

div.head: μόλυβδος
div.p: -ου, lead.

div.head: μοναχῇ
div.p: [dat. fem. of μοναχός (from

div.head: μόνος)
div.p: solitary, bor., Eng. monk], adv., alone, only; ᾗπερ μοναχῇ, where alone.

div.head: μόνος
div.p: -η, -ον [bor., Eng. monad, monogamy, monogram, monopoly, monotheist], alone, only, Neut. acc. as adv., οὐ μόνον... ἀλλὰ καί, not only ... but also, Lat. non solum ον Sed etiam.

div.head: μόσχειος
div.p: -ον [μόσχος, calf], of a calf; κρέα μόσχεια, veal.

div.head: μύζω
div.p: suck.

div.head: Μυρίανδος
div.p: -ου, ἡ, Myriandus, a Syrian coast city.

div.head: μυριάς
div.p: -άδος, ἡ [μυρίος; bor., Eng. myriad], the number ten thousand, myriad.

div.head: μυρίος
div.p: -α, -ον, countless; pl. with changed accent, μύριοι, -αι, -α, as definite numeral, ten thousand; so in the sing., with collective noun, 85, 15.

div.head: μύρον
div.p: -ου, fragrant oil, perfume.

div.head: Μύσιος
div.p: -α, -ον [Μυσός], Mysian, belonging to Mysia, a country in the northwestern part of Asia Minor.

div.head: Μυσοί
div.p: -ῶν, Mysians, people of Mysia, hostile to Persia.

div.head: μυχός
div.p: -00, nook, recess. μῶρος, -α, -ον [bor., Eng. sophomore ], stupid, foolish.

div.head: νάπη
div.p: -1s, wooded vale, dell, glen.

div.head: ναύαρχος
div.p: -ου [ναῦς, ἄρχω, command ], commander of ships, admiral.

div.head: ναῦς
div.p: νεώς, ἡ [cogn., Lat. navis, ship; bor., Eng. nausea], sip, including both merchantmen (ὁλκάδες), highhulled and broad of beam, and the long, low, and comparatively narrow men of war (νῆες μακραί), with a ram on or just below the water line. The prevailing type of war vessel in Xenophon’s time was the trireme (see τριήρης). Both merchantmen and men of war were steered by two oars, one on either side of the stern post. The trading ships were propelled by sails, and so were the fighting ships when not in action or in haste; but the trained crews of the vessels of war were capable of propelling them by oars at a very respectable speed, even for considerable distances. See Fig. 19, p. 69.

div.head: ναυσίπορος
div.p: -ον [ναῦς, πόρος, passage], passable for ships, navigable.

div.head: ναυτικός
div.p: -ή, -όν [ναῦς; bor., Eng. nautical, nautilus, Argonaut], naval, nautical.

div.head: νεανίσκος
div.p: -ου [diminutive of veavias, young man], youth, young man, applicable from boyhood up to forty years of age; contemptuously, my young fellow, 108, 8.

div.head: νεκρός
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. nex, death, neco, kill, bor., Eng. necrology, necropolis], dead body; pl., the dead.

div.head: νέμω
div.p: νεμῶ, Everua, -νενέμηκα, νενέμημαι, ἐνεμήθην, distribute; drive to pasture; mid., go to pasture, feed, raze; pass., νέμεται αἰξί, is pastured with goats.

div.head: νεόδαρτος
div.p: -ον [νέος, newly δέρω, flay], flayed.

div.head: νέος
div.p: -α, -ον, comp. vεώτερος, sup. νεώτατος [cogn., Lat. novus, new, Eng. new; bor., Eng. neologism, neolithic, neophyte], vourzg.

div.head: νευρά
div.p: -ᾶς [cp. νεῦρον], cord of sinew, bowstring.

div.head: νεῦρον
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. nervus (whence is bor. Eng. nerve), sinew, bor., Eng. neuralgia, neurasthenia, neuritis], sinew, cord.

div.head: νεφέλη
div.p: -ης [cogn., Lat. nebula, mist; bor., Eng. nepheloscope ], cloud.

div.head: νέω
div.p: νεύσομαι and νευσοῦμαι, -ένευσα, -νένευκα [cogn., Lat. no, swim], Swim.

div.head: νεωστί
div.p: [ νέος], adv., recertly.

div.head: νή
div.p: intensive adv., used in affirmative oaths, with acc., νὴ Δία, yes, by Zeus!

div.head: νῆσος
div.p: -ου, ἡ [νέω, swim, so νῆσος originally = floating land; bor., Eng. Polynesia, Melanesia ], island.

div.head: Νίκαρχος
div.p: -ου, (1) an Arcadian private in the Greek army; (2) an Arcadian captain, who deserted the Greeks.

div.head: νικάω
div.p: νικήσω, etc. [νίκη], conquer, surpass, outdo; often pres. with pf. force, have conquered, be victorious; μάχην νικᾶν, be victorious in battle.

div.head: νίκη
div.p: -ης [bor., Eng. Nicholas, Eunice, French Nice], victory; ἐπὶ νίκῃ, if a victory were at stake, 77, 22.

div.head: Νικόμαχος
div.p: -ου, Nicomachus, a leader of light infantry in the Greek army.

div.head: νοέω
div.p: νοήσω, etc. [νοῦς], perceive.

div.head: νόθος
div.p: ob-η, -ον, bastard, illegitimate.

div.head: νομή
div.p: -ἣς [νέμω; bor., Eng. nomad], a herd in pasture, herd.

div.head: νομίζω
div.p: νομιῶ, ἐνόμισα, νενόμικα, νενόμισμαι, ἐνομίσθην [νόμος], regard as a custom, consider, deem, believe, think, with acc. and inf., with two accs.; imperative, be assured, understand, 80, 8; pass., be customary, be usual, be considered.

div.head: νόμιμος
div.p: -η, -ov [νόμος], customary, lawful.

div.head: νόμος
div.p: -ου [νέμω, distribute, bor., Eng. astronomy, economy, Deuteronomy ], usage, custom, law.

div.head: νοῦς
div.p: νοῦ [cp. νοέω], mind, thought; τὸν νοῦν προσέχειν, pay attention, turn one’s attention, be attentive, with dat.; ἐν νῷ ἔχειν, purpose, intend.

div.head: νυκτερεύω
div.p: ἐνυκτέρευσα [νύκτερος, by night], spend the night, bivouac.

div.head: νύκτωρ
div.p: [νύξ], adv., 22 the night, at night, Lat. nocti.

div.head: νῦν
div.p: [cogn., Lat. nunc, now, Eng. now ], adv., now, at this time, ἔτι

div.head: νῦν
div.p: even to this day; τὸ νῦν εἶναι, for the present.

div.head: νύξ
div.p: νυκτός, ἡ [cogn., Lat. nox, Eng. night], night, νυκτός, by night; of a particular night, τῆς νυκτός, during or in the night; μέσαι νύκτες, midnight.

div.head: Ξανθικλῆς
div.p: -έους, ὁ, Xanthicles, elected a general in the Greek army.

div.head: Ξενίας
div.p: -ου, Xenias, a Greek general in the service of Cyrus, who deserted at Myriandus.

div.head: ξενικός
div.p: -ή, -όν [ξένος], foreign. Neut. as subst. (sc. στράτευμα), mercenary force.

div.head: ξένιος
div.p: -α, -ον [ξένος], of foreigners or guest friends; Ζεὺς ξένιος, see Ζεύς. Neut. pl. as subst., gifts of friendship or of hospitality.

div.head: ξένος
div.p: -ου, foreigner, stranger; one connected with another by the ties of hospitality, usually as a guest, but sometimes as host; as these ties were hereditary, one might be a

div.head: ξένος
div.p: who had never in his own person been either guest or host. There is no exact Eng. equivalent of the term, and the word guest friend has been coined to translate it; also a soldier serving in a foreign state for pay, mercenary.

div.head: Ξενοφῶν
div.p: -ῶντος, ὁ, Xenophon of Athens, author of the Anabasis. Accompanying the expedition as friend of Proxénus, one of the Greek generals, he became the leader of the Greeks after the treacherous capture of their officers at the Zapatas. See Introd. §§ 21-23, 27 ff.

div.head: Ξέρξης
div.p:
-ου, Xerxes, King of Persia
from 485 to 465 B.C., best known for his ill-starred expedition against Greece in 480-479.

div.head: ξεστός
div.p: -ή, -όν (verbal of ξέω, polish), polished.

div.head: ξηραίνω
div.p: ξηρανῶ, ἐξήρᾶνα, ἐξήρασμαι, ἐξηράνθην [ξηρός], dry.

div.head: ξηρός
div.p: -ά, -όν, dry.

div.head: ξίφος
div.p: -ους, τό, sword. See Introd. § 58, and Figs. 11, 39, pp. 55, 111.

div.head: ξυήλη
div.p: -ης: [ξύω, scrape, cp. ξεστός], curved dagger. See Introd. § 58.

div.head: ξυλίζομαι
div.p: [ξύλον], gather wood.

div.head: ξύλινος
div.p: -η, -ον [ξύλον], of wood, wooden.

div.head: ξύλον
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. xylophone], wood, pole; pl. wood, firewood, timbers.

div.head: ὁ
div.p: ἡ, τό, definite article, the; originally a dem. pron., the force of which is to some degree retained in ὁ μὲν... ὁ δέ, one... the other, οἱ μὲν...οἱ δέ, some... others, τὰ μὲν... τὰ δέ, now... now, τῇ μὲν... τῇ δέ, in one respect... in another, here ... there, and in ὁ δέ without preceding μέν, indicating change of subject, and he, but he, οἱ δέ, but they, and some, also without following δέ, οἱ μέν, they, τὰ μέν, some, τὰ μὲν ἔπαθεν, he received some wounds, The use of the definite article in Greek corresponds in general to the Eng. usage, but it is often found where we should omit it, as with proper names when they have been previously mentioned or are well known, with names of countries, abstract nouns, approximate round numbers, an inf. used as a noun, and dem. prons. The article is sometimes omitted contrary to the Eng. usage, as with πρεσβύτερος, 51, 2; so with names of peoples and of heavenly bodies, with βασιλεύς meaning the king of Persia, and with ordinals. Other noteworthy uses are: for possessive pron. when the context makes it clear; the famous, the well-known, Lat. ille, 57, 8; the proper or deserved, 68, 18; distributively, each, a, as τοῦ μηνὸς τῷ στρατιώτῃ, a month to each soldier, 68, 24; often used without a subst., when limited by an adj., ptc., gen., prepositional phrase or an adv., as τὸν βουλόμενον, any one who wished, οἱ συνεπόμενοι, those who had accompanied them; τὰ Κύρου πρὸς ἡμᾶς, the relations of Cyrus to us; οἱ σὺν αὐτῷ, οἱ ἐκείνου, his men, οἱ οἴκοι, the people at home, τὰ περὶ Προξένου, the news about Proxenus, with an abs. inf., τὸ κατὰ τοῦτον εἶναι, so far as this man is concerned, 82, 24.

div.head: ὀβολός
div.p: -ου, obol, an Athenian coin, worth about three cents.

div.head: ὀγδοήκοντα
div.p: [ὀκτώ, eight; cogn., Lat. octoginta, eighty], indecl., eighty.

div.head: ὄγδοος
div.p: -ή, -ον [ὀκτώ, eight], eighth.

div.head: ὅδε
div.p: ἥδε, τόδε [ὁ as dem. pron. + -δε, here], dem. pron., this, this very, referring to what is close at hand, but more emphatic than οὗτος and often accompanied by a gesture; often referring to what follows (cp.

div.head: οὗτος)
div.p: the following, τάδε, as follows.

div.head: ὁδοποιέω
div.p: ὡδοποίησα, ὡδοποίημαι [ ὁδοποιός (ὁδός, ποιέω, make), pioneer), make a road, repair a road.

div.head: ὁδός
div.p: -ου ἡ [bor., Eng. exodus, method, Methodist], way, road, route; expedition, march, journey; way, means, distance; τὴν ταχίστην ὁδόν, by the quickest way.

div.head: ὅθεν
div.p: [ὅς + -θεν, from], rel. adv., whence, from which, from whom.

div.head: ὅθενπερ
div.p: [ὅθεν + intensive πέρ], rel. adv., more precise than ὅθεν, the very place from which.

div.head: οἷ
div.p: enclitic, reflexive pron., see οὗ.

div.head: οἶδα
div.p: 2 pf. with pres. meaning, fut. εἴσομαι, plupf. ᾔδη and ᾔδειν as impf. [root ϝιδ, whence εἶδον (see ὁράω), saw, cogn, Lat. video, see, Eng. wit, wise, old Eng. wot], know, understand, with acc., ὅτι, nom. or acc. ptc., indir. question; χάριν εἰδέναι, be grateful; ἑκασταχόσε εἰδέναι, know the way tn every direction; εἰδώς, from actual knowledge, 83, 7.

div.head: οἴκαδε
div.p: [οἶκος + -de, -ward], homeward, home.

div.head: οἰκεῖος
div.p: -α, -ον [οἶκος], of one’s house, related; friendly, intimate. pl. as subst., kinsmen, relatives.

div.head: οἰκέτης
div.p: -ου [οἶκος], member of one’s household, pl., family, servants, slaves.

div.head: οἰκέω
div.p: οἰκήσω, etc. [οἶκος; bor., Eng. ecumenical] (have one’s house), live, live in, inhabit, with acc.; pass., be inhabited, be situated; πόλις

div.head: οἰκουμένη
div.p: inhabited city, distinguished from πόλις ἐρήμη, deserted city.

div.head: οἰκία
div.p: -ας [οἶκος], house.

div.head: οἰκοδομέω
div.p: οἰκοδομήσω, etc. [οἰκοδόμος

div.head: (οἶκος
div.p: δέμω, build), builder; cogn., Lat. domus, house], build a house, build.

div.head: οἴκοθεν
div.p: [οἶκος + -θεν, from], adv., from home.

div.head: οἴκοι
div.p: [οἶκος], adv., at home, ol οἴκοι, the people at home, τὰ οἴκοι, life at home.

div.head: οἰκονόμος
div.p: -ου [οἶκος, νέμω, distribute, adv., manage; bor., Eng. economics, economy ], house steward, manager.

div.head: οἶκος
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. vicus, village, Eng. -wick, -wich in names of towns, as Berwick, Ipswich ], house, home.

div.head: οἰκτίρω
div.p: ᾧκτίρα [οἶκτος, pity], pity.

div.head: οἶνος
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. vinum, wine, whence is bor. wine], wine.

div.head: οἰνοχόος
div.p: -ου [οἶνος, χέω, pour], wine pourer, cupbearer.

div.head: οἴομαι
div.p: and οἶμαι, οἰήσομαι, φήθην, suppose, think, fancy, Lat. opinor.

div.head: οἷος
div.p: -α, -ον [cp. ποῖος, what sort of], rel, adj., of which sort, Lat. gudiis; with correlative τοιοῦτος, such, expressed or implied, such as, proper, with inf., 116, 23; in indir. questions, of what sort, what sort of, what.

div.head: ἐν
div.p: οἵοις, in what straits; οἷόν τε (with or without a form of ἐστί), it is possible, with inf.; ὡς οἷόν τε μάλιστα ... as... possible, 124, 17; strengthening a sup., οἷον χαλεπώτατον, as inaccessible as possible. Neut. acc. as adv., as, with causal ptc., because. οἷόσπερ, οἵάπερ, οἷόνπερ [οἷος + intensive πέρ]. rel. adj., more precise than οἷος, just such as.

div.head: οἷς
div.p: οἰός, ἡ [cogn., Lat. ovis, sheep, Eng. ewe], sheep. οἱστός, -οῦ, arrow. Rare in Attic for τόξευμα.;

div.head: Οἰταῖος
div.p: -ου, Oetaean, a native of the district round Mt. Oeta in Thessaly.

div.head: οἴχομαι
div.p:
οἰχήσομαι, pres. with pf. meaning (cp. ἥκω), have gone, be gone, often with ptc. of manner, as οἴχονται διώκοντες, they were gone in
pursuit, the ptc. frequently contains the main idea, as ᾧχετο ἀπελαύνων, he rode away; be missing, be dead (cp. the Eng. euphemism ‘pass away’).

div.head: οἰωνός
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. avis, bird], bird of prey, then, since the cries and movements of such birds were supposed to indicate the will of the gods, sign, omen. See p. 45, footnote.

div.head: ὀκνέω
div.p: ὀκνήσω, ὥκνησα [ὄκνος], shrink from, hesitate, with inf.; fear, dread, with μή and subj. or opt.

div.head: ὄκνος
div.p: -ου, hesitation, reluctance.

div.head: ὀκτακόσιοι
div.p: -αι, -α [ὀκτώ], eight hundred.

div.head: ὀκτώ
div.p: [cogn., Lat. octo, eight, Eng. eight; bor., Eng. octagon, octopus], indecl., eight.

div.head: ὀκτωκαίδεκα
div.p: [ὀκτὼ καὶ δέκα, eight and ten], indecl., eighteen.

div.head: ὄλεθρος
div.p: -ου [ὄλλῦμι, destroy, see ἀπόλλυμι, destruction, death.

div.head: ὀλίγος
div.p: -η, -ον [bor., Eng. oligarchy], few, a few, only a few; small, short; ὀλίγου δεῖν, lack little of, come within an ace of, with inf.; ἐπ’ ὀλίγων, a few men deep. Neut. acc. as adv., a little.

div.head: ὀλισθάνω
div.p: 2 aor. ὥλισθον, slip.

div.head: ὀλισθηρός
div.p: -ά, -όν [ὀλισθάνω], slippery.

div.head: ὁλκάς
div.p: -άδος, ἡ [ἕλκω, draw], a towed ship, merchantman. See ναῦς.

div.head: ὁλοίτροχος
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. volvo, roll, τρέχω, run), rolling stone.

div.head: ὅλος
div.p: -η, -ον [cogn., Lat. salvus, sound, safe, solidus, solid, bor., Eng. holocaust, catholic], whole, entire, all, usually in pred. position.

div.head: Ὀλύνθιος
div.p: -ου, Olynthian, a citizen of Olynthus, an important city of Chalcidicé, at the head of the Toronaic gulf.

div.head: ὁμαλής
div.p: -ές, [cp. ὁμοῦ, and ἅμα, at the same time], level, even; ὁμαλὲς ἰέναι march over level ground.;

div.head: ὁμαλός
div.p: -ή, -όν [cp. ὁμαλής; bor., Eng. anomalous], level, even; ἡ ὁμαλή (sc. γῆ), level ground, Neut. as subst., plain. ὁμαλῶς [ὁμαλός], adv., evenly, with even step.

div.head: ὅμηρος
div.p: -ου, hostage.

div.head: ὁμιλέω
div.p: ὁμιλήσω, ὡμίλησα, ὡμίληκα [ὅμιλος (cp. ὁμοῦ, ἴλη, crowd), crowd, bor., Eng. homily, homiletic], associate with.

div.head: ὁμίχλη
div.p: -ῆς, mist, fog.

div.head: ὄμνυμι
div.p: and ὀμνύω, ὀμοῦμαι, ὥμοσα, ὀμώμοκα, ὀμώμο(σν)μαι, ὠμό(σ)γθην, swear, take oath, with cogn. acc., dat., and fut. inf.

div.head: ὅμοιος
div.p: -α, -ον [cp. ὁμοῦ; bor., Eng. homoeopathy ], like, similar, with dat. As subst., masc. pl., peers, used of Spartan citizens possessing full rights; neut. sing., ἐν τῷ ὁμοίῳ, on equal terms with them, 213, 4. ὁμοίως [ὅμοιος], adv., alike, equally.

div.head: ὁμολογέω
div.p: ὁμολογήσω, etc. [cp. ὁμοῦ, λέγω, say, bor., Eng. homologous ] (have common speech about anything), agree, admit, acknowledge, confess.

div.head: ὁμολογουμένως
div.p: [ὁμολογέω], adv., admittedly; with ἐκ πάντων, as was admitted by all.

div.head: ὁμομήτριος
div.p: -α, -ον [cp. ὁμοῦ, μήτηρ, mother], by the same mother.

div.head: ὁμόσε
div.p: [cp. ὁμοῦ], adv., to the same place; to close quarters.

div.head: ὁμοτράπεζος
div.p:
-ον [cp. ὁμοῦ, τράπεζα, table), at the same table. Masc. as subst., able companion, a title of privileged courtiers in Persia, who were allowed to eat in the same
room, though not at the same table, with the monarch or overlord.

div.head: ὁμοῦ
div.p: [gen. of ὁμός, common, same; cogn., Lat. similis, like, Eng. same; bor., Eng. homogeneous, homologous], adv., together, at the same time, ὁμοῦ εἶναι meet, with gen.

div.head: ὀμφαλός
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. umbilicus, navel ], navel.

div.head: ὅμως
div.p: [ὁμός, common, same, see ὁμοῦ], conj., nevertheless, all the same, still, however, yet.

div.head: ὄναρ
div.p: τό, only nom. and acc. sing., other forms being supplied from a different stem, ὀνείρατος, ὀνείρατα, etc. [bor., Eng. oneirocritic, oneiromancy ], dream, vision.

div.head: ὄνομα
div.p: -ατος, τό (cp. γιγνώσκω; cogn., Lat. nomen, cognomen, name, Eng. name; bor., Eng. onomatopoeia, patronymic, anonymous, pseudonym, synonym ], name, fame, as acc. of specification, by name.

div.head: ὄνος
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. asinus, ass], ass, donkey; ὄνος ἀλέτης, upper millstone, turned by ass power on a lower stationary millstone.

div.head: ὄξος
div.p: -ους, τό [ὀξύς, sharp, sour; cogn., Lat. acer, sharp, acétum, vinegar ; bor., Eng. oxygen, oxytone], sour wine.

div.head: ὅπῃ
div.p: [πῇ, how? where ?], rel. adv., where, wherever; whither, whithersoever, in what direction, of manner, in whatever way; ὅπῃ δύναιντο τάχιστα, as quickly as they could.

div.head: ὄπισθεν
div.p: adv., 2 the rear, behind, from the rear, οἱ those in the rear; τὰ ὄπισθεν, the rear, εἰς τοὔπισθεν, behind, backwards; ἐκ τοῦ

div.head: ὄπισθεν
div.p: behind, in the rear; with gen., behind.

div.head: ὀπισθοφυλακέω
div.p: ὠπισθοφυλάκησα [ὀπισθοφύλαξ ], compose the rear guard, bring up the rear, command the rear guard. ὀπισθοφυλακίᾶ, -ας [ὀπισθοφύλαξ], command of the rear guard.

div.head: ὀπισθοφύλαξ
div.p: -ακος, ὁ [ὄπισθεν, φυλάττω, guard], one guarding the rear; pl., rear guard, rear; as an adj., of the rear guard.

div.head: ὁπλίζω
div.p: ὥπλισα, ὥπλισμαι, ὡπλίσθην [ὅπλον], arm, equip; mid., arm oneself.

div.head: ὅπλισις
div.p: -εως, ἡ equipment, accouterments.

div.head: ὁπλίτης
div.p: -ου [ὅπλον], heavy-armed infantryman, hoplite. See Introd. §§ 56, 58.

div.head: ὁπλιτικός
div.p: -ή, -όν [ὁπλίτης], of or delonging to hoplites. Neut. as subst., hoplite division. ὁπλομαχίᾶ, -ας [ὅπλον, μάχομαι, fight), fighting in heavy armor, heavy infantry fighting.

div.head: ὅπλον
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. panoply], tool, implement,; pl., implements of war, arms, = ὁπλῖται, hoplites, 111, 1; sometimes the camp arsenal, where the arms were kept during encampment (see Introd. § 65); εἰς τὰ ὅπλα, to arms! τρέχειν ἐπὶ τὰ ὅπλα, run to arms; ἐν τοῖς ὅπλοις, under arms.

div.head: ὁπόθεν
div.p: [cp. πόθεν, whence?], rel. adv., whence, from whatever place, from whatever division.

div.head: ὅποι
div.p: [cp. ποῖ, whither ?], rel. adv., whither, where.

div.head: ὁποῖος
div.p: -α, -ον [cp. ποῖος, what sort of τε]. rel. adj., what sort of; ὁποῖόν τι, whatever sort of thing, whatever.

div.head: ὁπόσος
div.p: -η, -ον [cp. πόσος, how large? ], rel. adj., of what quantity; as large as, pl. as many as,; how large, pl. how many. Neut. acc. as adv., as far as.

div.head: ὁπόταν
div.p: [ὁπότε + ἄν], conj., whenever, when, with subj.

div.head: ὁπότε
div.p: [cp. πότε, when 7], conj., when, less often since, seeing that, with indic.; whenever, with opt. (cp.

div.head: ὁπόταν
div.p: with subj. ).

div.head: ὁπότερος
div.p: -α, -ον [cp. πότερος, which of two ?], rel. pron., which of two, whichever, Lat. uter.

div.head: ὅπου
div.p: [cp. ποῦ, where?], rel. adv., where, to the place where, with indic.; wherever, with ἄν and subj., or with opt.; ὅπου μή, except where.

div.head: ὀπτός
div.p: -ή, -όν, baked.

div.head: ὅπως
div.p: [cp. πῶς, how ?], rel. adv. or conj., how, As adv., how, in what way, as, as best, οὐκ ἔστιν ὅπως οὐ, with fut. indic., there is no question but that he will, etc; with an obj. clause depending on a verb of planning, taking care, or striving, that, how, usually with fut. indic., occasionally with subj., opt., or ἄν and potential opt.; introducing an exhortation, see to it that, with fut. indic. As conj., with a clause of purpose (commoner in Xenophon than ἕνα or ὡς), that, in order that, with subj. or opt.

div.head: ὁράω
div.p: ὄψομαι, 2 aor. εἶδον, ἑόρακα and ἑώρακα, ἑώραμαι and ὦμμαι, ὥφθην [roots ὁρα, ὁπ (cp. Eng. optic), ϝιδ (whence οἶδα) see, look, perceive; with acc. and ptc., ὅτι, or an indir. question. Pres. pass. ptc. as adj., seen, visible.

div.head: ὀργή
div.p: -ῆς, temper, temperament,; esp. anger; ὀργῇ, in anger. ὀργίζομαι, ὀργιοῦμαι, ὥργισμαι, ὠργίσθην [ὀργή], be angry, be enraged, with dat. ὀργνά, -ας [ὀρέγω, reach] (the reach of the outstretched arms), fathom, 6 Greek feet = 5 feet 10 inches Eng. measure.

div.head: ὄρθιος
div.p: -α, -ον [ὀρθός], straight up, steep; in column; λόχοι ὄρθιοι, companies in column, company columns (see Introd. § 67). Neut. as subst., steep hill, ὄρθιον ἱέναι, march up a steep hill; πρὸς τὸ ὄρθιον, up (lit., facing) the steep hill, against the steep incline.

div.head: ὀρθός
div.p: -ή, -όν [bor., Eng. orthodox, orthography, orthopedic }, straight, upright.

div.head: ὄρθρος
div.p: -ου, dawn. ὀρθῶς [ὀρθός], adv., rightly, correctly, with justice; ὀρθῶς ἔχειν, be right or proper.

div.head: ὅρια
div.p: -ων, τά [cp. ὁρίζω], borders, boundary, frontier.

div.head: ὁρίζω
div.p: -οριῶ, ὥρισα, ὥρικα, ὥρισμαι, ὡρίσθην [ὅρος, boundary, bor., Eng. horizon, aorist, aphorism], separate, be the boundary between.

div.head: ὅρκος
div.p: -ου, oath; τῶν θεῶν ὅρκοι, oaths by the gods.

div.head: ὁρμάω
div.p: ὁρμήσω, etc. [ὁρμή], start, with inf.; with ὁδόν, start on a journey; mid., with aor. ὡρμήθην, set out, start, Lat. proficiscor.

div.head: ὁρμέω
div.p: [ὅρμος, anchorage], be moored, lie at anchor.

div.head: ὁρμή
div.p: -ῆς, motion, start, movement, expedition, ἐν ὁρμῇ, on the point of starting μιᾷ ὁρμῇ, with one accord.

div.head: ὁρμίζω
div.p: ὁρμιοῦμαι, ὥρμισα, ὥρμισμαι, ὡρμίσθην (cp. ὁρμέω], anchor, moor.

div.head: ὀρνίθειος
div.p: -α, -ον [ὄρνις], of birds or fowls,; κρέα ὀρνίθεια, fowl, chicken,

div.head: ὄρνις
div.p: ὄρνιθος, ὁ, ἡ [bor., Eng. ornithology ], bird, esp. fowl, chicken.

div.head: Ὀρόντας
div.p: -α (Doric gen.), Orontas, (1) a noble Persian, executed by Cyrus for high treason; (2) a noble Persian, son-in-law of Artaxerxes, and satrap of Armenia.

div.head: ὄρος
div.p: -ους, τό, mountain, mountain range.

div.head: ὀρυκτός
div.p: -ή, -όν (verbal of ὀρύττω), dug, artificial, tunneled out.

div.head: ὀρύττω
div.p: -ορύξω, ὥρυξα, -ορώρυχα, ὀρώρνγμαι, ὠρύχθην, dig, quarry.

div.head: Ὀρχομένιος
div.p: -ου, Orchomenian, citizen of Orchoménus, a town in Arcadia.

div.head: ὅς
div.p: ἥ, ὅ, rel. pron., who, which, what, with indic.; as conditional rel., with ἄν and subj. or with opt.; often attracted to the case of an antecedent in the gen. or dat.; the antecedent may be incorporated into the rel. clause, or attracted to the case of the rel.; ἐν ᾧ (sc. χρόνῳ), while, during this time, ἀφ᾽ οὗ, since; μέχρι οὗ, to where; in old dem. force, καὶ ὅς, and he. For

div.head: ᾗ
div.p: and οὗ as advs., see the words.

div.head: ὅσιος
div.p: -α, -ον, holy, righteous, devout.

div.head: ὅσος
div.p: -η, -ον, rel. adj., properly correlative to τοσοῦτος or πᾶς, which may be omitted; how great, pl., how many; as great as, as long as, as much as, pl, as many as, often hardly to be distinguished from ὅς so great that, 107, 25; with τοσοῦτος it may be translated as; ὅσον or τοσοῦτον... ὅσον, with inf., enough for, 179, 7; ὅσῳ with comp., the, ὅσῳ θᾶττον, the quicker. Neut. acc. as adv., so far that;

div.head: ὅσον
div.p: ἐδύναντο μέγιστον, as loud as they could; with numerals, adout, as many as.

div.head: ὅσοσπερ
div.p: ὅσηπερ, ὅσονπερ [ὅσος + intensive πέρ], rel. adj., more precise than ὅσος, just as many as; often hardly to be distinguished from ὅς.

div.head: ὅσπερ
div.p: ἥπερ, ὅπερ [ὅς + intensive πέρ], rel. pron., more precise than

div.head: ὅς
div.p: just who, just what, who certainly, the very thing which; often hardly to be distinguished from ὅς.

div.head: ὄσπριον
div.p: -ου, leguminous plant; pL, peas and beans.

div.head: ὅστις
div.p: ἥτις, ὅ τι, gen. οὕτινος or ὅτου, ἥστινος [ὅς + τὶς, anybody], indefinite rel. pron., whoever, whatever, often hardly to be distinguished from ὅς; as conditional rel., with ἄν and subj. or with opt.; often in indir. questions; introducing a clause of result after οὕτω, that he; ἔστιν ὅστις, some one; So ὅτου δή, 219, 22; ὅ τι, why, 121, 19.

div.head: ὅταν
div.p: [ὅτε + ἄν], conj., whenever, when, with subj.

div.head: ὅτε
div.p: rel. adv. or conj., when, with indic.; whenever, with opt. (cp. ὅταν with subj.); ἔσθ᾽ ὅτε, sometimes.

div.head: ὅτι
div.p: [neut. of ὅστις, conj., that introducing indir. disc., with indic. or opt.; sometimes introducing dir. disc. and not to be translated; introducing a causal clause, because, with indic.; strengthening a sup. (cp. ὡς and ὅσον), ὅτι ἀπαρασκευότατον, as unprepared as possible.

div.head: οὐ
div.p: before a smooth vowel οὐκ, before a rough vowel οὐχ [bor., Eng. Utopia], adv., not, no, denying a statement of fact, Lat. non; with μή, see μή. It has the acute accent at the end of a sentence or clause.

div.head: οὗ
div.p: [ gen. of ὅς]. rel. adv., where, to the place where.

div.head: οὗ
div.p: dat. of (the only sing. form found in the Anabasis), pl. σφεῖς, σφῶν, reflexive pron., enclitic in sing., him, himself, themselves, usually as indir. reflexive.

div.head: οὐδαμόθεν
div.p: [οὐδαμός, of one, + -θεν, from), adv., from no place or quarter.

div.head: οὐδαμοῦ
div.p: [cp. οὐδαμόθεν], adv., nowhere.

div.head: οὐδέ
div.p: [οὐ + δέ, but, and), conj. and adv., but not, and not, nor, not either, not even, by no means; οὐδ᾽

div.head: ἄλλος
div.p: nobody else either; οὐδὲ...

div.head: οὐδέ
div.p: not even... nor either (cp.

div.head: οὔτε...
div.p: οὔτε).

div.head: οὐδείς
div.p: οὐδεμία, οὐδέν, gen. οὐδενός, οὐδεμιᾶς [οὐδέ + εἷς, one], not even one, not any, no. As subst., nobody, nothing. Neut. acc. as adv., 27 20 respect, not at all, by no means, not a whit.

div.head: οὐδέποτε
div.p: [οὐδέ + ποτέ, ever], adv., never.

div.head: οὐκέτι
div.p: [οὐκ + ἔτι, any longer], adv., no longer, οὐκέτι μή with subj., as a strong fut. neg., 112, 15.

div.head: οὔκουν
div.p: [οὐκ + οὖν], inferential adv., μοῦ... then, well... not, μοί, non igitur. Cp. οὐκοῦν.

div.head: οὐκοῦν
div.p: [οὐκ + οὖν], interrogative and inferential adv., not... then? well ...not? in questions which expect an affirmative reply, Lat. nonne igitur. In affirmations, well then, now then. Cp. οὔκουν.

div.head: οὖν
div.p: postpositive inferential and confirmatory adv., accordingly, then, so, therefore, now, well then; in resuming an interrupted narrative it may often be omitted from the translation; δ᾽ οὖν, after what has been stated doubtfully or on another’s authority, denotes return to certain ground, at any rate, but certainly; καὶ γὰρ οὖν, and so of course, and so naturally.

div.head: οὗπερ
div.p: [gen. of ὅσπερ], rel. adv., more precise than of, the very place where, just where.

div.head: οὔποτε
div.p: [οὐ + ποτέ, ever], adv., never.

div.head: οὔπω
div.p: [οὐ + πώ, yet], adv., not yet, not before.

div.head: οὐπώποτε
div.p: [οὐ + πώποτε, ever yet], adv., never yet, never before. οὐρά͵ -ας [bor., Eng. cynosure, squirrel], tail; of an army, rear, Lat. novissimum agmen.

div.head: οὐραγός
div.p: -ου [οὐρά, ἄγω, lead], rear leader, last man in a file, becoming leader if the file faced about.

div.head: οὐρανός
div.p: -ου [bor., Uranus, Urania, uranography ], sky, heaven.

div.head: οὖς
div.p: ὠτός, τό [cogn., Lat. auris, ear, audio, hear, Eng. ear; bor., Eng. otology], ear.

div.head: οὔτε
div.p: [οὐ + τέ, and], conj., and not, Lat. neque,; οὔτε... οὔτε, neither ... nor, αἴ. neque... neque.

div.head: οὔτε...
div.p: τε, not only not... but also, Lat. neque... et.

div.head: οὗτος
div.p:
αὕτη, τοῦτο, dem. pron., this, commonly referring to what precedes, sometimes to what follows; in pred. position when used with subst.; frequently hardly to be distinguished from a pers. pron., he, she, it; ταῦτα frequently represents a singular idea and is to be translated this, καὶ ταῦτα, adding an important qualification, and that too; καὶ οὗτος, he too, even he, καὶ τούτων πονηρῶν, and villains at that, 129, 23; ἐν τούτῳ (sc. τῷ χρόνῳ),
at this moment, hereupon, meanwhile, οὑτοσί, αὑτηΐ, τουτί [οὗτος + deictic -ι], this... here, with a gesture.

div.head: οὕτως
div.p: or οὕτω commonly before consonants [οὗτος], adv., ἐμὲ this way, under these circumstances, so, usually referring to what precedes (cp. obros); sometimes referring ahead, as follows; οὕτως... ὥσπερ; exactly ...as

div.head: οὐχί
div.p: stronger form of οὐ, not.

div.head: ὀφείλω
div.p: ὀφειλήσω, ὠφείλησα, 2 aor. ὥφελον, ὠφείληκα, ὠφειλήθην, owe; NA pass., be owing, be due, with dat.; 2 aor., with inf., ought, used to express a hopeless wish, ὥφελε Κῦρος ζῆν would that Cyrus were alive! (Cyrus ought to be alive!)

div.head: ὄφελος
div.p: τό, only in nom. and acc., advantage, help, use, στρατηγοῦ ὄφελος οὐδέν, a general is of no use.

div.head: ὀφθαλμός
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. ophthalmia, ophthalmoscope], eye, ἐν ὀφθαλμοῖς, in sight.

div.head: ὀχετός
div.p: -ου [ὀχέω], channel or ditch for irrigation.

div.head: ὀχέω
div.p: [cogn., Lat. veho, carry, Eng. wagon], carry, pass., be carried, ride.

div.head: ὄχημα
div.p: -ατος, τό [ὀχέω], vehicle.

div.head: ὄχθη
div.p: -ης (poetic), high bank, bluff.

div.head: ὄχλος
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. ochlocracy], crowd, throng, body of non-combatants, camp followers (see Introd. § 61); trouble, bother.

div.head: ὀχυρός
div.p: -ά, -όν [ἔχω, hold], capable of being held, strong, of a military position; cp. ἐχυρός. Neut. pl. as subst., strongholds.

div.head: ὀψέ
div.p: adv., late.

div.head: ὀψίζω
div.p: ὠψίσθην [ὀψέ], be late, come late.

div.head: ὄψις
div.p: -εως, ἡ (cp. ὄψεσθαι (see ὁράω, see); bor., Eng. thanatopsis ], look, appearance.

div.head: παγκράτιον
div.p: -ου [πᾶς, all, κράτος, strength], pancratium, all-round contest, a combination of boxing and wrestling, the severest of all Greek athletic exercises, calling into play, as the name denotes, all the powers of the combatants. Straps were not used on the hands (see on 225, 7), as they would have been a hindrance in wrestling; and blows could not be struck with the clenched fist, but only with the fingers bent. The struggle continued till one of the contestants was completely used up. παγχαλέπως [παγχάλεπος (πᾶς, all, χαλεπός, dificult), very dificult], adv., with great dificully.

div.head: πάθος
div.p: -ους, τό [πάσχω, suffer, cp. ἔπαθον; bor., Eng. pathos, homoeopathy, sympathy], suffering, trouble, misfortune.

div.head: παιανίζω
div.p: ἐπαιάνισα [παιᾶν, paean], chant the paean, sing the war song to Apollo or Artemis (see Introd. § 66); sing a hymn of thanksgiving.

div.head: παιδεία
div.p: -ας [παιδεύω; bor., Eng. cyclopedia], training, education.

div.head: παιδεύω
div.p: παιδεύσω, etc. [παῖς], train up or educate a child.

div.head: παιδικά
div.p: -ῶν, τά [waits], favorite, usually a boy; with the pl. cp. Lat. feliciae, darling, favorite.

div.head: παιδίον
div.p: -ου [diminutive of παῖς], little child, baby.

div.head: παιδίσκη
div.p: -ης [diminutive of παῖς], little girl.

div.head: παῖς
div.p:
παιδός, ὁ, ἡ [bor., Eng.
pedagogue, orthopedic], child, boy, girl, son, daughter, ἐκ παίδων, from boyhood, Lat. a pueris.

div.head: παίω
div.p: παίσω, ἔπαισα, -πέπαικα, ἐπαίσθην [bor., Eng. anapaest ], strike, beat, transitive or intransitive.

div.head: πάλαι
div.p: adv., long ago, long since, for a long time; a pres. tense with it has the force of a pf., but few, which regularly has pf. meaning in the pres., takes plupf. force, 202, 20.

div.head: παλαιός
div.p: -ά, -όν [πάλαι; bor., Eng. palaeography, palaeontology ], old; comp., rather old, 209, 11. Neut. acc. as adv., τὸ παλαιόν, in ancient times, once on a time.

div.head: παλαίω
div.p: ἐπάλαισα, ἐπαλαίσθην [πάλη; bor., Eng. palaestra], wrestle. warn, -ης [πάλλω, poise], wrestling; see on 225, 7. See Fig. 75, p. 224.

div.head: πάλιν
div.p: [ bor., Eng. palinode, palingenesis, palimpsest ], adv., back , again, a second time.

div.head: παλλακίς
div.p: -ίδος, ἡ, concubine, mistress.

div.head: παλτόν
div.p: -οῦ [πάλλω, poise], spear, javelin, used by the Persian cavalry. Cp. δόρυ.

div.head: παμπληθής
div.p: -ές, [πᾶς, all, πλῆθος, great number), in full numbers, vast.

div.head: πάμπολυς
div.p: -πόλλη, -πολυ [πᾶς, all.

div.head: πολύς
div.p: much], very large, pl., very many, a great many.

div.head: πανοῦργος
div.p: -ον [πᾶς, all, cp. ἔργον, work], willing to do anything, always in bad sense, unscrupulous, villainous.

div.head: παντάπασι
div.p: -σιν before vowels [πᾶς, all], adv., altogether, entirely, utterly, with neg., at all.

div.head: πανταχοῦ
div.p: [πᾶς, all] adv., everywhere. παντελῶς [παντελής (πᾶς, all, τέλος, completion), all complete], adv, completely, uiterly.

div.head: πάντῃ
div.p: [πᾶς, all], adv., on every side, everywhere.

div.head: παντοδαπός
div.p: -ή, -όν [was, all], of every kind, of all sorts.

div.head: πάντοθεν
div.p: [πᾶς, was, all, +-θεν, from], adv., from every side, on all sides.

div.head: παντοῖος
div.p: -α, -ον [πᾶς, all], of all kinds or varieties.

div.head: πάνυ
div.p: [πᾶς, all], adv., altogether, very, exceedingly, ever so, οὐ πάνυ πρός, not very near, at some daistance from, with dat.

div.head: (πάομαι)
div.p: πάσομαι, ἐπασάμην, wéraμαι (poetic except in Xenophon; the pres. is not found at all), ged, acquire; commonly pf., have acquired, possess.

div.head: παρά
div.p: by elision παρ᾽ [cogn., Eng. fore, for; bor., Eng. parable, paragraph, parallel], prep. with gen., dat., or acc., deside. With gen., from beside, from; rarely of agency, by. With dat., deside, near, with; under (second in command to); παρὰ βασιλεῖ, at court; τὰ παρ᾽ ἐμοί, life with me. With acc., to the side of, to, usually of persons, in friendly relations (cp. ἐπί and πρός); of motion along beside or to a position beside, along, near, beside, (of ships) off, with, of time, at, during, of passing beside and beyond what is proper or expected, contrary to, in violation of. In cpds., to, along, beside, past, beyond, contrary to; cp. Eng. words beginning with par(a)-, as parabola, paradox, paralysis, parasite, paregoric, parenthesis, parody, also see above.

div.head: παραβαίνω
div.p: [βαίνω, go], go beyond, violate.

div.head: παραβοηθέω
div.p: [βοηθέω, go to aid), go to help, go to the rescue.

div.head: παραγγέλλω
div.p: [ἀγγέλλω, announce], pass a message along, send word, give the word, command, the order passing from officer to officer, or from man to man; παραγγέλλει εἰς τὰ ὅπλα, he gives the command ‘To arms!’ 79, 15; ἴς; κατὰ τὰ γελμένα, according to orders, παρήγγελτο, impers., word had been passed along, Cp. παρεγγυάω.

div.head: παράγγελσις
div.p: -εως [παραγγέλλω], word of command.

div.head: παραγίγνομαι
div.p: [γίγνομαι, become), be on hand, come, arrive.

div.head: παράγω
div.p: [ἄγω, lead`, lead along, lead on.

div.head: παράδεισος
div.p: -ου [Persian word; bor., Eng. paradise]; inclosed pleasure ground, usually stocked with game.

div.head: παραδίδωμι
div.p: [δίδωμι, give], give up, hand over, surrender, Lat. trado. παραθαρρύνω [θαρρύνω, encourage], encourage, cheer. παραθεῖναι, see παρατίθημι.

div.head: παραθέω
div.p: [θέω, run], run past.

div.head: παραινέω
div.p: παραινέσω, παρήνεσα, παρήνεκα, παρήνημαι, παρῃνέθην [ αἰνέω, praise], exhort, advise.

div.head: παρακαλέω
div.p: [καλέω, call; bor., Eng. paraclete], call to, call in, summon, invite,; encourage, exhort.

div.head: παρακελεύομαι
div.p: [κελεύω, urge], urge, advise, exhort.

div.head: παρακέλευσις
div.p: -εως [παρακελεύομαι], ], urging on, cheering.

div.head: παρακολουθέω
div.p: [ἀκολουθέω, ἀκολουθήσω, etc., follow, bor. Eng. acolyte], accompany.

div.head: παραλυπέω
div.p: [λυπέω, annoy], be troublesome, be refractory.

div.head: παραμείβομαι
div.p: [ἀμείβω, ἀμείψω, ἤμειψα, -ημείφθην, change], change οὐδεὶς position of direction, change.

div.head: παραμελέω
div.p: [ἀμελέω, be careless], pay no heed to, neglect, with gen.

div.head: παραμένω
div.p: [μένω, remain], stay near or by, remain loyal.

div.head: παραμηρίδια
div.p: -ων, τά [μηρός, thigh], armor for the thighs, thigh pieces.

div.head: παραπέμπω
div.p: [πέμπω, send ], send along, dispatch.

div.head: παραπλήσιος
div.p: -α, -ον or -os, -ον [ σίος, near ], close beside, like, similar, with dat.

div.head: παραρρέω
div.p: [ῥέω, flow], flow beside; of melting snow, slip off, run off. Cp. περιρρέω.

div.head: παρασάγγης
div.p: -ου (Persian word, modern Persian farsang), parasang, equiv. to 30 stades, about 3.4 miles. The day’s march of Cyrus’s army averaged about six parasangs. It seems likely that Xenophon used it as a rough measure of time rather than of length (cp. ‘it’s an hour’s walk from here’), so that the distance included in a parasang would vary according to the rough or easy character of the road. See Introd. § 64.

div.head: παρασκευάζω
div.p: [σκευάζω, σκευάσω, ἐσκεύασα, ἐσκεύασμαι, -εσκευάσθην, prepare), prepare, provide; mid., get oneself ready, prepare for oneself, provide, procure; pf., be ready, be prepared.

div.head: παρασκευή
div.p: -ῆς [cp. παρασκευάζω], ], preparation, armament. παρασκηνάω [σκηνάω (σκηνή, tent), put under a tent), encamp beside.

div.head: παρατάττω
div.p:
[τάττω, draw up; bor., Eng. parataxis], draw up side by side; παρατεταγμένος, drawn up in
battle array, in line of battle, Lat. instructus.

div.head: παρατείνω
div.p: [τείνω, stretch], along, extend.

div.head: παρατίθημι
div.p: [τίθημι, put], put beside, set before, serve food.

div.head: παρατρέχω
div.p: [τρέχω, run], run along, παρεγγνάω [ἐγγυάω, ἠγγύησα, ἠγγύηκα, ἠγγύημαι, -ηγγνήθην, pledge], pass the word along, command, the order passing from officer to officer or from man to man; παρεγγυῷτο, impers., the word was passed. Cp. παραγγέλλω.

div.head: πάρειμι
div.p: [εἰμί, be], be beside, be present or be there, be on hand, come, arrive, with dat. of possessor, have ; impers., with inf. as subject, de posstble, 202, 25; of παρόντες, the bystanders; τὰ παρόντα (with or without πράματα), the present circumstances; ἐν τῷ παρόντι, in the present crisis.

div.head: πάρειμι
div.p: [εἶμι, go, come], go along, come along, go by, pass by.

div.head: παρελαύνω
div.p: [ἐλαύνω, drive], ride past or along, march past.

div.head: παρέρχομαι
div.p: [ἔρχομαι, come, go], pass by, pass through, pass, go along; of time, pass, be up, pf. ptc. as adj., past, 190, 11.

div.head: παρέχω
div.p: [ἔχω, hold], hold beside or in readiness, furnish, provide, supply, afford, offer; cause, inspire; make, render; mid., πειθομένους... ... παρέχεσθαι, make... obedient to himself, 138, 17.

div.head: παρθένος
div.p: -ου, ἡ [bor., Eng. Parthenon], maiden, girl.

div.head: πάροδος
div.p: [ὁδός, way], way past, passage, way to, approach.

div.head: παροίχομαι
div.p: [οἴχομαι, be gone], be gone by; τὰ παροιχόμενα, the past.

div.head: Παρράσιος
div.p: -ου, Parrhasian, a native of Parrhasia, a district in southwestern Arcadia.

div.head: Παρύσατις
div.p: -ίδος, ἡ, wife Παρύσατις and half-sister of Darius II, mother of Artaxerxes II and Cyrus the Younger. Having great power at her son’s court, she did not hesitate to use it most unscrupulously to rid herself of all her enemies and those of her favorite son Cyrus. See Introd. §§ 1, 2.

div.head: πᾶς
div.p: πᾶσα, πᾶν, gen, παντός, πάσης [bor., Eng. panacea, pandemonium, pantheon }, regularly in pred.
