(rarely attrib.) position, all the, the whole of; without article, in sing., every, every kind of, in pl., all, As subst., πάντες, all, everybody; πάντα, all things, everything; περὶ παντὸς ποιεῖσθαι, consider it all-important; ἐπὶ πᾶν ἐλθεῖν, have recourse to every expedient, Neut. acc. pl. as adv., in all respects, utterly.

div.head: Πασίων
div.p: -wvos, ὁ, Pasion, of Megara, one of the Greek generals, who deserted the expedition at Myriandus.

div.head: πάσχω
div.p: πείσομαι, ἔπαθον, πέπονθα [cp.

div.head: πάθος
div.p: suffering ], experience, suffer, be hurt, εὖ πάσχειν, be well treated, receive benefits, κακῶς πάσχειν, suffer loss, be all used.

div.head: πατάσσω
div.p: πατάξω, ἐπάταξα, strike.

div.head: Πατηγύας
div.p: -α (Doric gen.), Pategyas, a Persian in the suite of Cyrus.

div.head: πατήρ
div.p:
πατρός, ὁ [cogn., Lat. pater, father, Eng. father; bor., Eng.
patriarch, patriot, patronymic], father.

div.head: πατρίς
div.p: -ίδος, ἡ native land, Lat. patria.

div.head: πατρῷος
div.p: -α, -ον [πατήρ], belonging to or inherited from a father, father’s, paternal, ancestral.

div.head: παύω
div.p: παύσω, ἔπαυσα, πέπαυκα, πέπαυμαι, ἐπαύθην [cogn., Lat. pauci, few, pausa, pause, Eng. few], cause to cease, put an end to, stop, give up; mid., cause oneself to cease, desist, stop, rest, abs., with gen., or with ptc.; pass., be ended.

div.head: Παφλαγών
div.p: -όνος, ὁ, Paphlagonian, a native of Paphlagonia, a country in the northern part of Asia Minor.

div.head: παχύς
div.p: -εῖα, -eva, -v [bor., Eng. pachyderm, pachymeter ], thick, large.

div.head: πέδη
div.p: -ης [cp. πούς, foot], fetter, shackle.

div.head: πεδίον
div.p: -ου, plain, level ground.

div.head: πεζῇ
div.p: [dat. fem. of πεζός (sc. ὁδῷ, way) ], adv., on foot.

div.head: πεζός
div.p: -ή, -όν [cp. πούς, foot], on foot, of infantry, infantry. Masc. as subst., foot soldier, pl., infantry.

div.head: πειθαρχέω
div.p: ἐπειθάρχησα [πείθαρχος (πείθομαι, ἀρχή, rule), obedient to authority), obey, with dat.

είθω, πείσω, ἔπεισα, πέπεικα and πέποιθα, πέπεισμαι, ἐπείσθην [root πιθ; cogn., Lat. fido, trust; Eng. faith], persuade, win over, convince, with acc.; mid. and pass., de persuaded, be won over, comply, obey, with dat.; πειστέον εἴη Clearchus must be obeyed, 135, 173 πειθόμενος, as adj., obedient.

div.head: πεινάω
div.p: πεινήσω, ἐπείνησα, πεπείνηκα, be hungry.

div.head: πεῖρα
div.p: -ας [cogn., Lat. experior, try; bor., Eng. empirical], trial, experience, intimate acquaintance, close friendship; πεῖραν ἔχετε, you have made trial, 153, 1.

div.head: πειράομαι
div.p: πειράσομαι, ἐπειρασάμην, πεπείραμαι, ἐπειράθην [πεῖρα], try, endeavor; make trial of, test, with gen.

div.head: πελάζω
div.p: πελάσω and πελῶ, ἐπέλασα, ἐπελάσθην [πέλας, near], draw near, approach.

div.head: Πελοποννήσιος
div.p: -α, -ον [Πελοπόννησος], of Peloponnésus, Peloponnesian. :

div.head: Πελοπόννησος
div.p: -ου, ἡ [Πέλοπος νῆσος, Pelops' island), Peloponnésus, the southern part of Greece, now Moréa.

div.head: Πέλται
div.p: -ῶν, Peltae, a city of Phrygia, on the Maeander.

div.head: πελταστής
div.p: -ου [πέλτη], one who carries a πέλτη, peltast, targeteer. See Introd. δὲ 57, 59, and Fig. 8, p. 41.

div.head: πελταστικός
div.p: -ή, -όν [πελταστής], of peltasts. Neut. as subst. (sc. στράτευμα), peltast force.

div.head: πέλτη
div.p: -ης, light shield, target, crescentshaped, the distinctive arm of the peltast. In 103, 20, it has been commonly, but probably wrongly, explained as pole or spear. See Introd. § 59, and Fig. 8, p. 41.

div.head: πέμπτος
div.p: -η, -ον [πέντε], fifth.

div.head: πέμπω
div.p: πέμψω, ἔπεμψα, rérougpa, πέπεμμαι, ἐπέμφθην [ bor., Lat. pompa, procession, Eng. pomp], send, convey, send word.

div.head: πένομαι
div.p: [cp. πόνος, for], cogn., Lat. pénuria, want; bor., Eng. penury be poor.

div.head: πεντακόσιοι
div.p: -αι, -α [πέντε], five hundred.

div.head: πέντε
div.p: [cogn., Lat. quinque, five, Eng. five; bor., Eng. pentagon, Pentateuch ], indecl., five.

div.head: πεντεκαίδεκα
div.p: [πέντε καὶ δέκα, five and ten], indecl., fifteen.

div.head: πεντήκοντα
div.p: [πέντε; cogn., Lat. quinquaginta, fifty,; bor., Eng. Pentecost ], indecl., fifty.

div.head: πεντηκοντήρ
div.p: -ἤρος, ὁ [πεντήκοντα], penteconter, commander of fifty, i.e. of half a company. See Introd. § 56.

div.head: πεντηκοστύς
div.p: -ύος, ἡ [πεντήκοντα], division of fifty, half a company. See Introd. § 56.

div.head: περαίνω
div.p: περανῶ, ἑπέρανα, πεπέρασμαι, ἐπεράνθην [πέρας, end; cp. πέραν], carry out, execute, accomplish.

div.head: πέραν
div.p: [cogn., Eng. far], adv., on the other side; τὸ πέραν, the other side ; as prep. with gen., across.

div.head: περάω
div.p: περάσω, ἐπέρασα, πεπέρακα [ cp. πέραν], in Attic used only by Xenophon, cross, go through.

div.head: πέρδιξ
div.p: -ικος, ὁ, ἡ [bor., Lat. perdix, partridge, whence French perdrix, Eng. partridge ], partridge.

div.head: περί
div.p: [bor., Eng. perimeter, period], prep. with gen., dat., or acc., round, about, With gen., only figuratively in prose, about, concerning, with regard to, for; in a contest of, 53 περὶ πλείστου, of the greatest importance; wept παντός, αὐτὰ περὶ Προξένου, news of Proxenus. With dat., round, about, in prose commonly of parts of the body. With acc., round, about, attending, including the person attended (cp. ἀμφί), of περὶ Ἀριαῖον, Ariacus and his men; busy about; with respect to, of time, about. In cpds., round, about, over, sometimes denoting superiority (see περιγίγνομαι); cp. Eng. words beginning with peri-, as pericardium, perihelion, peritoneum, also see above.

div.head: περιβάλλω
div.p: [βάλλω, throw], embrace.

div.head: περιγίγνομαι
div.p: [γίγνομαι, become, be], be superior to, get the better of (cp. ‘I'll get round him’), with gen.

div.head: περιειλέω
div.p: [εἰλέω, pack close], wrap round.

div.head: περίειμι
div.p: [εἰμί, be], be superior, surpass, outdo, with gen., with dat. of respect.

div.head: περίειμι
div.p: [εἶμι, go], for pres. with fut. meaning, see εἶμι; go round, make a detour.

div.head: περιέχω
div.p: [ἔχω, hold], surround.

div.head: περιίστημι
div.p: [ἴστημι, cause to stand], station round, 2 aor., intr., stand round.

div.head: περιμένω
div.p: [μένω, remain], wait round, wait, watt for, await.

div.head: Πέρινθος
div.p: -ου, ἡ, Perinthus, a city of Thrace, on the Propontis.

div.head: πέριξ
div.p: [περί], adv., round about.

div.head: περίοδος
div.p: -ου, ἡ [ὁδός, way, bor., Eng. period], way round, circuit.

div.head: περίπατος
div.p: -ov [πάτος, path, bor., Eng. peripatetic], walk, stroll, ἐν περιπάτῳ εἶναι, be walking.

div.head: περιπήγνυμι
div.p: [πήγνυμι, freeze], make freeze round, pass., intr., freeze round, freeze on.

div.head: περιπίπτω
div.p: [πίπτω, fall], fall round, fall upon one with arms about him, with dat.

div.head: περιπλέω
div.p: [πλέω, sail], sail round, coast round.

div.head: περιπτύσσω
div.p: [πτύσσω, -πτύξω, ἔπτυξα, -ἐπτυγμαι, -επτύχθην, fold round, outflank.

div.head: περιρρέω
div.p:
[ῥέω, flow], flow round,
encircle, of fetters, drop of. Cp. παραρρέω.

div.head: περιστερά
div.p: -ας, dove.

div.head: περιτρέχω
div.p: [τρέχω, run], run round or about.

div.head: περιττεύω
div.p: ἐπερίττευσα [περιττός], be over and above, outnumber, outfank.

div.head: περιττός
div.p: -ή, -όν [περί], over and above what is necessary, superfluous, οἱ περιττοί, the outflanking troops. περιφανῶς [περιφανής (φαίνω, show), conspicuous], adv. conspicuously, manifestly.

div.head: περίφοβος
div.p: -ον [φόβος, fear], in great fear, much alarmed.

div.head: Πέρσης
div.p: -ου, Persian, originally οὐ fined to the inhabitants of Persia proper, on the northern shore of the Persian Gulf, but as the Persian empire absorbed other races, the word was used of any subject of the great king; used also as adj.

div.head: περσίζω
div.p: [Πέρσης], speak Persian.

div.head: Περσικός
div.p: -ή, -όν [Πέρσης], Perstan.

div.head: περσιστί
div.p: [περσίζω], adv., in Persian.

div.head: πέτομαι
div.p: -πτήσομαι, -επτόμην [cogn., Lat. penna (for petna), feather, Eng. feather], fly.

div.head: πέτρα
div.p: -ας, rock, cliff, boulder.

div.head: πέτρος
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. Peter (cp. Matthew 16. 18), petrify, petrography, petroleum ], stone.

div.head: πεφυλαγμένως
div.p: [from pf. mid. ptc. of

div.head: φυλάττω
div.p: guard], adv., guardedly, cautiously.

div.head: πῃ
div.p: enclitic adv., in any way.

div.head: πηγή
div.p: -ῆς, source, spring, headwaters; always pl. in the Anabasis.

div.head: πήγνυμι
div.p: πήξω, ἔπηξα, πέπηγα, ἐπάγην [cogn., Lat. pango, wake fast, pagina, page, pax, peace], freeze.

div.head: πηλός
div.p: -ου, mud, mire.

div.head: πῆχυς
div.p: -εως, ὁ, cubit, equiv. to 14 Greek feet, or 174 inches Eng. measure. The word meant forearm, which, like foot, palm, etc., was used as a convenient measure.

div.head: Πίγρης
div.p: -ητος, ὁ, Pigres, Cyrus’s Greek interpreter.

div.head: πιέζω
div.p: πιέσω, ἐπίεσα, ἐπιέσθην, press, press hard, pass., be hard pressed, be crowded, be weighed down, be overburdened.

div.head: πικρός
div.p: -ά, -όν, bitter.

div.head: πίμπλημι
div.p: πλήσω, ἔπλησα, -πέπληκα, -πέπλησμαι, ἐπλήσθην [cogn., Lat. impleo, fill, plénus, full, Eng. full, fill], fill, with gen. of material.

div.head: πίνω
div.p: πίομαι, ἔπιον, πέπωκα, -πέπομαι, -επόθην [cogn., Lat. poto, drink], drink.

div.head: πίπτω
div.p: πεσοῦμαι, ἔπεσον, πέπτωκα [cp. πέτομαι], fall, esp. in battle; be involved in.

div.head: Πισίδαι
div.p: -ῶν, οἱ, Pisidians, inhabitants of Pisidia, a mountainous country in the southern part of Asia Minor. They did not acknowledge the Persian sway.

div.head: πιστεύω
div.p: πιστεύσω, ἐπίστευσα, πεπίστευμαι, ἐπιστεύθην [ cp. πιστός], put trust or confidence in, rely on, trust, be confident, with dat., or inf. in indir. disc.

div.head: πίστις
div.p: -εως, [cp. πιστός], faith; good faith, fidelity; pledge of faith, pledge, διὰ πίστεως.

div.head: πιστός
div.p:
-ή, -όν [πείθω, persuade; cogn., Lat. fidus, faithful, Eng. faith], faithful, trusty. As subst., οἱ πιστοί, the Faithful, a title given to selected counselors of the
Persian king; πιστά, pledges, interchange of pledges.

div.head: πιστότης
div.p: -ητος, ἡ [πιστός], ], faithfulness, fidelity.

div.head: πίτυς
div.p: -υος, ἡ, pine tree.

div.head: πλάγιος
div.p: -α, -ον, sideways, slanting;

div.head: εἰς
div.p: πλάγιον, sideways. Neut. pl. as subst., flanks of an army.

div.head: πλαίσιον
div.p: -ου, rectangular figure; of soldiers, square, which might be either solid or hollow. See Introd. § 63, and plan, p. 168.

div.head: πλανάομαι
div.p: πλανήσομαι, πεπλάνημαι, ἐπλανήθην [πλάνη, wandering; bor., Eng. planet], wander, go astray.

div.head: πλάττω
div.p: ἔπλασα, πέπλασμαι, ἐπλάσθην [bor., Eng. plastic, plaster, protoplasm], shape, make up, fabricate.

div.head: πλατύς
div.p: -εἴα, -ύ [bor., Eng. place, plate, plateau], wide, broad.

div.head: πλεθριαῖος
div.p: -α, -ον [πλέθρον], of a plethron.

div.head: πλέθρον
div.p: -ου, [plethron], a Greek linear measure, 100 Greek feet or about 97 Eng. feet.

div.head: Πλεισθένης
div.p: -ους, ὁ, Pleisthénes, a private in Cyrus’s Greek army.

div.head: πλέκω
div.p: ἔπλεξα, -πέπλοχα, πέπλεγμαι, ἐπλέχθην and -επλάκην [cogn., Lat. plico, fold, plecto, weave], plait.

div.head: πλεονεκτέω
div.p: πλεονεκτήσω, ἐπλεονέκτησα [πλεονέκτης (πλέον, ἔχω, have), one who has more], have more, have a larger share.

div.head: πλευρά
div.p: -ᾶς [bor., Eng. pleurisy ], 724, usually pl., side, of a hollow square, flank. See plan, p. 168.

div.head: πλέω
div.p: πλεύσομαι and πλευσοῦμαι, ἔπλευσα, πέπλευκα, πέπλευσμαι [cogn., Lat. plud, Eng. fleet, float, flow, flood ], sail.

div.head: πληγή
div.p: -ῆς [πλήττω, strike; bor., Eng. apoplexy], blow, flogging.

div.head: πλῆθος
div.p: -ους, τό [πλήθω; cogn., Lat. plébs, common people], multitude, great number, numbers; great amount; size, extent, common soldiers, 147, 24.

div.head: πλήθω
div.p: [cp. πίμπλημι; bor., Eng. plethora ], be full, only in pres. ptc. in prose, ἀγορὰ πλήθουσα, time of full market, middle of the forenoon.

div.head: πλήν
div.p: adv., used frequently as conj. and as prep. with gen., except, except that.

div.head: πλήρης
div.p: -ες [πίμπλημι], full, full of, abounding in, with gen.

div.head: πλησιάζω
div.p: πλησιάσω, etc. [πλησίος], ], draw near, approach.

div.head: πλησίος
div.p: -α, -ον, sup. πλησιαίτατος, near, positive not found in Attic prose, the advs. πλησίον and ἐγγύς being used instead. Neut. acc. as adv., ear, attributively, neighboring.

div.head: πλίνθινος
div.p: -η, -ον [πλίνθος], of brick, brick.

div.head: πλίνθος
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. plinth], brick.

div.head: πλοῖον
div.p: -ου [πλέω], ship, boat, craft, a general term; opposed to τριήρης, in scorn, craft, tub, 71, ὃ.

div.head: πλούσιος
div.p: -α, -ον [πλοῦτος, wealth], rich.

div.head: πλουτέω
div.p: πλουτήσω, ἐπλούτησα, πεπλούτηκα [πλοῦτος, wealth, bor., Eng. plutocracy, Pluto], be rich.

div.head: πνεῦμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [πνέω; bor., Eng. pneumatic, pneumonia], wind, blast.

div.head: πνέω
div.p: πνεύσομαι and πνευσοῦμαι, ἔπνευσα, πέπνευκα [ bor., Eng. dyspnoea ], breathe, blow.

div.head: ποδαπός
div.p: -ή, -όν, from what country ? where from ?

div.head: ποδήρης
div.p: -ες [πούς, foot], reaching to the feet.

div.head: ποδίζω
div.p: -ποδιῶ, πεπόδισμαι, ἐποδίσθην [πούς, foot], tie the feet, hobble. ποδῶν, see πούς.

div.head: πόθος
div.p: -ου, longing.

div.head: ποιέω
div.p: ποιήσω, etc. [bor Eng. poet, onomatopoeia], make, fashion. Idiomatic uses: put, arrange, form ; appoint; hold games; summon an assembly; allow, cause, bring to pass; carry out, act, do; εὖ ποιεῖν, benefit, do a service, abs. or with acc.; κακῶς ποιεῖν, injure, maltreat, abs. or with acc.; ἀγαθόν τι ποιεῖν τινα, do one a good turn; κακὰ ποιεῖν τινα, do wrongs or harm to one. Mid., often to be translated like the act., but expressing the subject’s interest in the act; also consider, with pred. acc.; so with περὶ πλείστου and περὶ παντός, for which see περί; pass., be done, be going on.

div.head: ποιητέος
div.p: -α, -ον (verbal of ποιέω), must be done.

div.head: ποικίλος
div.p: -ή, -ον, many-colored, variegated.

div.head: ποῖος
div.p: -a, -ον [cp. οἷος, of which sort], interrogative adj.. what sort of? what ?

div.head: πολεμέω
div.p: πολεμήσω, etc. [πόλεμος], be at war, make war, fight, with dat. or

div.head: πρός
div.p: and acc. of the opponent; with σύν and dat. of the helper; ὅσα ἐπολεμήθη, what acts of war were committed.

div.head: πολεμικός
div.p: -ή, -όν [πόλεμος bor, Eng. polemic], of or for war, skilled in war, warlike. Neut. as subst., signal for battle; pl., military matters, warfare.

div.head: πολέμιος
div.p: -α, -ον [πόλεμος], of or belonging to war, of or like an enemy, the enemy’s, hostile. As subst., ἡ πολεμία (sc. χώρα, country), the enemy's country, οἱ the enemy, Lat. hostés (cp. ἐχθρός); πολέμια, matters of war, military science.

div.head: πόλεμος
div.p: -ου, war, warfare.

div.head: πολιορκέω
div.p: πολιορκήσω, ἐπολιόρκησα, -πεπολιόρκημαι, ἐπολιορκήθην [ πόλις.

div.head: εἴργω
div.p: shut in], hem in a city, besiege; the force of πόλις in the cpd. sometimes disappears, as be hemmed in, of persons on a hill, 187, 21.

div.head: πόλις
div.p: -εως, ἡ [cp. πολύς; cogn., Lat. po-pulus (reduplicated), people; bor., Eng. metropolis, politics, police], city; as a political unit, state.

div.head: πόλισμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [cp. πόλις], town.

div.head: πολιτεύω
div.p: πολιίτεύσω, etc. [πολίτης (from πόλις), citizen], be a citizen, live as a citizen.

div.head: πολλάκις
div.p: [πολύς], adv., frequently, often.

div.head: πολλαπλάσιος
div.p: -α, -ον [πολύς, roXUs, and root πλα, which is cogn. with Eng. -fold], manifold, many times as many or as much. .

div.head: πολλαχοῦ
div.p: [modus], adv., in many places, in many occastons. πολνάνθρωπος, -ον [πολύς, ἄνθρωπος, human being], populous.

div.head: Πολυκράτης
div.p: -ους, ὁ, Polycraites, a captain in the Greek army.

div.head: πολύς
div.p:
πολλή, πολύ [cogn., Eng. full, fill; bor., Eng. polygon, polysyllable, Polynesia], much, great, large; of time, long, pl., many, often joined with another adj. by καί, which is not translated. As subst., of πολλοί, the majority; won, much, a great part, τὸ πολύ, the greater part, ἐκ πολλοῦ, with a long start; ἐπὶ πολύ, for a long distance; ὡς ἐπὶ τὸ πολύ, as a rule,
generally, Neut. acc. as adv., πολύ, much, far; πολλά, often, 190, 10. Comp. πλείων or πλέων, more, greater, larger, louder; pl., more, in greater numbers. As subst., ἐκ πλέονος, when at a greater distance, 103, 6. Neut. acc. as adv., πλέον, more. Sup. πλεῖστος, most, very abundant, pl., very many , strengthened by ὅτι or ὡς, as many as possible. As subst., of πλεῖστοι, most of them, the majority; τὰ πλεῖστα, larger part, περὶ πλείστου, of the greatest importance. Neut. acc. as adv., πλεῖστον, most, most thoroughly; ὡς πλεῖστον, as far as possible.

div.head: Πολύστρατος
div.p: -ου, Polystratus, an Athenian.

div.head: πολυτελής
div.p: -ές [ πολύς, τέλος, outlay], requiring large outlay, costly.

div.head: πονέω
div.p: πονήσω, etc., but -επονήθην [πόνος], toil, undergo hardship.

div.head: πονηρός
div.p: -ά, -όν [πόνος], troublesome, bad, worthless, knavish. Masc. as subst., criminal, knave. πονηρῶς [πονηρός], adv., with difficulty.

div.head: πόνος
div.p: -ου [πένομαι, be poor], sti, difficulty, hardship.

div.head: Πόντος
div.p: -ου [bor., Lat. pontus, sea, Eng. Hellespont], sea; in prose generally used of proper names, as

div.head: Εὔξεινος
div.p: Πόντος, Euxine or Black Sea.

div.head: πορεία
div.p: -ας [πορεύομαι], mid., journey, march, route.

div.head: πορεύομαι
div.p: πορεύσομαι, πεπόρευμαι, ἐπορεύθην [πόρος], go, proceed, march, travel, often with cogn. acc.

div.head: πορευτέος
div.p: -ά, -όν (verbal of πορεύομαι), to be traversed or crossed, impers. πορευτέον, necessary to march.

div.head: πορίζω
div.p: ποριῶ, ἐπόρισα, πεπόρικα, πεπόρισμαι, ἑπορίσθην [πόρος], provide, furnish; mid., procure, obtain.

div.head: πόρος
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. porta, gate, portus, harbour, Eng. fare, ferry, ford; bor., Eng. pore], passage, of a river, ford, way, means.

div.head: πόρρω
div.p: [πρό], adv., far off, far from, with gen.

div.head: πορφυροῦς
div.p: -ᾶ, -οῦν, contracted from

div.head: πορφύρεος
div.p: -α, -ον [πορφύρᾶ, purplefish; bor., Lat. purpura, purple, Eng. porphyry, purple], purple, more accurately dark red, crimson.

div.head: πόσος
div.p: -η, -ov [cp. ὅσος, how great], interrogative adj., how great? how large? how extensive ?

div.head: ποταμός
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. hippopotamus, Mesopotamia ], river.

div.head: ποτέ
div.p: enclitic adv., once; after εἰ οὕ neg., af any time, ever; emphasizing a question, ὅποι ποτέ, where in the world ?

div.head: πότερος
div.p: -α, -ον [cp. ὁπότερος, which of two], interrogative pron., which of two? Lat. uter. Neut. acc. as adv., πότερον and πότερα, commonly correlative with ἤ, in double indir. questions, whether ... or, Lat. utrum...an, in double dir. questions πότερον or πότερα is not translated.

div.head: ποτόν
div.p: -ου [cp. πίνω, drink], drink; pl., drinkables, drink. wine was the common drink in Greece, but being stronger than most wines of to-day, it was regularly diluted with water. In Persia water was used as a beverage.

div.head: πότος
div.p: -ου [cp. πίνω, drink], drinking, drinking bout, symposium.

div.head: ποῦ
div.p: [cp. ὅπου, where], interrogative adv., where ?

div.head: πού
div.p: [cp. ποῦ], indefinite enclitic adv., anywhere, somewhere.

div.head: πούς
div.p: ποδός, ὁ [cogn., Lat. pés, pedis, foot, Eng. foot; bor., Eng. antipodes, tripod, octopus], foot, as a linear measure, foot, equiv. to nearly 11.67 inches Eng. measure.

div.head: πρᾶγμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [πράττω; bor., Eng. pragmatic], deed, matter, business; trouble, annoyance ; πράγματα παρέχειν, give or make trouble.

div.head: πρανής
div.p: -ές, [πρό, forward, cogn., Lat. pronus, leaning forward ], bent forward; of a hill, steep; εἰς τὸ πρανές, down the hill, 170, 9; κατὰ τοῦ πρανοῦς, down the steep slope, 225, 19.

div.head: πρᾶξις
div.p: -εως, ἡ [πράττω], doing, enterprise, undertaking.

div.head: πρᾶος
div.p: πραεῖα, πρᾶον, gentle, tame. πρᾶττω, πράξω, ἔπραξα, πέπρᾶγα and πέπραχα, πέπραγμαι, ἐπράχθην [bor. Eng. practical, practice], do, manage, administer; intr., usually with an adv., be in a state or condition, do (cp. ‘how do you do?’), fare, κάκιον πράττειν, fare worse; καλῶς πράττειν, fare well, prosper. πράως [πρᾶος], adv., gently, slightingly.

div.head: πρέπω
div.p: πρέψω, ἔπρεψα, be fitting, suit; in prose commonly impers., πρέπει, it is proper or fitting, it becomes, with dat.

div.head: πρεσβεύω
div.p: πρεσβεύσω, ἐπρέσβευσα, πεπρέσβευκα, πεπρέσβευμαι [πρέσβυς], serve as ambassador, with

div.head: παρά
div.p: and gen.

div.head: πρέσβυς
div.p: -εως, ὁ [bor., Eng. priest, Presbyterian], old, poetic; its prose use as an adj. is confined to the comp. and sup., πρεσβύτερος, older, elder, πρεσβύτατος, oldest, eldest. As subst., in prose only in the pl., elders, esp. ambassadors, who were usually old men.

div.head: πρίν
div.p: [cp. πρό], conj., (1) after affirmative clauses, before, with inf.; so πρὶν ἤ (cp. Lat. prius quam, before); (2) after clauses which contain or imply a neg. idea (sometimes preceded by πρότερον or

div.head: πρόσθεν
div.p: which is not translated), before, until, with indic., ἄν and subj., or opt.

div.head: πρό
div.p: [cogn., Lat. pro, before, Eng. for, fore; bor., Eng. programme, prologue, prophet], prep. with gen., before, in front of; of time, before, previous to. In cpds., before, forward, for, on behalf of; cp. some Eng. words (see above) beginning with pro-.

div.head: προαγορεύω
div.p: [ἀγορεύω, ἀγορεύσω, etc., speak, proclaim], announce publicly, make public declaration.

div.head: προάγω
div.p: [ἄγω, lead], lead forward.

div.head: προαισθάνομαι
div.p: [αἰσθάνομαι, perceive], perceive beforehand, perceive in time.

div.head: προβαίνω
div.p: [βαίνω, step, go], go forward, advance; of time, pass, wear on.

div.head: προβάλλω
div.p: [βάλλω, throw, bor., Eng. problem], throw before; mid., hold before oneself; προβάλλεσθαι τὰ ὅπλα, advance arms, put them in position to make or repel an attack (cp. modern ‘charge bayonets’).

div.head: πρόβατον
div.p: -ου [προβαίνω] (anything that walks forward ), commonly pl., cattle; esp. small cattle, sheep, or sheep and goats, collectively.

div.head: προβουλεύω
div.p: [βουλεύω, plan], plan for or on behalf of.

div.head: πρόγονος
div.p: -ου [γίγνομαι, be born], forefather, ancestor.

div.head: προδίδωμι
div.p:
[δίδωμι, give], give up to
an enemy, betray, desert, be false to, Lat. prodo.

div.head: προδότης
div.p: -ov [προδίδωμι], betrayer, traitor.

div.head: προδρομή
div.p: -ῆς, (cp. δρόμος, running), running forward, sally, πρόειμι [εἶμι, go], go forward, go ahead, advance. προεῖπον [εἶπον, tell], tell forth, proclaim, give orders.

div.head: προελαύνω
div.p: [ἐλαύνω, drive, ride], ride or march forward.

div.head: προέρχομαι
div.p: [ἔρχομαι, go], go forward, advance.

div.head: προέχω
div.p: [ἔχω, have], have the advantage.

div.head: προθυμέομαι
div.p: προθυμήσομαι and fut. pass. προθυμηθήσομαι as mid., προυθυμήθην [πρόθυμος], be zealous or eager, desire earnestly, be set on doing a thing, abs. or with inf.

div.head: προθυμία
div.p: -ας [πρόθῦμος, zeal, ardor.

div.head: πρόθυμος
div.p: -ου [θυμός, spirit], forward-spirited, eager, zealous, ready. προθύμως [πρόθυμος], adv., zealously, eagerly, readily.

div.head: προΐημι
div.p: [ἴημι, send], send forth; mid., give up oneself or what is dear to one, intrust, surrender, abandon.

div.head: προΐστημι
div.p: [ἵστημι, cause to stand, set], place at the head of, set over ; mid., with 2 aor., pf., and plupf. act., be over, command, with gen.

div.head: προκαλύπτω
div.p: [καλύπτω, καλύψω, ἐκάλυψα, κεκάλυμμαι, ἐκαλύφθην, cover], put a cover before, cover over.

div.head: προκατακαίω
div.p: [καίω, burn], burn down before, go ahead and burn.

div.head: προκαταλαμβάνω
div.p: [λαμβάνω, take], seize before some one else, seize beforehand.

div.head: Προκλῆς
div.p: -έους, ὁ, Procles, governor of Teuthrania, a district in western Asia Minor, including Pergamus. προμετωπίδιον, -ου [μέτωπον, forehead ], frontlet, a protection for a horse’s forehead. See Introd. § 51, and Fig. 5, p. 37.

div.head: Πρόξενος
div.p: -ου, Proxénus, of Thebes in Boeοtia, one of the Greek generals, and a personal friend of Xenophon.

div.head: προοράω
div.p: [ὁράω, see], see before oneself, see coming.

div.head: προπέμπω
div.p: [πέμπω, send], send forward or ahead.

div.head: προπίνω
div.p: [πίνω, drink], drink to the health of, with dat.

div.head: προπονέω
div.p: [πονέω, toil], toil for, with gen.

div.head: πρός
div.p:
[cp. πρό; bor., Eng. proselyte, prosody], prep. with gen., dat., or acc., facing. With gen., from a position facing; arising from, in keeping with; from the point of view of, in the sight of, by; next to, in the direction of. With dat., facing; beside, near, by, at; on the frontier of, in addition to, besides. With acc., to a position facing, of friendly or hostile relation (cp. ἐπί and παρά), towards, to, against; in reply to, with regard to, relating to, with a view to, for; with, near, at, πρὸς φιλίαν, in friendship, in a friendly way; πρὸς τὸ... εἶναι, in order to be,
As adv., πρὸς δ᾽ ἔτι, besides. In cpds., to, towards, against, besides, cp. some Eng. words (see above) beginning with pros-.

div.head: προσάγω
div.p: [ἄγω, lead], lead towards or against, apply, employ; intr., march against.

div.head: προσαιτέω
div.p: [αἰτέω, ask], ask besides, ask for more, with acc.

div.head: προσβαίνω
div.p: [βαίνω, step, go], step against, put the foot against.

div.head: προσβάλλω
div.p: [βάλλω, throw], throw against; intr., rush against, charge, make an attack upon, abs. or with πρός and acc.

div.head: προσβατός
div.p: -ή, -όν (verbal of προσβαίνω, accessible.

div.head: προσβολή
div.p: -ῆς, [προσβάλλω], attack, charge.

div.head: προσγίγνομαι
div.p: [γίγνομαι, become], be added, join.

div.head: προσδίδωμι
div.p: [δίδωμι, give], give besides, give in addition.

div.head: προσδοκάω
div.p: προσεδόκησα (the simple δοκάω is not found), expect, look for.

div.head: προσδοκέω
div.p: [δοκέω seem best], seem best besides or further.

div.head: πρόσειμι
div.p: [εἶμι, go, come], for pres. with fut. meaning, see εἶμι; come towards, come up, come on, approach.

div.head: προσελαύνω
div.p: [ἐλαύνω, drive, ride], ride towards, ride up; march towards or against; be on the way.

div.head: προσέρχομαι
div.p: [ἔρχομαι, come, go; bor., Eng. proselyte], come or go to, come up, approach, go over to, desert to, with dat.

div.head: προσέχω
div.p: [ἔχω, hold], hold to; in the Anabasis, only in the phrase προσέχειν τὸν νοῦν, pay attention to, turn the attention to, with dat.

div.head: προσήκω
div.p: [ἥκω, have come], have come to, reach, belong to, be related to, with dat.; impers., with inf. as subject, be fitting or proper.

div.head: πρόσθεν
div.p: [πρός], adv., before, in front. Idiomatic uses: τὰ πρόσθεν, the van, εἰς τὸ πρόσθεν, forward, but with gen., in front of, of time, before, formerly, previously; followed by πρίν it is not translated; πρόσθεν

div.head: ἤ
div.p: sooner than, before, as adj., former, formerly, before; as adj., former, previous.

div.head: προσίημι
div.p: [ἴημι, send], let come to; mid., let come to oneself, receive; προσίεσθαι εἰς ταὐτὸ ἡμῖν αὐτοῖς, admit to the same standing with ourselves, 146, 10.

div.head: προσκαλέω
div.p: [καλέω, call], call to, summon.

div.head: προσκυνέω
div.p: προσκυνήσω, προσεκύνησα [κυνέω, kiss, poetic], make obeisance, prostrate oneself, bow down to, worship, abs. or with acc.; pass., receive homage.

div.head: προσλαμβάνω
div.p: [λαμβάνω, take], take besides or in addition, take along; take hold of a piece of work, lend a hand. προσμείγνῦυμι [μείγνυμι, μείξω, ἔμειξα, μέμειγμαι, ἐμείχθην and mix; cogn., Lat. misceo, mix, Eng. mix, mash], mingle with; intr., join, unite with.

div.head: πρόσοδος
div.p: -ου, ἡ [ὁδός, way], way to, income, revenue.

div.head: προσόμνυμι
div.p: [ὄμνυμι, swear], swear besides, swear further, with inf. προσποιέομαι [ποιέω, do], pretend, feign, profess, claim, with inf.

div.head: προσπολεμέω
div.p: [πολεμέω, make war], carry on war against.

div.head: προστατέω
div.p: προεστάτησα [προστάτης (τροΐστημι), manager ], be manager of, with gen.

div.head: προστάττω
div.p: [τάττω, assign], command, give orders, with dat.

div.head: προστερνίδιον
div.p: -ου [στέρνον, breast], breastpiece, for horses. See Figs. 5, 30 pp: 37, 88.

div.head: προστίθημι
div.p: [τίθημι, put], put to, add; mid., assent to, concur in, with dat.

div.head: προστρέχω
div.p: [τρέχω, run], run lo, run up to, with dat.

div.head: πρόσω
div.p: [πρό], adv., forward; so rot

div.head: πρόσω
div.p: 64, 4; far away; with gen., far from, but far into, 196, 10. Comp. προσωτέρω, farther.

div.head: πρόσωπον
div.p: -ου [cp. ὄψομαι, fut. of

div.head: ὁράω
div.p: see], face, countenance.

div.head: προτεραῖος
div.p: -α, -ον [πρότερος], 2γέεειἦing; τῇ προτεραίᾳ (sc. nucpa), on the day before.

div.head: πρότερος
div.p: -ά, -ον [cp. πρό, before), former, previous, to be translated usually by an adv., formerly, previously; with gen. of comparison, before, sooner. Neut. acc. as adv., with or οὐ out τό, before, previously; followed by πρίν it is not translated.

div.head: προτιμάω
div.p: [τἱμάω, honor], honor more than another, prefer in honor, fut. mid. as pass., 73, 18.

div.head: προτρέχω
div.p: [τρέχω, run], run forward.

div.head: προφαίνω
div.p: [φαίνω, show], show forth; mid., come in sight, appear.

div.head: προφασίζομαι
div.p: προφασιοῦμαι, προυφασισάμην [πρόφασις], offer as an excuse, plead in excuse.

div.head: πρόφασις
div.p: -εως, ἡ [φημί, say], pretext, excuse.

div.head: προφυλακή
div.p: -ῆς [φυλακή, guard], a guard before, pl., outposts, pickets. προφύλαξ, -ακος, ὁ [φύλαξ, sentinel; bor., Eng. prophylactic], seséry, picket.

div.head: προχωρέω
div.p: [χωρέω, nove], move forward, impers., tf goes on well for one, t¢ ts convenient or advantageous.

div.head: πρῴ
div.p: comp. πρῳαίτερον [πρό, before], adv., early tn the morning, early.

div.head: πρωτεύω
div.p: πρωτεύσω, ἐπρώτευσα [πρῶros], be first, have the first place.

div.head: πρῶτος
div.p: -ή, τον [πρό, before, bor., Eng. protocol, protoplasm, prototype], first, foremost; often used where Eng. prefers an adv. or a phrase, first, be the first to, Mase. pl. as subst., he van of an army; the most prominent men οὗ community. Neut. acc. as adv., with or without τό, first, in the first place, at first.

div.head: πτάρνυμαι
div.p: ἔπταρον [cogn., Lat. szeeze ], sneeze.

div.head: πτέρυξ
div.p: -υγος, ἡ [cp. πέτομαι, fly; bor., Eng. apteryx], wing of a bird; pl., sometimes flaps of a cuirass (see Introd. § 58, and Figs. 6, II, 29, pp. 40, 55, 88).

div.head: πυγμή
div.p: -7s [cogn., Lat. pugnus, /is¢, pugna, battle; bor., Eng. pygmy ], fist; boxing; see on 225, 7. See Fig. 76, p. 225.

div.head: Πυθαγόρας
div.p: -ου, Pythagoras, a Spartan admiral.

div.head: πυκνός
div.p: -ή, -όν, close together, compact, solid.

div.head: Πύλαι
div.p: -ῶν, Pylae, ‘The Gates’ a fortress on the frontier between Mesopotamia and Babylonia.

div.head: πύλη
div.p: -ῆς [bor., Eng. pylorus, Propylaea], gate, usually pl., of the two wings (cp. Lat. forés, folding door); mountain pass.

div.head: πυνθάνομαι
div.p: πεύσομαι, ἐπυθόμην, πέπυσμαι, maguire, inquire about, learn by inquiry, find out.

div.head: πῦρ
div.p: πυρός, τό [cogn., ny. fire; bor., pyre, pyrography, pyrotechnics], fire, pl. τὰ πυρά, camp fires, signal fires.

div.head: πυραμίς
div.p: -ίδος, ἡ [bor Eng. pyramid ], pyramid.

div.head: Πύραμος
div.p: -ου, Pyramus, a river flowing through Cilicia.

div.head: πύρινος
div.p: -η, -ον [πυρός], of wheat.

div.head: πυρός
div.p: -ου, always pl. in the Anabasis, wheat, πώ, indefinite enclitic adv., used only after a neg., yet, up to this time.

div.head: πωλέω
div.p: πωλήσω, ἐπωλήθην [bor., Eng. monopoly ], sell.

div.head: πῶλος
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. pullus, young of an animal, Eng. foal, filly], colt, foal.

div.head: πῶμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [cp. πίνω, drink], drink.

div.head: πώποτε
div.p: [πώ + ποτέ, ever], indefinite adv., in neg. clauses, ever yet, ever.

div.head: πῶς
div.p: [cp. ὅπως, how], interrogative adv., how ? in what way ?

div.head: πώς
div.p: (cp. πῶς], indefinite enclitic adv., in any way, somehow; for some reason or other; somewhat, about; False τὴν αὐτήν πως ὥραν, somewhere about the same hour.

div.head: ῥᾴδιος
div.p: -α, -ον, comp. ῥᾳων, sup. ῥᾷστος, easy, ῥᾳδίως [ῥᾴδιος, adv., easily; ds ῥᾷστα, as easily as possible.

div.head: ῥᾳθυμέω
div.p: [ῥᾳθῦμος (cp. ῥᾷδιος, θυμός, Spirit), easy-going], take things easy, live in idleness.

div.head: ῥᾳθυμία
div.p: -ας [cp. ῥᾳθυμέω], idleness, an easy life.

div.head: ῥέω
div.p: ῥεύσομαι and ῥυήσομαι, ἐρρύηκα, ἐρρύην [cogn., Eng. stream; bor., Eng. catarrh, rheum], flow.

div.head: ῥίπτω
div.p: (and ῥιπτέω in pres, and impf.), ῥίψω, ἔρριψα, ἔρριφα, ἔρριμμαι, épρίφθην and ἐρρίφην, throw, throw aside, hurl down.

div.head: Ῥόδιος
div.p: -α, -ον [Ῥόδος, Rhodes], Rhodian, of Rhodes, an island in the Aegéan, south of Caria. Masc. as subst., Rhodian. The Rhodians were famed as slingers.

div.head: ῥοφέω
div.p: ῥοφήσομαι, ἐρρόφησα [cogn., Lat. sorbeo (whence is bor. Eng. absorb), suck in], suck in, gulp down.

div.head: ῥῦμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [ἐρύω, draw], drawing of a bow; ἐκ τόξου ῥύματος, if he had a bowshot’s start, 162, 7.

div.head: ῥώμη
div.p: -ης [ῥώννῦμι, strengthen], strength; military force.

div.head: σάγαρις
div.p: -εως, ἡ, battle ax, carried by Asiatics, and frequently represented in art as a weapon of the Amazons. See Fig. 64, p. 200.

div.head: σακίον
div.p: -ου [diminutive of σάκος, sack; bor., Lat. saccus, sack, Eng. sack], little bag or sack.

div.head: σάλπιγξ
div.p: -ίγγος, ἡ, trumpet. Fig. 63, p. 196.

div.head: σαλπίζω
div.p: ἐσάλπιγξα σἀλπιγξ], sound the trumpet; ἐπεὶ ἐσάλπιγξε (sc. ὁ σαλπικτής), when the trumpet sounded, 60, 21.

div.head: σαλπικτής
div.p: -ου [σαλπίζω], trumpeter. See Fig. 63, p. 196.

div.head: Σάμιος
div.p: -α, -ον [Σάμος, Samos], Samian, of Samos, an important Ionic island in the Aegéan.

div.head: Σάρδεις
div.p: -εων, αἱ, Sardis, capital of Lydia, and chief city of Cyrus’s province; the starting point of the expedition of Cyrus.

div.head: σατραπεύω
div.p: [σατράπης ], be satrap, rule as satrap, with gen, or acc.

div.head: σατράπης
div.p: -ου, satrap, governor of a Persian province, an officer intrusted with the civil control of one of the provinces into which the Persian empire was divided. Each province had also a general to look after its military affairs, and a secretary to represent the king and watch his colleagues. Certain favored satraps, as Cyrus, the king’s son, exercised military as well as civil control over their satrapies.

div.head: Σάτυρος
div.p: -ου, satyr, one of a mythical race, possessing animal characteristics and human form. Their sensual, bestial nature is represented in art by bristly hair, pointed ears, horses’ tails, etc. In 59, 17, Silénus is meant, the jolly drunken attendant of Dionysus, the wine god.

div.head: σαυτοῦ
div.p: -ῆς, contracted form of σεαυτοῦ [stem of σύ, you + αὐτός, self], reflexive pron. of second pers., yourself; in attributive position the gen. is used as a strong possessive pron., your own.

div.head: σαφής
div.p: -ές, clear, evident. wages [σαφής], adv., clearly, evidently; surely, with certainty.

div.head: σημαίνω
div.p: σημανῶ, ἐσήμηνα, σεσήμασμαι, ἐσημάνθην [σῆμα, sign; bor, Eng. semaphore], wake a sign, indicate, point out, give the signal, impers. (sc. ὁ σαλπικτής, Cp. 197, 1), signal is given.

div.head: σημεῖον
div.p: -ου [σῆμα, sign], sign, signal; standard.

div.head: σησάμινος
div.p: -η, -ον [σήσαμον], of sesame.

div.head: σήσαμον
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. sesame], sesame, an oily Oriental plant from the seeds of which an oil is produced.

div.head: σιγή
div.p: -ῆς, silence; dat. as adv., in silence, silently.

div.head: σίγλος
div.p: -ου (Semitic word, cp. Hebrew shekel), siglus, a coin current in Persia, according to Xenophon equiv. to 7.5 Attic obols, about 22 cents.

div.head: Σικυώνιος
div.p: -ου [Σικνών, Sicion], Sicyonian, a citizen of Sicyon, an important city near Corinth.

div.head: Σιλανός
div.p: -ου, Silanus, a soothsayer from Ambracia.

div.head: σίνομαι
div.p: (Ionic word, used in Attic prose only by Plato and Xenophon), harm, injure.

div.head: Σινωπεύς
div.p: -έως [Σινώπη, Sinope], Sinopéean, a citizen of Sinope, a colony of Miletus on the southern coast of the Black Sea.

div.head: σιτίον
div.p: -ου [σῖτος], food.

div.head: σῖτος
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. parasite], grain, food; pl. σῖτα, food; σῖτος μελίνης, millet bread.

div.head: Σιττάκη
div.p: -ης, Sitiacé, a city of Babylonia, near the Tigris.

div.head: σιωπάω
div.p: σιωπήσομαι, ἐσιώπησα, σεσιώπηκα, -εσιωπήθην [σιωπή, selence], be silent.

div.head: σκεδάννυμι
div.p: σκεδῶ, ἐσκέδασα, ἐσκέδασμαι, ἐσκεδάσθην, scatter.

div.head: σκέλος
div.p: -ους, τό [ bor., Eng. isosceles], leg. σκεπτέον (verbal of σκέπτομαι), necessary to consider.

div.head: σκέπτομαι
div.p: (in Attic the pres. and impf. are rare, being supplied by

div.head: σκοπέω)
div.p: σκέψομαι, ἐσκεψάμην, ἔσκεμμαι [cogn., Eng. spy; bor., Eng. skeptic], look carefully, see, observe; consider, reflect.

div.head: σκευή
div.p: -ῆς, dress, attire.

div.head: σκεῦος
div.p: -ους, τό, implement, pl., baggage, outfit, Lat. impedimenta, σκενοφορέω, σκευοφορήσω [σκενοφόρος], carry baggage.

div.head: σκευοφόρος
div.p: -ον [σκεῦος, φέρω, bear], As subst., masc., baggage carrier: neut. pl, baggage animals, baggage train.

div.head: σκηνέω
div.p: σκηνήσω, ἐσκήνησα [σκηνή], be in a lent, be encamped, be quartered; banguet, aor., encamp.

div.head: σκηνή
div.p: -ῆς [bor., Lat. scaena, scene, Eng. scene], tent, pl. sometimes, camp, quarters, 176, 16 (the tents had been burned, 158, 15).

div.head: σκηνόω
div.p: [σκηνή], pitch tents, encamp, take quarters.

div.head: σκήνωμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [σκηνόω], tent; pl., quarters.

div.head: σκηπτός
div.p: -ου, thunderbolt, stroke of lightning.

div.head: σκηπτοῦχος
div.p: -ου [σκῆπτρον, scepter.

div.head: ἔχω
div.p: hold], scepter bearer, staff bearer, a high official in the Persian court.

div.head: σκληρός
div.p: -ά, -όν [bor., Eng. sclerosis], hard, rough. Neut. as subst., rough place. σκληρῶς [σκληρός], roughly, in hard circumstances.

div.head: σκοπέω
div.p: [σκοπός], only in pres. and impf. (σκέπτομαι supplies the other forms], look at, consider; have an eye to, with πρός and acc.; watch; see, learn.

div.head: σκοπός
div.p: -οῦ [σκέπτομαι; bor., Eng. scope, microscope, episcopal], scout, spy.

div.head: σκοταῖος
div.p: -α, -ον [σκότος], 22 the dark.

div.head: σκότος
div.p: -ους, τό [cogn., Eng. shadow, shade, shed ], darkness.

div.head: Σκυθηνοί
div.p: -ῶν, Scythéni, a tribe living near the southeastern shore of the Black Sea; their exact location is uncertain.

div.head: σμῆνος
div.p: -ους, τό, swarm of bees.

div.head: Σόλοι
div.p: -ων [bor., Eng. solecism], Soli, a coast city of Cilicia, noted for the bad Greek spoken by its inhabitants.

div.head: Σοῦσα
div.p: -ων, τά (the Shushan of Esther 2. 5), Susa, capital of a Persian province and winter residence of the Persian monarchs. It was southeast of Babylon.

div.head: Σοφαίνετος
div.p: -ου, Sophaenétus, of Arcadia, one of Cyrus’s Greek generals.

div.head: σοφία
div.p: -ας [bor., Eng. Sophia], cleverness, skill, wisdom; musical skill.

div.head: σοφός
div.p: -ή, -όν [bor., Eng. sophist, philosophy, sophomore], clever, accomplished, wise.

div.head: σπανίζω
div.p: σπανιῶ, ἐσπάνισα, ἑσπάνισμαι [cp. σπάνιος], lack, be in want of, with gen.

div.head: σπάνιος
div.p: -α, -ον, rare, scarce.

div.head: Σπάρτη
div.p: -ης, Sparta or Lacedaemon, capital of Laconia, in Peloponnésus, chief city of Greece at the time of Cyrus’s expedition.

div.head: Σπαρτιάτης
div.p: -ου [Σπάρτη], Spartan, a citizen of Sparta.

div.head: σπάρτον
div.p: -ου, rope, cord.

div.head: σπάω
div.p: -σπάσω, ἔσπασα, -έσπακα, ἔσπασμαι, ἐσπάσθην [bor., Eng. spasm ], draw a sword.

div.head: σπένδω
div.p: -σπείσω, ἔσπεισα, ἔσπεισμαι [cogn. Lat. spondeo, promise sacredly, vow], pour a libation; mid., pour libations one with another, esp. in making a treaty, hence, make a treaty or truce.

div.head: σπεύδω
div.p: σπεύσω, ἔσπευσα, hasten, be in a hurry, be eager.

div.head: σπολάς
div.p: -άδος, ἡ, leather jerkin. See Introd. § 59, end.

div.head: σπονδή
div.p: -ῆς [σπένδω; bor., Eng. spondee], libation, drink offering ; pl., libations, esp. in concluding a treaty or truce, hence, treaty, truce.

div.head: σπουδάζω
div.p: σπουδάσομαι, ἐσπούδασα, ἐσπούδακα, ἑἐσπούδασμαι [σπουδή], make haste, work with alacrity.

div.head: (σπουδαιολογέω)
div.p: ἐσπουδαιολόγησα, ἐσπουδαιολογήθην

div.head: λόγος
div.p: [σπουδαιο(σπουδαῖος, serious, λέγω, speak), speaking sertously], converse seriously or earnestly.

div.head: σπουδή
div.p: -ῆς, haste, speed.

div.head: στάδιον
div.p: -ου, pl. στάδια, τά, or στάδιοι, of [bor., Eng. stadium], stadium, stade, a Greek measure of length, equiv. to six plethra or 600 Greek feet, 582.5 Eng. feet; stadium race or 200-yard dash, the regular short race in Greek games, corresponding to our 100-yard dash.

div.head: σταθμός
div.p: -ου [ἴστημι, cause to stand], halting place, station on the road; the space between two stations, day’s march, stage. See Introd. § 64.

div.head: στασιάζω
div.p: στασιάσω, ἐστασίασα [στάσις, faction], form a faction against, be at odds with, with dat.

div.head: στέγασμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [στεγάζω (στέγη), cover], covering, tent covering.

div.head: στέγη
div.p: -ης [cogn., Lat. tego, cover, téctum, roof, Eng. deck, thatch], roof, house, Lat. téctum.

div.head: στείβω
div.p: -ἐστειψα, ἐστίβημαι, tread; στειβόμεναι ὁδοί, beaten or frequented roads.

div.head: στέλλω
div.p: στελῶ, ἔστειλα, -έσταλκα, ἔσταλμαι, ἐστάλην, set in order, equip.

div.head: στενός
div.p: -ή, -όν (bor, Eng. stenography], narrow. Neut., sing. or pl., as subst., pass, defile.

div.head: στενοχωρία
div.p: -ας [στενός, χῶρος, place], narrow place.

div.head: στέργω
div.p: στέρξω, ἔστερξα, love.

div.head: στερέω
div.p: στερήσω, ἐστέρησα, -εστέρηκα, ἐστέρημαι, ἐστερήθην (the fut. mid. is used as pass.), deprive, rob of; with acc. of person, gen. of thing; pres. pass. στέρομαι with pf. meaning, be deprived of, be without, have lost.

div.head: στέρνον
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. sternum], breast.

div.head: στέρομαι
div.p: see στερέω. στερρῶς [στερρός στερεός, stiff, firm; bor., Eng. stereopticon, stereotype], firmly, resolutely.

div.head: στέφανος
div.p: -ου [στέφω, put round; bor., Eng. Stephen], crown, garland, wreath.

div.head: στεφανόω
div.p: στεφανώσω, ἐστεφάνωσα, ἐστεφάνωμαι, ἐστεφανώθην [στέφανος], crown, wreathe,; mid., put on a wreath.

div.head: στίβος
div.p: -ου [στείβω], track, trail.

div.head: στῖφος
div.p: -ους, τό, compact body; of troops, mass, close array.

div.head: στλεγγίς
div.p: -ίδος, ἡ, strigil, flesh scraper, Lat. strigidis, used by athletes after exercise, to remove the oil and dirt from the skin before bathing. See Fig. 13, p. 58.

div.head: στολή
div.p: -ῆς [στέλλω; bor., Eng. stole], equipment, raiment, robe.

div.head: στόλος
div.p: -ov [στέλλω], equipment, esp. for war, armament, army, expedition, journey.

div.head: στόμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [bor., Eng. stoma, and (through Lat. stomachus, stomach) stomach], mouth, outlet, entrance, of an army, front, van.

div.head: στρατεία
div.p: -ας [στρατεύω], expedition, campaign.

div.head: στράτευμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [στρατεύω]. army, sometimes of part of an army, division, force.

div.head: στρατεύω
div.p:
στρατεύσω, ἐστράτευσα, ἐστράτευκα, ἐστράτευμαι [στρατός], make an expedition, go on an
expedition, make war, take the field, serve, march, the act. being used of commanders, the mid. of soldiers as well as of commanders.

div.head: στρατηγέω
div.p: στρατηγήσω, ἐστρατήγησα, ἐστρατήγηκα [στρατηγός], be a general, command, abs, or with gen.; with στρατηγίαν acc.), hold a command.

div.head: στρατηγία
div.p: -ας[στρατηγός, bor., Eng. strategy ], office of general, command, generalship, tactics.

div.head: στρατηγός
div.p: -ου [στρατός, ἄγω, lead], general, leader of an army or of a division, See Introd. § 54.

div.head: στρατιά
div.p: -ᾶς [cp. στρατός], army, troops.

div.head: στρατιώτης
div.p: -ου [στρατιά], soldier, private.

div.head: Στρατοκλῆς
div.p: -έους, Straticles, commander of the Cretan archers in the Greek army.

div.head: στρατοπεδεύω
div.p: usually mid., στρατοπεδεύομαι, ἐστρατοπεδευσάμην, ἐστρατοπέδευμαι [στρατόπεδον], encamp,; be encamped.

div.head: στρατόπεδον
div.p: -ου [στρατός, πέδον (ροetic; cp. δάπεδον, ground, πεδίον, plain), ground), camp ground, camp, army in camp.

div.head: στρατός
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. sternd, ptc. stratus, spread, Eng. strew, straw ], encamped army, army.

div.head: στρεπτός
div.p: -ή, -όν (verbal of στρέφω), twisted. Masc. as subst., necklace, of twisted metal. See Fig. 43, p. 130, the figure of Darius.

div.head: στρέφω
div.p: στρέψω, ἔστρεψα, ἔστραμμαι, στράφην and ἐστρέφθην [bor., Eng. strophe, apostrophe], turn, twist, of cords; intr. and pass., turn about, face about, countermarch, See plan, p. 102.

div.head: στρουθός
div.p: -ου, ὁ, ἡ [bor., Eng. ostrich], sparrow; ἡ μεγάλη στρουθός, ostrich.

div.head: στυγνός
div.p: -ή, -όν [στυγέω, hate], hateful, gloomy, stern. Neut. as subst., sternness.

div.head: Στυμφάλιος
div.p: -ου [Στύμφαλος, Stymphalus)], Stymphalian, a citizen of Stymphalus, a town in northeastern Arcadia.

div.head: σύ
div.p: σοῦ, pl., ὑμεῖς, ὑμῶν [originally τύ; cogn., Lat. tu, you, Eng. thou, and (with ὑμεῖς) you], pers. pron., you.

div.head: συγγενής
div.p: -ές, [γένος, race], of the same family. Masc. as subst., kinsman, relative.

div.head: συγγίγνομαι
div.p: [γίγνομαι, become], be with, have a conference with, meet, become acquainted with, study under, be (sexually) intimate with, with dat.

div.head: σύγε
div.p: [σύ + γέ, at least], you at least, you emphasized. Cp. ἔγωγε.

div.head: συγκαλέω
div.p: [καλέω, call], call together, assemble.

div.head: συγκατακαίω
div.p: [κατακαίω, burn up], burn up with or at the same time. συγκαταστρέφομαι [καταστρέφω, subdue], aid in subduing, with dat.

div.head: συγκύπτω
div.p: [κύπτω, κύψω, ἔκυψα, κέκυφα, stoop], draw together, converge.

div.head: σύειος
div.p: -α, -ον [σῦς, hog, cogn., Lat. sus, hog, Eng. sow, swine, soil], of swine; χρῖμα σύειον, ointment of hog’s fat.

div.head: Συέννεσις
div.p: -ιos (Ionic gen.), ὁ, Syennesis, title of the kings of Cilicia (cp. Pharaoh, of the Egyptian kings, and Caesar, of the Roman emperors). Xenophon uses it as a proper. name.

div.head: συλλαμβάνω
div.p:
[λαμβάνω, take, bor., Eng. syllable, syllabus], seize,
arrest (cp. the slang use of ‘gather in’), capture.

div.head: συλλέγω
div.p: [-λέγω, -λέξω, -έλεξα, -είλοχα, -είλεγμαι and -λέλεγμαι, -ελέγην and -ελέχθην, gather, usually in cpds. in prose], collect, gather, assemble, raise an army; pass., come together, assemble.

div.head: συλλογή
div.p: -ῆς, [συλλέγω], gathering; of soldiers, levy.

div.head: συμβαίνω
div.p: [βαίνω, go], come together, impers., come to pass, happen; ἐκ τῶν συμβάντων, from what happened.

div.head: συμβάλλω
div.p: [βάλλω, throw, bor., Eng. symbol], throw together, gather; mid., contribute, make suggestions.

div.head: συμβοηθέω
div.p: [βοηθέω, help], help with others; join in helping.

div.head: συμβουλεύω
div.p: [βουλεύω, plan], advise, give advice, with dat.; mid., consult with, ask advice of, with dat.

div.head: σύμβουλος
div.p: -ου [βουλή, plan], adviser, counselor.

div.head: συμμανθάνω
div.p: [μανθάνω, learn), learn with; become familiar with, get used to.

div.head: σύμμαχος
div.p: -ον [μάχομαι, fight], fighting along with, allied. As subst., masc., ally; neut. pl., helps, advantages.

div.head: συμμείγνυμι
div.p: [μείγνῦμι, μείξω, ἔμειξα, μέμειγμαι, ἐμείχθην and ἐμίγην, mix ], mix with, fall in with, join, join battle, begin battle (cp. slang ‘mix it up with’ any one), with dat. σύμπᾶς, -πᾶσα, -παν [πᾶς, all], all taken together, all. Neut. acc. as adv., τὸ σύμπαν, taking all things together, on the whole.

div.head: συμπέμπω
div.p: [πέμπω, send], send along with, send as escort, with acc. and dat.

div.head: συμπίπτω
div.p: [πίπτω, fall; bor., Eng. symptom ], fall together with, grapple with.

div.head: σύμπλεως
div.p: -ων [πλέως, full, cp. πίμπλημι, fill; cogn., Lat. plénus, full, Eng. full], well filled, with gen. Cp. ἔκπλεως.

div.head: συμποδίζω
div.p: [-ποδίζω, tie the feet], tie the feet together, hamper, impede.

div.head: συμπολεμέω
div.p: [πολεμέω, fight], fight on the same side with, help in war, with dat.

div.head: συμπορεύομαι
div.p: [πορεύομαι, advance], go along with, accompany. συμπράττω [πράττω, do], help in doing, cooperate with, with acc. of thing and dat. of person.

div.head: συμπροθυμέομαι
div.p: [προθυμέομαι, desire earnestly], join in earnestly desiring, be equally destrous, with acc. and inf.

div.head: συμφέρω
div.p: [φέρω, bear], bring together, collect; impers., be profitable, expedient, advantageous.

div.head: σύν
div.p: [bor., Eng. syl-, sym-, -syn-, sy-, or sys-, as in syllable, sympathy, syntax, system], prep. with dat., often used by Xenophon where other Attic prose writers would use

div.head: μετά
div.p: with gen., with. Idiomatic uses: on the side of, with the aid of, in codperation with, in (of dress); οἱ σὺν αὐτῷ, his men, his troops. In cpds, it signifies together, or denotes cooperation or accompantment, and becomes by assimilation or euphony συμbefore labials and μ, σνγbefore palatals, συλbefore λ, συρbefore ρ, συσbefore σ followed by a vowel, and συbefore ζ or σ followed by a consonant; cp. Eng. words (see above) beginning with syl-, svm-, syn-, and syor sys-.

div.head: συναγείρω
div.p: [ἀγείρω, collect], gather together, assemble.

div.head: συνάγω
div.p:
[ἄγω, lead; bor., Eng.
synagogue], bring together, collect, call together.

div.head: συναδικέω
div.p: [ἀδικέω, do wrong], join in wrong-doing, be an accomplice in crime, with dat.

div.head: συναιρέω
div.p: [αἱρέω, take; bor., synaeresis], take together, bring into small compass; ὡς συνελόντι εἰπεῖν, to speak concisely, σνυνακολουθέω [ἀκολουθέω, follow], follow on, accompany.

div.head: συναλλάττω
div.p: [ἀλλάττω, ἀλλάξω, ἤλλαξα, -ήλλαχα, ἤλλαγμαι, ἠλλάχθην and ἠλλάγην, change], change and bring together; pass., be reconciled, come to terms, with πρός and acc.

div.head: συναναβαίνω
div.p: [ἀναβαίνω, go up or inland ], go up or inland with, accompany inland, with dat.

div.head: συναντάω
div.p: συνήντησα [ἀντάω, meet, poetic], meet, συνάπειμι [ἄπειμι, go away], go away with, accompany back.

div.head: συνάπτω
div.p: [ἅπτω, fasten], fasten together; with μάχην and dat., join battle with, engage in battle with.

div.head: σύνδειπνος
div.p: -ου [δεῖπνον, dinner], guest at dinner.

div.head: συνδιαπράττομαι
div.p: [διαπράττομαι, mid., accomplish, stipulate], join in negotiations.

div.head: σύνειμι
div.p: [εἰμί, be], be with; οἱ συνόντες, associates, fellows.

div.head: σύνειμι
div.p: [εἶμι, go, come], come together, assemble, meet.

div.head: συνεισέρχομαι
div.p: [εἰσέρχομαι, go into], go into a place with one.

div.head: συνεκβαίνω
div.p: [ἐκβαίνω, go out or up], go out with, go up with.

div.head: συνεκβιβάζω
div.p: [βιβάζω, -βιβάσω or βιβῶ, -εβίβασα, causative of βαίνω, used mostly in cpds., cause to go], help get a thing out of difficulty.

div.head: συνεκκόπτω
div.p: [ἐκκόπτω, cut out or down], help cut down.

div.head: συνεπεύχομαι
div.p: [ἐπεύχομαι, vow], vow at the same time.

div.head: συνεπισπεύδω
div.p: [σπεύδω, hasten], help hurry on.

div.head: συνέπομαι
div.p: [ἕπομαι, follow], follow along with, accompany, with dat.

div.head: συνεργός
div.p: -όν [ἔργον, work], working with, Masc. as subst., coworker, helper.

div.head: συνέρχομαι
div.p: [ἔρχομαι, go, come], come together, assemble.

div.head: συνεφέπομαι
div.p: [ἐφέπομαι, follow after], follow closely after, accompany.

div.head: σύνθημα
div.p: -ατος, τό [συντίθημι], agreement, watchword. See Introd. § ὃ

div.head: συνίστημι
div.p: [ἵστημι, cause to stand], bring together, introduce.

div.head: σύνοδος
div.p: -ου, ἡ [ὁδός, way; bor., Eng. synod], meeting, of armies, encounter.

div.head: σύνοιδα
div.p: [olda, know], share in knowledge, with dat. of reflexive pron. and ptc. in indir. disc., be conscious of, feel in one’s conscience.

div.head: συνολολύζω
div.p: [ὀλολύζω, ὀλολύξομαι, ὠλόλυξα, cry aloud, cogn., Lat. ululo, howl, ulula, owl, Eng. howl, owl], cry aloud at the same time.

div.head: συνομολογέω
div.p: [ὁμολογέω, agree], agree with or to, consent to, with acc. of thing.

div.head: συνοράω
div.p: [ὁράω, see], see all together, see at a glance; with ἀλλήλους, watch each other.

div.head: συνουσία
div.p: -ας [σύνειμι, be with ], being together, intercourse, conference. συντάττω [τάττω, draw up; bor., Eng. syntax], draw up together or in line of battle, arrange, marshal; ταῖά., form in line or in battle array.

div.head: συντίθημι
div.p: [τίθημι, put, bor., Eng. synthesis], put logether,; mid., make a covenant or agreement, agree on.

div.head: σύντομος
div.p: -ov [τέμνω, cut; bor., Eng. atom, epitome], cut short, short.

div.head: συντράπεζος
div.p: -ου [τράπεζα, table], table companion; see ὁμοτράπεζος.

div.head: συντρίβω
div.p: [τρίβω, τρίψω, ἔτριψα, τέτριφα, τέτρίμμαι, ἐτρίφθην and ἐτρίβην, rub], rub together, crush.

div.head: συντυγχάνω
div.p: [τυγχάνω, happen], =happen upon, fall in with, meet, with dat.

div.head: συνωφελέω
div.p: [ὠφελέω, help], contribute to help.

div.head: Συρακόσιος
div.p: -ον [Συράκουσαι, Syracuse], Syracusan, a citizen of Syracuse, an important city on the east coast of Sicily.

div.head: Συρία
div.p: -ας, Syria, a country in Asia, including the territory south of Cilicia and the Euphrates, as far as Arabia, except Phoenicia and Palestine on the Mediterranean coast. Xenophon applies the name also to Mesopotamia, 74, 23.

div.head: Σύριος
div.p: -α, -ον [Σύρος], of Syria, Syrian.

div.head: Σύρος
div.p: -ου, Syrian, an inhabitant of Syria.

div.head: συρρέω
div.p: [ῥέω, flow], stream together, flock together.

div.head: συσκευάζω
div.p: [σκευάζω, σκευάσω, ἐσκεύασα, ἐσκεύασμαι, -εσκευάσθην, prepare], get together; mid., pack up one’s own things.

div.head: συσπάω
div.p: [σπάω, draw], draw together, sew together. συσπειράομαι, συνεσπείρᾶμαι, συνεσπειράθην [σπειράομαι, be coiled or folded ], be rolled together; of troops, be in close formation.

div.head: συσπουδάζω
div.p: [σπουδάζω, make haste], make haste with, join in eager activity.

div.head: συστρατεύομαι
div.p: [στρατεύω, make an expedition], mid., join in an expedition.

div.head: συστράτηγος
div.p: -ου [στρατηγός, general ], fellow-general.

div.head: συστρατιώτης
div.p: -ου [στρατιώτης, soldier), fellow-soldter, comrade.

div.head: συστρατοπεδεύομαι
div.p: [στρατοπεδεύω, encamp ], encamp with, with σύν and dat.

div.head: συχνός
div.p: -ή, -όν, considerable, long. Neut. acc. as adv., διαλείποντα συχνόν, at considerable intervals.

div.head: σφαγιάζομαι
div.p: ἐσφαγιασάμην [σφάγιον], sacrifice a victim, make a propitiatory offering.

div.head: σφάγιον
div.p: -ου [cp. σφάζω], sacrificial victim; pl., sacrifice, usually made to propitiate a deity; omens, καὶ τὰ ἱερὰ καλὰ καὶ τὰ σφάγια καλά, the omens not only from the regular but also from the special propitiatory sacrifice were favorable, 91, 23. Cp.

div.head: ἱερός
div.p: and see p. 45, footnote.

div.head: σφάζω
div.p: σφάξω, ἔσφαξα, ἔσφαγμαι, ἐσφάγην, slaughter, kill.

div.head: σφενδονάω
div.p: [σφενδόνη], sling, use the sling.

div.head: σφενδόνη
div.p: -ης, sling, sling stone, bullet. See Introd. § 59, and Figs. 50, 51, pp. 162, 163.

div.head: σφενδονήτης
div.p: -ου [σφενδονάω], ], slinger. See Introd. §§ 57, 59, and Fig. 50, p. 162.

div.head: σφόδρα
div.p: [σφοδρός, vehement], adv., very, very much, implicitly, exceedingly.

div.head: σχεδία
div.p: -ας, raft, float. 42, pp. 78, 125.

div.head: σχεδόν
div.p: adv., nearly, almost, about, chiefly.

div.head: σχῆμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [cp. σχήσω, fut. of

div.head: ἔχω
div.p: have; bor, Eng. scheme], form, arrangement, formation.

div.head: σχίζω
div.p: ἔσχισα, ἐσχίσθην [cogn., Lat. scindο, split, Eng. shed (the verb, and in watershed); bor, Eng. schism ], split.

div.head: σχολάζω
div.p: ἐσχόλασα, ἐσχόλακα [σχολή; bor., Eng. scholastic], have leisure, be at liberty.

div.head: σχολαῖος
div.p: -α, -ον [σχολή], leisurely, slow. σχολαίως, comp. σχολαίτερον [σχολαῖος], adv., leisurely, slowly, lazily.

div.head: σχολή
div.p: -ῆς, [bor., Eng. school, scholium], leisure,; dat. as adv., slowly.

div.head: σῴζω
div.p: σώσω, ἔσωσα, σέσωκα, σέσωμαι and σέσωσμαι, ἐσώθην [cp. σῶος; bor., Eng. creosote], save, rescue; retain, keep; pass., be saved, save oneself, return safely.

div.head: Σωκράτης
div.p: -ους, ὁ, Socrates, (1) an Achaean, one of Cyrus’s Greek generals; (2) the Athenian philosopher, friend of Xenophon. See Introd. §§ 28, 30, and Fig. 45, p. 141. See Figs. 25.

div.head: σῶμα
div.p: -ατος, τό, body, life, person; σώματα ἀνδρῶν, men, 211, 14. σῶος, -α, -ον, safe, alive and well.

div.head: Σῶσις
div.p: -ἰος, ὁ, Sosis, of Syracuse, one of Cyrus’s Greek generals.

div.head: σωτήρ
div.p: -ῆρος, ὁ [σῴζω], savior, deliverer, a title of Zeus. σωτηρίᾳ, -ας [fem. of σωτήριος], safety, deliverance. Σωτηρίδας, -ου, Soteridas, of Sicyon, a soldier in Cyrus’s Greek army.

div.head: σωτήριος
div.p: -α, -ον [σωτήρ], bringing safety or deliverance. Neut. pl. as subst., thank-offerings for deliverance.

div.head: σωφροσύνη
div.p: -ης [σώφρων (σῶος, φρήν, mind), sound-minded, temperate], self-control, prudence, moderation.

div.head: τάλαντον
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. tollo, lift], scale; weight; talent, a sum of money (not a coin), equiv. to 6000 Attic drachmas, about $1080.

div.head: ταμιεύω
div.p: ταμιεύσω, τεταμίευμαι [ταμίας

div.head: (τέμνω
div.p: cut), carver, steward], be steward, parcel out.

div.head: Ταμώς
div.p: -ώ, ὁ, Tamos, an Egyptian in command of Cyrus’s fleet.

div.head: ταξίαρχος
div.p: -οὐ [τάξις, ἄρχω, command ], commander of a division. See Introd. § 56, footnote; § 57.

div.head: τάξις
div.p: -εως, ἡ arrangement, order; discipline; rank, line, line of battle; place assigned, post, body of soldiers of indefinite number, division, τὰ ἀμφὶ τάξεις, tactics.

div.head: Τάοχοι
div.p:
-ων, Taochi, Taochians, a
tribe near the southeastern shore of the Black Sea.

div.head: ταπεινός
div.p: -ή, -όν, low, humble, submissive. ταράττω, ταράξω, ἐτάραξα, τετάραγμαι, ἐταράχθην, trouble, stir up, agitate, throw into confusion.

div.head: τάραχος
div.p: -ου [ταράττω], tumult, confusion. Ταρσοί, -ῶν (commonly Ταρσός, -ου), Tarsus, the capital of Cilicia, birthplace of St. Paul.

div.head: τάττω
div.p: τάξω, ἔταξα, τέταχα, τέταγμαι, ἐτάχθην [bor., Eng. tactics, taxidermy], errange, draw up, marshal, station; assign, detail for a duty, order, mid., take a position;

div.head: ἐν
div.p: τῷ τεταγμένῳ, in the position assigned him, 162, 27.

div.head: ταῦρος
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. taurus, bull, Eng. steer], bull.

div.head: ταύτῃ
div.p: (dat. fem. of οὗτος, this], adv. (sc. ὁδῷ, way), in this way or direction; in this place, here, of manner, in this way, in this.

div.head: τάφος
div.p: -ου [θάπτω, bury, bor., Eng. epitaph, cenotaph ], tomb, grave.

div.head: τάφρος
div.p: -ου, ἡ [cp. τάφος, ditch, trench.

div.head: τάχα
div.p: [ταχύς], adv., quickly, forthwith. ταχέως [ταχύς], adv., quickly, speedily, swiftly.

div.head: τάχος
div.p: -ους, τό [ταχύς; bor., Eng. tachometer], quickness, speed.

div.head: ταχύς
div.p: -εἴα, -ύ, Comp. θάττων, sup. τάχιστος [bor., Eng. tachygraphy, tachymeter], guich, swift; διὰ ταχέων, by quick measures, quickly; τὴν ταχίστην ὁδόν, by the quickest way; τὴν ταχίστην, the quickest way, as speedily as possible, Neut. acc. as adv., ταχύ, quickly, soon; comp. θᾶττον, more quickly, more swiftly, quicker, faster; sup. τάχιστα, usually with an adv., with or without a form of δύναμαι, as ὡς (or ὅτι) τάχιστα, as quickly as possible, ᾗ (or ὅπῃ) ἐδύνατο τάχιστα, as fast as he could; ὡς (or ἐπὰν or ἐπειδὰν) τάχιστα, as soon as. τέ, by elision and euphony, τ᾽, θ᾽ [cogn., Lat. -que, and], enclitic conj., and, τὲ... τέ, τὲ καί, τὲ...

div.head: καί
div.p: both... and, not only... but also, but the first correlative may often be untranslated.

div.head: τέθριππον
div.p: -ου [τέτταρες, ἵππος, horse], four-horse chariot, chariot and four. See Fig. 33, p. 92.

div.head: τείνω
div.p: τενῶ, ἔτεινα, -τέτακα, τέταμαι, ἐτάθην [cogn., Lat. tendo, stretch, tenuis, slim, Eng. thin; bor., Eng. hypotenuse, tone, tune (produced by stretching the vocal cords or the strings of a lyre)], stretch; intr., exert oneself, hasten, Lat. contendo.

div.head: τεῖχος
div.p: -ους, τό, wall; fortification, fortress.

div.head: τεκμαίρομαι
div.p: τεκμαροῦμαι, ἐτεκμηράμην (cp. τεκμήριον), judge from signs, infer.

div.head: τεκμήριον
div.p: -ου, Sign, proof, evidence.

div.head: τέκνον
div.p: -ου, child.

div.head: τελέθω
div.p: poetic, become, be, come out. τελειταῖος, -α, -ον [τελευτή], last, in the rear. Masc., pl. as subst., rear guard, rear.

div.head: τελευτάω
div.p:
τελευτήσω, ἐτελεύτησα, τετελεύτηκα, ἐτελευτήθην [τελευτή], ], finish , intr. (sc. βίου), end one’s life, die. Ptc. as adv., τελευτῶν, at last, finally; cp. τέλος. τελεντή, -ῆς [cp. τέλος], ], end, with or
without τοῦ βίου, end of life, end (cp. ‘a peaceful end‘).

div.head: τελέω
div.p: τελῶ and τελέσω, ἐτέλεσα, τετέλεκα, τετέλεσμαι, ἐτελέσθην [τέλος], complete; of a debt or other obligation, pay.

div.head: τέλος
div.p: -ους, τό, end, result, outcome,; pl, magistrates, as the final authority in the government. Acc. sing. as adv., at last, finally.

div.head: τερμίνθινος
div.p: -η, -ον [τέρμινθος, turpentine tree], of turpentine.

div.head: τέταρτος
div.p: -η, -ον [τέτταρες], fourth; τετάρτῃ (sc. ἡμέρᾳ), on the fourth day.

div.head: τετρακισχίλιοι
div.p: -αι, -α [τετράκις, four times, χίλιοι, thousand], four thousand.

div.head: τετρακόσιοι
div.p: -αι, -α [τέτταρες], four hundred ; sing. with collective noun, 85, 15.

div.head: τετταράκοντα
div.p: [τέτταρες], forty.

div.head: τέτταρες
div.p: -α, gen. -ων [cogn., Lat. quattuor, four, Eng. four; bor., Eng. tetragon, tetrarch], four; ἐπὶ τεττάρων, four deep.

div.head: Τευθρανία
div.p: -ας, Teuthrania, a district in western Asia Minor, including the famous city of Pergamus.

div.head: τέχνη
div.p: -ης [bor., Eng. technical, technology], art, skill; way, means.

div.head: τέως
div.p: adv., so long, τέως αὐτοὺς ἀναβαίνοντας, all the time that they were going up, 187, 2.

div.head: τῇ
div.p: [dat. fem. of ὁ as dem. pron.], adv., here, τῇ mev... τῇ δέ, in one respect... in another, here... there.

div.head: τήκω
div.p: -τήξω, -έτηξα, τέτηκα, ἐτάκην indecl., and ἐτήχθην, melt; intr. in pass. and pf. act., melt, thaw.

div.head: Τηλεβόας
div.p: -ου, Teledoas, a little river of Armenia, flowing into the Euphrates.

div.head: τήμερον
div.p: [τ-, dem. prefix, + ἡμέρα, day], to-day, Lat. hodié,; τὴν τήμερον ἡμέραν, to-day, Lat. hodiernum diem.

div.head: Τημνίτης
div.p: -ου, Temnite, a citizen of Temnus, in Aeolis.

div.head: τηνικαῦτα
div.p: adv., at that time, then.

div.head: τιάρα
div.p: -ας, tiara, a Persian headdress, similar to the modern turban; τιάρα ὀρθή, upright tiara, the special mark of the king, 130, 7. See Fig. 43, p. 130.

div.head: Τίγρης
div.p: -ητος, ὁ, Zigris, a large river of western Asia, joining the Euphrates below Babylon.

div.head: τίθημι
div.p: θήσω, ἔθηκα, τέθηκα, τέθειμαι (rare, κεῖμαι being used instead), ἐτέθην [root be, cogn., Lat. -do, as in abdo, put away, hide, Eng. do; bor., Eng. theme, thesis, parenthesis], put, place, rest. Idiomatic uses: of games, hold; θέσθαι τὰ ὅπλα, order arms, halt under arms, stand with one end of spear and shield resting on the ground, ready for instant use, 79, 28; ground arms, lay them on the ground, to rest the men, 104, 3; with εἰς τάξιν, get under arms in line of battle, 114, 14; with κατὰ χώραν, return to quarters (lit., put the arms in their place, i.e. in the camp arsenal, see ὅπλον), 80, 13.

div.head: Τιμασίων
div.p: -ωνος, Timasion, of Dardanus in the Troad, elected a general in the Greek army.

div.head: τιμάω
div.p: τιμήσω, etc. [τιμή], honor, hold in honor.

div.head: τίμιος
div.p: -α, -ον [Tiny], honorable; honored, held in esteem.

div.head: τιμωρέω
div.p: τιμωρήσω, etc. [τιμωρός, avenger ἀεί, help, avenge; mid., take vengeance on, punish, τιμωρίᾶ, -ας [τιμωρέω], punishment.

div.head: Τιρίβαζος
div.p: -ου, Tiribazus, governor of western Armenia, under the satrap Orontas.

div.head: τίς
div.p: τί, gen. τίνος and τοῦ, interrogative pron., either adj. or subst., who? which? what? τί as adv., why? for what? in what respect ? how ? τὶς, τὶ, gen. τινός and τοῦ, indefinite pron., enclitic, as subst., anybody, anything, somebody, something, a man, one; pl., some; as adj., a, any, a certain, a sort of; making an adj. or pron. more indefinite, of μέν τινες, some few, moon πόση τις, how ‘large? ὁποῖόν τι, whatever; τὶ as adv., somewhat, a bit.

div.head: Τισσαφέρνης
div.p: -ους, Tissaphernes, satrap of Lydia and Caria, and in control of the Greek cities along the western coast of Asia Minor; contemporary with Cyrus the younger, whose plans he tried in every way to frustrate, and whose satrapy he received after the battle of Cunaxa. Parysatis, in revenge for his enmity to her favorite son, ultimately brought about his death, 395 B.C.

div.head: τιτρώσκω
div.p: τρώσω, ἔτρωσα, τέτρωμαι, ἐτρώθην, wound.

div.head: τλήμων
div.p: -ον, gen. -ονος [cp. τολμάω; cogn., Lat. tollo, lift], enduring, wretched; οἱ τλήμονες, the poor sufferers. τοί [ originally ethical dat. of τύ = σύ, you ], postpositive enclitic adv., you know, let me tell you, in truth, but often best translated by emphasis.

div.head: τοιγαροῦν
div.p: [τοί + γάρ, really, + οὖν, therefore], adv. of inference, and so of course, and so naturally.

div.head: τοίνυν
div.p: [τοί + νύν, then], postpositive adv. of inference, therefore, then, well then.

div.head: τοιόσδε
div.p: -άδε, -όνδε [τοῖος, such, + -δε (cp. ὅδε), here], dem. adj., such as this (which follows), about as follows.

div.head: τοιοῦτος
div.p: τοιαύτη, τοιοῦτο and τοιοῦτον [ τοῖος, such, οὗτος, this], dem. adj., such as this (which precedes), of such a kind, such, to this effect (as stated above); ἐν τοιούτῳ, in such a critical situation, 84, 15; τοιούτων εἰς φιλίαν, such grounds for friendship.

div.head: τολμάω
div.p: τολμήσω, etc. [cp. τλήμων; cogn., Lat. tollo, lift], endure, have the courage; venture, dare.

div.head: Τολμίδης
div.p: -ου, Tolmides, of Elis, a noted Greek herald.

div.head: τόξευμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [τοξεύω], arrow.

div.head: τοξεύω
div.p: -τοξεύσομαι, ἐτόξευσα, τετόξευμαι, ἐτοξεύθην [τόξον], shoot with the bow, shoot arrows, pass., be hit or shot with an arrow.

div.head: τοξικός
div.p: -ή, -όν, [τόξον; bor., Eng. toxicology, toxin], pertaining to the bow, ἡ τοξική (sc. τέχνη), archery.

div.head: τοξότης
div.p: -ου [τόξον], bowman, archer. In the Greek army the bowmen were chiefly Cretans and Scythians, See Introd. § 57, and Fig. 49, p. 161.

div.head: τόπος
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. topic, topography, Utopia), place, district, region.

div.head: τοσόσδε
div.p: -ήδε, -όνδε, [τόσος, so great, + -δε (cp. ὅδε), here], dem. adj., so great, pl., so many, only so many, so few.

div.head: τοσοῦτος
div.p:
-αὐτη, -ουῦτο and -οῦτον [τόσος, so great, οὗτος, this}, dem, adj.
so great, so much, pl. so many; that great, 182, 12; only so much, merely this, merely, usually referring to what precedes, sometimes to what follows; τοσούτῳ with comp., the, so much the. Neut. as subst. such a distance, 173, 4. Neut. acc. as adv., so much, So far.

div.head: τότε
div.p: adv., at that time, then; οἱ τότε, the men of that time.

div.head: τράγημα
div.p: -ατος, τό [τρώγω, nibble], commonly pl., sweetmeats, dainties.

div.head: Τράλλεις
div.p: -εων, αἱ, Tralles, a city in northern Caria.

div.head: τράπεζα
div.p: -ns [cp. τέτταρες, four, πούς, foot; bor., trapezium, trapezoid ], table, originally one with four legs.

div.head: Τραπεζούντιος
div.p: -ου, Trapezuntian, a citizen of Trapézus.

div.head: Τραπεζοῦς
div.p: -οῦντος, ἡ, Trapézus, the modern Trebizond, an important Greek city on the southeastern shore of the Black Sea.

div.head: τραῦμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [τιτρώσκω, wound ], wound.

div.head: τράχηλος
div.p: -ου, neck, throat.

div.head: τραχύς
div.p: -εῖα, -ύ [bor., Eng. trachea, trachoma], rough, harsh; ἡ τραχεῖα (sc. γῆ), rough ground.

div.head: τρεῖς
div.p: τρία, gen. τριῶν [cogn., Lat. tres, three, Eng. three], three, τρεῖς καὶ δέκα, thirteen.

div.head: τρέπω
div.p: τρέψω, ἔτρεψα and ἐτραπόμην, τέτροφα and τέτραφα, τέτραμμαι, ἐτρέφθην and ἐτράπην, turn, divert; with εἰς φυγήν, put to flight; mid., turn, turn aside, indulge in; of a road, go, 177, 26.

div.head: τρέφω
div.p: θρέψω, ἔθρεψα, τέτροφα, τέθραμμαι, ἐθρέφθην (only in ptc. in Attic prose) and ἐτράφην, nourish; maintain, support, rear, raise.

div.head: τρέχω
div.p: δραμοῦμαι, ἔδραμον, -δεδράμηκα, -δεδράμημαι, run.

div.head: τρέω
div.p: ἔτρεσα [cogn., Lat. tremo, tremble, terreo, frighten), tremble; transitive, shrink from, flee from. τρία, set Tpeis.

div.head: τριάκοντα
div.p: [τρεῖς; cogn., Lat. triginta, thirty], indecl., thirty.

div.head: τριακόσιοι
div.p: -αι, -α [τρεῖς], three hundred.

div.head: τριήρης
div.p: -ους, ἡ [τρεῖς, cp. ἐρέττω, row ], trireme, man-of-war, a long narrow galley with three banks of oars, and fitted with a ram on or just below the water line. The crew of a a reme numbered about 200 men; of these 150 were oarsmen, who probably rowed in three shifts of 50 men each. The exact arrangement of the rowers is not certain. See Figs. 19, 20, pp. 69, 71. Cp. ναῦς.

div.head: τρίπηχυς
div.p: -υ [τρεῖς, πῆχυς, cubit (=1.5 feet)], three cubits long.

div.head: τρισάσμενος
div.p: -η, -ον [τρίς, thrice, ἄσμενος, glad ], thrice glad, with the greatest pleasure.

div.head: τρισχίλιοι
div.p: -αι, -α [τρίς, thrice, χίλιοι, thousand ἄγε three thousand.

div.head: τρίτος
div.p: -η, -ον [τρεῖς], third, τρίτῃ or τῇ τρίτῃ (sc. ἡμέρᾳ), on the third day; ἐπὶ τῷ τρίτῳ, the third blast; τὸ τρίτον, for the third time.

div.head: τριχῇ
div.p: [τρεῖς], adv., threefold, in three divisions.

div.head: τρίχινος
div.p: -η, -ον [θρίξ, gen. τριχός, hair; bor., Eng. trichinosis, trichology ], of hair, made of hair.

div.head: τρόπαιον
div.p:
-ου [τροπή; bor., Eng. trophy ], trophy, a memorial of the enemy’s defeat, consisting of captured armor and weapons fastened up on a trunk of a tree or a post at the place where the enemy turned in flight (whence the name). Such trophies
(see Fig. 71, p. 214) were of course only temporary. More permanent memorials were formed by armor and weapons which were taken home and deposited as votive offerings in temples; see 152, 23.

div.head: τροπή
div.p: -ῆς, [τρόπω, turn; bor., Eng. tropic, heliotrope], turning of the enemy, flight, rout.

div.head: τρόπος
div.p: -ου [τρέπω, turn, bor., Eng. trope], turn, way, manner, means; character, habits, tastes, disposition .

div.head: ἐκ
div.p: παντὸς τρόπου, by any means, no matter how; τρόπῳ τινί, after a fashion; τόνδε τὸν τρόπον, in the following manner.

div.head: τροφή
div.p: -ῆς [τρέφω, nourish; bor., Eng. atrophy, hypertrophy], support, maintenance.

div.head: τρυπάω
div.p: τετρύπημαι [τρύπη, hole; bor., Eng. trepan], dove, pierce; τὰ ὦτα τετρύπημαι, I have had my ears bored.

div.head: τρωτός
div.p: -ή, -όν (verbal of τιτρώσκω), liable to wounds, vulnerable.

div.head: τυγχάνω
div.p: τεύξομαι, ἔτυχον, τετύχηκα, hit, obtain, get, secure, find, meet, with gen.; chance, happen, esp. with supplementary ptc., which may often be translated as the main verb while τυγχάνω is rendered adverbially, by chance, as it happened, etc.; παρὼν ἐτύγχανε, he was present by chance, he happened to be present.

div.head: Τυριάειον
div.p: -ου Tyriaeum, a city of southern Phrygia.

div.head: τυρός
div.p: -ου [from βούτυρον, cow-cheese, is bor. Eng. butter], cheese.

div.head: τύρσις
div.p: -ιος, ἡ [cogn., Lat. turris, tower], tower, turret.

div.head: τύχη
div.p: -ης [τυγχάνω], fortune, chance.

div.head: ὑβρίζω
div.p: ὑβριῶ, ὕβρισα, ὕβρικα, ὕβρισμαι, ὑβρίσθην [ὕβρις], be insolent, ιnsult, maltreat, outrage.

div.head: ὕβρις
div.p: -εως, ἡ, ιnsolence, violence.

div.head: ὑγιαίνω
div.p: ὑγίᾶνα [ὑγιής, healthy; bor., Eng. hygiene], be in good health.

div.head: ὑδροφορέω
div.p: [ὑδροφόρος, carry water.

div.head: ὑδροφόρος
div.p: -ον [ὕδωρ, φέρω, carry], carrying water. Masc. and fem, as subst., water carrier.

div.head: ὕδωρ
div.p: ὕδατος, τό [cogn., Lat. unda, wave, Eng. water, wet, otter; bor., Eng. hydra, hydrant, hydraulic, hydrophobia ], water; ὕδωρ ἐξ οὐρανοῦ, rain.

div.head: ὕλη
div.p: -ης, [cogn., Lat. silva, forest], forest, wood, shrub, bush.

div.head: ὑμέτερος
div.p: -α, -ον [ὑμεῖς], your, yours.

div.head: υἱός
div.p: -ου [cogn., Eng. son], son.

div.head: ὑπάγω
div.p: [ἄγω, lead], lead under; intr., lead on slowly, advance slowly, mid., lead on craftily, induce, uggest craftily.

div.head: ὑπαίτιος
div.p: -ον [αἴτιος, responsible], responsible, accountable; ὑπαίτιόν τι, a thing to be accounted for, a cause for blame.

div.head: ὑπακούω
div.p: [ἀκούω, hear], hear submissively, listen to, with gen.

div.head: ὑπαναχωρέω
div.p: [ἀναχωρέω, retire], retire slowly.

div.head: ὑπαντάω
div.p: [ἀντάω, meet], go to meet.

div.head: ὕπαρχος
div.p: -ου [ἄρχω, rule], underofficer, lieutenant; lieutenant governor of a province.

div.head: ὑπάρχω
div.p: [ἄρχω, begin], begin, take the lead, with supplementary ptc.; be at the beginning, be at hand, exist; be devoted to, favor, support, with dat.

div.head: ὑπασπιστής
div.p:
-ου [ὑπασπίζω, carry
σοῦ a shield (ἀσπίς), shield bearer, a slave attending an officer or a heavy-armed soldier.

div.head: ὕπειμι
div.p: [εἰμί, be], be under, be underneath.

div.head: ὑπέρ
div.p: [cogn., Lat. super, above, Eng. over; bor., Eng. hyperbola, hyperbole, hypercritical], prep. with gen. or acc., over. With gen., over, above, beyond; down over; in behalf of, in defense of. With acc., beyond. In cpds., over, above, exceedingly, in behalf of; cp. Eng. words (see above) beginning with hyper-.

div.head: ὑπερβάλλω
div.p: [βάλλω, throw], throw over; pass over, cross over, cross.

div.head: ὑπερβολή
div.p: -ῆς, [ὑπερβάλλω; bor., Eng. hyperbola, hyperbole], crossing, passage; mountain pass.

div.head: ὑπερδέξιος
div.p: -ον [δεξιός, right], above or high on the right, high, elevated.

div.head: ὑπερέρχομαι
div.p: [ἔρχομαι, go], go over, pass over.

div.head: ὑπερέχω
div.p: [ἔχω, have, be], be above, project, overhang.

div.head: ὕπερθεν
div.p: [ὑπέρ], adv., from above, above.

div.head: ὑπερύψηλος
div.p: -ον [ὑψηλός], exceedingly high.

div.head: ὑπήκοος
div.p: -ον [ὑπακούω], obedient, subject to, with dat.

div.head: ὑπηρετέω
div.p: ὑπηρετήσω, ὑπηρέτησα, ὑπηρέτηκα, ὑπηρέτημαι [ὑπηρέτης], serve, help, supply, with dat. of person.

div.head: ὑπηρέτης
div.p: -ου [ἐρέττω, row] (underrower), assistant, servant.

div.head: ὑπισχνέομαι
div.p: ὑποσχήσομαι, ὑπεσχόμην, ὑπέσχημαι [cp. ἔχω, have], hold oneself under an engagement, promise, with dat. of person, and acc. of thing or fut. inf.

div.head: ὕπνος
div.p: -ον [cogn., Lat. sopor, somnus, sleep; bor., Eng. hypnosis, hypnotism ], sleep.

div.head: ὑπό
div.p: by elision and euphony ὑπ᾽ or ὑφ᾽ [cogn., Lat. sub, under; bor., Eng. hypocrite, hypodermic, hypothesis], prep. with gen., dat., or acc., under. With gen., of agency or cause, by, from, at the hands of; ὑπὸ. μαστίγων, under the lash. With dat., depending on verbs of rest, under, at the foot of. With acc., depending on verbs expressing or implying motion, under, at or along the foot of. In cpds., under, underhandedly, somewhat, slightly; cp. Eng. words (see above) beginning with hypo-.

div.head: ὑποδεής
div.p: -ές [δέω, lack], found only in comp. ὑποδεέστερος, somewhat inferior, of lower rank.

div.head: ὑποδέχομαι
div.p: [δέχομαι, receive], receive under protection, receive hospitably, welcome.

div.head: ὑποδέω
div.p: [δέω, δέρμα, bind under, of sandals or shoes, put on, ὑποδεδεμένοι, with shoes on, 204, 17.

div.head: ὑπόδημα
div.p: -ατος, τό [ὑποδέω], sandal, shoe, of wood or leather, sometimes with a narrow strip of leather on the front or sides, and fastened with thongs, as shown in Fig. 67, p. 204.

div.head: ὑποζύγιον
div.p: -ου [ὑπὸ ζυγῷ, under the yoke], beast under the yoke, beast of burden; pl., pack animals, baggage animals.

div.head: ὑπολαμβάνω
div.p: [λαμβάνω, take], take under one’s protection; take up a conversation, answer, μεταξὺ ὑπολαβών, interrupting.

div.head: ὑπολείπω
div.p: [λείπω, leave], leave behind.

div.head: ὑπολύω
div.p: [λύω, loosel, loose beneath; mid., take off one’s sandals or shoes.

div.head: ὑπομαλακίζομαι
div.p: [μαλακίζομαι, ἐμαλακισάμην, ἐμαλακίσθην, be softened}, grow soft a little, lose courage somewhat.

div.head: ὑπομένω
div.p: [μένω, remain], stay behind, wait, stop, stand ones ground; transitive, wait for.

div.head: ὑπόμνημα
div.p: -ατος, τό [ὑπομιμνῄσκω, remind ], reminder.

div.head: ὑπόπεμπτος
div.p: (verbal of ὑποπέμπω), sent underhandedly, treacherously sent.

div.head: ὑποπέμπω
div.p: [πέμπω, send ], send underhandedly or secretly, send with oY entent.

div.head: ὑποπτεύω
div.p: ὑποπτεύσω, ὑπώπτευσα, ὑπωπτεύθην [ὕποπτος (verbal of

div.head: ὑφοράω)
div.p: suspected ], view with suspicion, suspect, apprehend, with acc. or acc. and inf.;. be apprehensive, fear, with μή and opt.

div.head: ὑποστράτηγος
div.p: -ου [ὑπὸ στρατηγῷ, under a general ], lieutenant general, See Introd. § 54.

div.head: ὑποστρέφω
div.p: [στρέφω, turn], turn round unexpectedly; make a clever turn, avoid a trap.

div.head: ὑποφαίνω
div.p: [φαίνω], show a little; intr., dawn, break.

div.head: ὑποφείδομαι
div.p: [φείδομαι, φείσομαι, ἐφεισάμην, spare], spare a little.

div.head: ὑποχείριος
div.p: -ον [ὑπὸ χειρί, under the hand in the power of, subject to, with dat.

div.head: ὕποχος
div.p: -ον [ἔχω, have], subject to, under the control of, with dat.

div.head: ὑποχωρέω
div.p: [χωρέω, give way], retire gradually, make way, retreat, abs. or with dat.

div.head: ὑποψία
div.p: -ας [cp. ὑποπτεύω], suspicion, distrust.

div.head: ὑστεραῖος
div.p: -α, -ον [ὕστερος], later, following; τῇ ὑστεραίᾳ (sc. ἡμέρᾳ) or

div.head: εἰς
div.p: τὴν ὑστεραίαν, on the following day, on the next day; τὴν ὕστεραίαν, during the next day.

div.head: ὑστερέω
div.p: ὑστέρησα, ὑστέρηκα [ὕστεpos], be later, come too late for, with gen.

div.head: ὕστερος
div.p: -α, -ον [cogn., Eng. out, utter], later, behind. Neut. acc. as adv., later, afterwards, with gen., after.

div.head: ὑφηγέομαι
div.p: [ἡγέομαι, lead], lead on slowly.

div.head: ὑφίημι
div.p: [ἴημι, send], let down, yield; concede, with acc. and inf.; mid., give up, submit.

div.head: ὑφίστημι
div.p: [ἵστημι, cause fo stand], station secretly; intr., in mid. and 2 aor. act., offer oneself, volunteer; stand ομες ground.

div.head: ὑφοράω
div.p: [ὁράω, see], view with suspicion, suspect.

div.head: ὑψηλός
div.p: -ή, -όν [ὕψος], high, lofty. Neut. as subst., height.

div.head: ὕψος
div.p: -ους, τό [cp. ὑπέρ, above], height.

div.head: φαιδρός
div.p: -ά, -όν [cp. φαίνω], bright, beaming, cheery.

div.head: φαίνω
div.p:
φανῶ, ἔφηνα, -πέφαγκα and πέφηνα, πέφασμαι, ἐφάνθην and ἐφάνην [bor., Eng. phase, phantasm, fantastic, fancy, phenomenon, diaphanous], make appear, show. Idiomatic uses: intr., shine, mid., pass., and 2 pf. act., be shown, show oneself, be seen, seem, appear; with supplementary ptc., not of appearances, but of what is manifestly true, as οὐ φθονῶν ἐφαίνετο,
510 it was clear that he did not envy, he evidently did not envy, 98, 12.

div.head: φάλαγξ
