div.p: -αγγος, ἡ [bor., Eng. phalanx phalanx, line of battle, Lat. aciés; ἐπὶ φάλαγγος, in line of battle; sometimes, main body of an army, on the march or in camp. See Introd. § 66.

div.head: Φαλῖνος
div.p: -ου, Phalinus, a Greek instructor in tactics, in the service of Tissaphernes.

div.head: φανερός
div.p: -ά, -όν [φαίνω], open to view, visible, manifest, in plain sight, with supplementary ptc., often to be translated impersonally, as ἐπιβουλεύων φανερὸς γέγονας, ιt has been made clear that you are plotting, 82, 11;

div.head: ἐν
div.p: τῷ φανερῷ, openly. φανερῶς [φανερός], adv., openly.

div.head: φαρέτρα
div.p: -ας, quιver. p. 200.

div.head: φαρμακοποσία
div.p: -ας [φάρμακον (whence is bor. Eng. pharmacy), drug, πίνω, drink], taking poison, drugging. Φασιᾶνοί, -ῶν [Φᾶσις; bor., Eng. pheasant ], Phasiani, an Armenian tribe, living along the Phasis River.

div.head: Φᾶσις
div.p: -ιος, ὁ, Phasis, the upper Araxes, a river in northeastern Armenia, flowing into the Caspian Sea.

div.head: φάσκω
div.p: [φημί], assert; allege, claim.

div.head: φέρω
div.p: οἴσω, ἤνεγκα and ἤνεγκον, ἐνήγοχα, ἐνήνεγμαι, ἠνέχθην [cogn., Lat. fero, bear, Eng. bear; bor., Eng. metaphor, phosphorus, Christopher], dear, bring, carry, carry away. Idiomatic uses: of a road, lead; draw pay; produce crops; bear, endure; βαρέως or χαλεπῶς φέρειν, be heavy at heart, be grieved; φέρειν See Fig. 64, καὶ ἄγειν, plunder, see ἄγω; pass., be borne, be thrown, rush on.

div.head: φεύγω
div.p: φεύξομαι and φευξοῦμαι, ἔφυγον, πέφευγα [cogn., Lat. fugio, flee], flee, run away; flee from, with acc.; flee from one’s country, be exiled orbanished.

div.head: φημί
div.p: φήσω, ἔφησα, common only in pres. and impf. [cogn, Lat. fari, speak, bor., Eng. euphemism, prophet ], say, assert, abs., with inf., acc. and inf., or nom. and inf. Idiomatic uses: in answers, assent, say yes, with neg., say no, οὔ φημι with inf, say that... not (φημί regularly takes the neg., which in Eng. goes with the dependent verb), deny, refuse, Lat. nego.

div.head: φθάνω
div.p: φθήσομαι and rarely φθάσω, ἔφθασα and ἔφθην, come or do before some one else, anticipate, getahead of, with acc. of the person (sometimes omitted) and supplementary ptc. of the action, as φθάνειν καταλαβόντες, karadaBdérres, anticipate in seizing, seize first; φθανουσιν ἐπὶ τῷ ἄκρῳ γενόμενοι τοὺς πολεμίους, they arrive on the height before the enemy, 175, 13; often with πρίν and inf. clause, get ahead before; φθάσαι πρὶν παθεῖν, strike the first blow, 126, 19; ἁρπάσαι φθάσαντας, to capture in advance, 211, 19.

div.head: φθέγγομαι
div.p: φθέγξομαι, ἐφθεγξάμην, ἔφθεγμαι [bor., Eng. diphthong], utter a sound, shout, of a trumpet, sound.

div.head: φθείρω
div.p: φθερῶ, ἔφθειρα, ἔφθαρκα and -έφθορα, ἔφθαρμαι, ἐφθάρην, destroy, lay waste.

div.head: φθονέω
div.p: φθονήσω, ἐφθόνησα, ἐφθονήθην [φθόνος, envy], be jealous of, envy, with dat.

div.head: φιάλη
div.p: -ης [bor., Eng. phial, vial], cup, resembling a large saucer, having no handles or base, used for drinking and esp. for libations to the gods. See Fig. 73, p. 219.

div.head: φιλέω
div.p: φιλήσω, ἐφίλησα, πεφίλημαι, ἐφιλήθην [φίλος], ], love.

div.head: Φιλήσιος
div.p: -ου, Philesius, of Achaea, elected a general in the Greek army.

div.head: φιλία
div.p: -ας [fem. of φίλιος], friendship.

div.head: φιλικός
div.p: -ή, -όν [φίλος], befitting a friend, friendly. φιλικῶς [φιλικός], adv., in a friendly way; φιλικῶς διακεῖσθαι, be on friendly terms with, with dat.

div.head: φίλιος
div.p: -α, -ον friendly. Fem. as subst., friendly country.

div.head: φίλιππος
div.p: -ον [φίλος, ἵππος, horse, bor., Eng. Philip], fond of horses.

div.head: φιλόθηρος
div.p: -ον [φίλος θήρα, hunting], fond of hunting.

div.head: φιλοκερδέω
div.p: [φιλοκερδής (κέρδος, gain), fond of gain), be eager for gain.

div.head: φιλοκίνδυνος
div.p: -ον [ φίλος, κίνδυνος, danger], fond of danger, venturesome.

div.head: φιλομαθής
div.p: -ές [φίλος, μανθάνω, learn; bor., Eng. philomath], fond of learning, eager to learn.

div.head: φιλονικία
div.p: -ας [φιλόνικος (νίκη, victory), fond of victory], eagerness for victory, rivalry.

div.head: φιλοπόλεμος
div.p: -ον [φίλος.

div.head: πόλεμος
div.p: war], fond of war.

div.head: φίλος
div.p: -η, -ον, comp. φιλαίτερος [bor., Eng. philanthropy, philately, philology ], friendly, devoted, attached, with dat. Masc. as subst., friend, adherent.

div.head: φιλόσοφος
div.p: [φίλος, σοφός, wise, bor., Eng. philosopher], lover of wisdom, philosopher.

div.head: φιλοτιμέομαι
div.p: φιλοτιμήσομαι, πεφιλοτίμημαι, ἐφιλοτὶμήθην [φιλότιμος

div.head: (τιμή
div.p: honor), loving honor], love honor, be ambitious, be jealous, feel piqued.

div.head: φιλοφρονέομαι
div.p: ἐφιλοφρονησάμην and ἐφιλοφρονήθην [φιλόφρων (φρήν, mind), kindly disposed], feel friendly, be in a friendly mood; with acc., greet cordially.

div.head: φλυαρέω
div.p: φλυαρήσω [cp. φλυαρία], talk nonsense.

div.head: φλυαρία
div.p: -ας [cp. φλυαρέω] silly talk, nonsense; pl., senseless suggestions.

div.head: φοβερός
div.p: -ά, -όν [φόβος], fearful, dreadful, alarming.

div.head: φοβέω
div.p: φοβήσω, ἐφόβησα [φόβος], frighten, frighten away. Pass. deponent φοβέομαι, φοβήσομαι, πεφόβημαι, ἐφοβήθην, fear, be afraid, abs., with acc., with μή, or with inf.

div.head: φόβος
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. hydrophobia], fear, terror, panic; pl., threats, 183, 1.

div.head: Φοινίκη
div.p: -ns [φοῖνιξ, palm] (Palm land), Phoenicia, the name given by the Greeks to the central portion of the Syrian coast country containing Tyre and Sidon.

div.head: φοινικιστής
div.p: -οῦ [cp. φοινικοῦς], wearer of the purple (or crimson, see φοινικοῦς), a Persian noble of high rank. Some authorities take it for purple dyer, an officer in charge of the royal purple fisheries and dyehouses.

div.head: φοινικοῦς
div.p: -ῆ, -οῦν, contracted from φοινίκεος, -α, -ον [Φοῖνιξ, Phoenician ], purple, or rather dark red, crimson. The discovery of the color was ascribed to Phoenicians.

div.head: φοῖνιξ
div.p:
-ικος, ὁ, date palm, palm tree; οἶνος φοινίκων, palm wine, made of the sap of the tree; a drink was also
made from the juice of the dates. The cabbage (ἐγκέφαλος) was edible.

div.head: Φοῖνιξ
div.p: -ικος, ὁ, Phoenician, a native of Phoenicia.

div.head: φορέω
div.p: φορήσω, ἐφόρησα, -πεφόρηκα, πεφόρημαι, -εφορήϑην [cp. φέρω, bear], bear or carry habitually , of clothes, wear.

div.head: φράζω
div.p: φράσω, ἕφρασα, πέφρακα, πέφρασμαι, ἐφράσθην [bor., Eng. phrase, paraphrase, periphrastic], tell, show, direct, bid, with dat. of person, acc. of thing.

div.head: φρέαρ
div.p: φρέατος, τό, well.

div.head: φρονέω
div.p: φρονήσω, ἐφρόνησα, πεφρόνηκα [φρήν, mind], think, be wise, have understanding, μέγα φρονήσας ἐπὶ τούτῳ, being greatly puffed up at this.

div.head: φρόνημα
div.p: -ατος, τό [φρονέω], spirit, confidence.

div.head: φρόνιμος
div.p: -ον [φρήν, mind ], sagacious, sensible, prudent.

div.head: φροντίζω
div.p: φροντιῶ, ἐφρόντισα, πεφρόντικα [φροντίς, thought, care], be thoughtful or anxious, think, think out, contrive, abs. or with ὅπως.

div.head: φρούραρχος
div.p: -ου [φρουρά, garrison.

div.head: ἄρχω
div.p: command], commander of a garrison.

div.head: φρουρέω
div.p: φρουρήσω, ἐφρούρησα, -τεφρούρημαι, ἐφρουρήθην [φρουρός

div.head: (πρό
div.p: in front of, ὁράω, see), watcher], keep watch, guard; pass., be under guard.

div.head: φρούριον
div.p: -ου [φρουρός, watcher, cp. φρουρέω], garrisoned position, garrison.

div.head: φρύγανον
div.p: -ου, τό [φρύγω, roast], dry stick, pl., brushwood.

div.head: Φρυγία
div.p: -ας [Φρύξ], Phrygia, a Persian province, part of Cyrus’s satrapy, in the west central part of Asia Minor, called Φρυγία ἡ μεγάλη to distinguish it from Lesser Phrygia on the southern shore of the Propontis.

div.head: Φρύξ
div.p: Φρυγός, ὁ, Phrygian, a native of Phrygia.

div.head: φυγάς
div.p: -άδος, ὁ [φεύγω], exile.

div.head: φυγή
div.p: -ῆς [φεύγω], flight φνλακή, -ῆς[φυλάττω], guard, detachment of guards, body guard, garrison , guard duty, picket duty; watch, a third part of the night (see Introd. § 65).

div.head: φύλαξ
div.p: -ακος, ὁ [φυλάττω], guard, sentinel, picket.

div.head: φυλάττω
div.p: φυλάξω, ἐφύλαξα, -πεφύλαχα, πεφύλαγμαι, ἐφυλάχθην [bor., Eng. phylactery, prophylactic], keep guard, be on guard; guard, defend, watch; φνλακὰς φυλάττειν do guard duty; mid., be on one’s guard, defend oneself, be on one’s guard against, keep an eye on, abs., with acc., or with μή.

div.head: φυσάω
div.p: πεφύσημαι, ἐφυσήθην [φῦσα, bellows ], blow up, inflate.

div.head: Φύσκος
div.p: -ου, Physcus, a river flowing into the Tigris.

div.head: φύω
div.p: φύσω, ἔφυσα and ἔφυν, πέφυκα [cogn., Lat. fui, I was, Eng. be; bor., Eng. physics, neophyte], bring forth, produce. Φωκαῖς, -ίδος, ἡ, woman, from Phocaea, a Greek city on the coast of Asia Minor northwest of Smyrna.

div.head: φωνή
div.p:
-ῆς, [cp. φημί; bor. Eng. euphony, phonetic, phonograph, microphone, telephone], voice; language, dialect. φῶς, φωτός, τό [cp. φαίνω, show, bor., Eng. phosphorus, photograph], light.
Χαλδαῖοι, -ων, οἱ, Chaldeans, an independent tribe in the mountains of Armenia, thought to have been of the same stock as the Babylonian Chaldaeans; possibly the same people as the Chalybes.

div.head: χαλεπαίνω
div.p: χαλεπανῶ, ἐχαλέπηνα, ἐχαλεπάνθην [χαλεπός), be harsh, be angry or provoked, be angry at, abs. or with dat.

div.head: χαλεπός
div.p: -ή, -όν, hard, difficult: painful, inaccessible; harsh, stern, bitter. Neut. as subst., sternness, severity. χαλεπῶς [χαλεπός], adv., wth difficulty; painfully; χαλεπῶς φέρειν, take it hard, be grieved.

div.head: χαλινόω
div.p: ἐχαλίνωσα, -κεχαλένωμαι [χαλινός, bridle], bridle a horse.

div.head: χαλκός
div.p: -ου, bronze, a compound of copper and tin. χαλκοῦς, -ῆ, -οῦν, contracted from

div.head: χάλκεος
div.p: -α, -ον [χαλκός], of bronze, brazen.

div.head: χάλκωμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [χαλκόω (χαλκός), make in bronze], bronze utensil or vessel.

div.head: Χάλος
div.p: -ου, Chalus, a river of northern Syria. Χάλυβες, -ων, οἱ, Chalpbes, a tribe on the northern frontier of Armenia.

div.head: χαράδρα
div.p: -ας, bed of a mountain stream left dry in summer, gorge.

div.head: χαρίεις
div.p: -ίεσσα, -ίev [χάρις], graceful, elegant, clever.

div.head: χαρίζομαι
div.p: χαριοῦμαι, ἐχαρισάμην, κεχάρισμαι [χάρις], show kindness, do favors, be obliging, gratify, abs., with dat. of person, cogn. acc. of thing.

div.head: χάρις
div.p: -ιτος, ἡ [χαίρω, refoice; cogn., Lat. gratus, pleasing: bor. Eng. eucharist ], kindness, favor ; thanks, gratitude ; χάριν εἰδέναι or ἔχειν, be grateful, feel gratitude, with dat.; χάριν ἀποδιδόναι, return a favor, with dat.

div.head: Χαρμάνδη
div.p: -ης, Charmande, a city of Arabia, on the Euphrates.

div.head: χειμών
div.p: -ῶνος, ὁ [cp. χιών, snow], winter, cold, storm.

div.head: χείρ
div.p: χειρός, ἡ [bor., Eng. chirography, chiromancy, chiropody, surgeon (originally chirurgeon)], hand, wrist, εἰς χεῖρας, in or to hand-to-hand conflict, into the power of, abs, or with dat.

div.head: Χειρίσοφος
div.p: -ου, ἡ a Spartan general, sent by his government to aid Cyrus. After the entrapping of the generals at the Zapatas, he and Xenophon were the chief leaders of the army.

div.head: χειροπληθής
div.p: -ές [χείρ, πλήθω, be full], hand-filling, as large as can be held in the hand.

div.head: χειροποίητος
div.p: -ον [ χείρ, ποιέω, make], made by hand, artificial, Χερρόνησος, -ου, ἡ [χέρρος (older form χέρσος), mainland, vioos, island], peninsula, in the Anabasis only of the Thracian Chersonése, which extends along the north and west of the Hellespont.

div.head: χήν
div.p: χηνός, ὁ, ἡ [cogn., Lat. anser, goose, German Gans, Eng. gander, goose ], goose.

div.head: χίλιοι
div.p: -αι, -α, thousand.

div.head: χιλός
div.p: -ου, green fodder, forage; χιλὸς

div.head: ξηρός
div.p: hay.

div.head: χίμαιρα
div.p: -ας [bor., Eng. chimera, chimerical], she-goat.

div.head: Χῖος
div.p: -ου, Chian, a native of Chios, an island in the Aegean Sea off the coast of Lydia.

div.head: χιτών
div.p:
-ῶνος, ὁ, undergarment, shirt, tunic. See Figs. 11, 14, 59, pp. 55,
60, 185. It was ordinarily the only garment worn in the house, but in public a mantle (ἱμάτιον) was usually worn over it; see Fig. 56, p. 171.

div.head: χιών
div.p: -όνος, ἡ [cp. χειμών; cogn., Lat. hiems, winter, Eng. Himalaya (= snow-abode)], snow.

div.head: χοῖνιξ
div.p: -ικος, ἡ, choenix, a Greek dry measure equiv, to about a quart

div.head: χοίρειος
div.p: -α, -ον [χοῖρος, young pig], of a pig; χοίρεια, pork.

div.head: χορεύω
div.p: χορεύσω, etc. [χορός, dance, chorus, bor, Eng. chorus, choir], dance.

div.head: χόρτος
div.p: -ου [cogn., Lat. hortus, garden, Eng. garden, yard] (originally inclosure, feeding place), fodder, grass; χόρτος κοῦφος, hay.

div.head: χράομαι
div.p: χρήσομαι, ἐχρησάμην, κέχρημαι, ἐχρήσθην, use, make use of; employ, enjoy, have, find, treat, handle, manage, with dat. (cp. Lat. utor, use, with ablative), or with neut. pron. as cogn. acc.

div.head: χρή
div.p: (originally a noun meaning necessity, used impersonally with ἐστί implied, there is necessity; impf. χρῆν = χρὴ ἦν, or with added augment ἔχρην), it is necessary, one must, with inf. or acc. and inf. χρήζω, need, desire, abs. or with inf.

div.head: χρῆμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [χράομαι, thing used, pl. things, property, possessions, money.

div.head: χρήσιμος
div.p: -η, -ον and -ος, -ον [χρῆσις

div.head: (χράομαι)
div.p: use], useful, serviceable, efficient.

div.head: χρηστός
div.p: -ή, -όν [verbal of χράομαι, bor., Eng. chrestomathy ], useful ; of persons, good and true, trusty.

div.head: χρῖμα
div.p: -ατος, τό [χρίω; bor., Eng. chrism], unguent, ointment.

div.head: χρίω
div.p: χρίσω, ἔχρισα, κέχριμαι [bor., Eng. Christ], with oil or ointment; mid., anoint oneself.

div.head: χρόνος
div.p: -ου [ bor., Eng. chronic, chronicle, chronology, chronometer, anachronism ], time, while.

div.head: χρυσίον
div.p: -ου [diminutive of χρυσός], ], piece of gold, coined gold, money.

div.head: χρυσός
div.p: -ου [bor., Eng. chrysalis, chrysanthemum, chryselephantine], gold.

div.head: χρυσοῦς
div.p: -ῆς, -οῦν, contracted from χρύσεος, -α, -ον [χρῦσός], of gold, golden; inlaid or ornamented with gold, gold-mounted.

div.head: χρυσοχάλινος
div.p: -ον [χρυσός, χαλινός, bridle], with gold-mounted bridle.

div.head: χώρα
div.p: -ας, place, esp. military position, post, station; land, country, territory; κατὰ χώραν, see τίθημι.

div.head: χωρέω
div.p: χωρήσω and χωρήσομαι, ἐχώρησα, κεχώρηκα, -κεχρημαι, -εχωρήθην [χῶρος, place], give place; move, go, go forward, advance, march; of measures, hold, contain.

div.head: χωρίον
div.p: -ου [diminutive of χῶρος, place], place, spot, space, esp. strong place, fortress, stronghold, often with adjs. meaning strong, as ἐχυρός, ὀχυρός, ἰσχυρός.

div.head: χωρίς
div.p: adv., apart, separately; with gen., apart from.

div.head: Ψάρος
div.p: -ου, Psarus, a river flowing through Cilicia into the Mediterranean.

div.head: ψέλιον
div.p: -ov, bracelet, armlet.

div.head: ψευδής
div.p: -ές [ψεύδω], false, untrue.

div.head: ψεῦδος
div.p: -ους, τό [ψεύδω], falsehood, lie.

div.head: ψεύδω
div.p:
ψεύσω, ἔψευσα, ἔψευσμαι, ἐψεύσθην [bor., Eng. pseudo-, as in
pseudonym], rare in act., deceive; mid., lie, deceive, be deceitful; pass., be deceived, be mistaken, abs., with acc. or πρός and acc. of person, cogn. acc. of thing.

div.head: ψηφίζομαι
div.p: ψηφιοῦμαι, ἐψηφισάμην, ἐψήφισμαι, ἐψηφίσθην [ψῆφος, pebble, used in voting], vote, vote upon, decide.

div.head: ψιλός
div.p: -ή, -όν [cp. epsilon, upsilon], bare, barren; unprotected, without defensive armor.

div.head: ψιλόω
div.p: ψιλώσω, ἐψίλωσα, ἐψίλωμαι, ἐψιλώθην [ψιλός], strip dare, clear, with gen.

div.head: ψοφέω
div.p: ἐψόφησα [ψόφος], make a noise, ring.

div.head: ψόφος
div.p: -ου, noisd.

div.head: ψυχή
div.p: -ῆς, [ψύχω, blow, breathe; bor., Eng. Psyche, psychic, psychology, psychotherapy ], breath of life, life, soul, spirit.

div.head: ψῦχος
div.p: -ους, τό [ψύχω, blow], cold, pl., seasons of cold.

div.head: ὦ
div.p: interjection, O, usually with a vocative and not to be translated.

div.head: ὧδε
div.p: [ὅδε, this], adv., in this way, thus; usually referring to what follows (see ὅδε), as follows, in the following manner.

div.head: ᾠδή
div.p: -ῆς [ᾄδω, sing, bor., Eng. ode, melody, prosody, comedy, tragedy ], song.

div.head: ὠθέω
div.p: ὥσω, ἕωσα, ἔωσμαι, ἐώσθην, push; mid., push from oneself.

div.head: ὠμοβόειος
div.p: -α, -ον [ὠμός, βοῦς, ox], of or covered with raw oxhide.

div.head: ὠμός
div.p: -ή, -όν, raw; rough, savage, gruff.

div.head: ὠνέομαι
div.p: ὠνήσομαι, ἐπριάμην, ἐώνημαι, ἐωνήθην [ὦνος, price], buy.

div.head: ὤνιος
div.p: -α, -ον [ὦνος, price], for sale; τὰ ὤνια, goods for sale, wares.

div.head: Ὦπις
div.p: -ιδος, ἡ, Opis, a city of Assyria, on the Physcus.

div.head: ὥρα
div.p: -ads [cogn., Eng. year; bor., Lat. hora, hour, Eng. hour, horoscope ], season of the year, time of day, hour, proper time, the time, opportunity, with inf. or dat. and inf.

div.head: ὡραῖος
div.p: -α, -ον [ὥρα], in season, in the bloom of youth.

div.head: ὡς
div.p:
[ὅς, who], rel. adv. and conj., as, how. As adv., as, how, as if, apparently, ostensibly, as he (they) said, alleging that, on the ground that, thinking that, with the avowed intention, often with a circumstantial ptc. of cause or purpose, showing that the ptc. states the real, or pretended, reason or purpose as given out by the subject of the main verb or of somebody else mentioned prominently in the context, but not implying that the writer or speaker asserts it to be the actual reason or purpose; so with gen. abs. or a prepositional phrase; with numerals, about, with sup. (cp. Lat. quam), ὡς μάλιστα, without a form of δύναμαι, as much as possible, ὡς τάχιστα, as quickly as possible; ὡς ἐδύνατο, as best he could, ὡς ἐπὶ τὸ πολύ, as a rule, generally; ὡς συνελόντι εἰπεῖν, to speak concisely, As prep., only of persons, to. As conj., as, that; of cause, as, since; of time, when, ὡς τάχιστα,
as soon as, with indic.; introducing indir. disc., how, that, with indic. or opt.; of purpose, that, in order’ that, with subj. or opt.; of result or intended result, so that, so as to, with inf.; βραχύτερα ἣ ὡς ἐξικνεῖσθαι, too short a distance to reach, ὥς [ὅς, this, epic], dem. adv., used in Attic only in certain phrases, thus, so; οὐδ᾽ ws, not even under these circumstances.

div.head: ὡσαύτως
div.p: [ὥς, αὐτός, same], adv., in this same way, likewise.

div.head: ὥσπερ
div.p: [ws + intensive πέρ], rel. adv., just as, just like, as, just as if, as it seemed, apparently.

div.head: ὥστε
div.p: [ὡς + τέ, and], conj., so that; of result or intended result, so that, that, so as to, with indic. or inf.; introducing a sentence, so that, and so; of proviso, so that it be, provided it be, with inf, 135, 5.

div.head: ὠτειλή
div.p: -ῆς, wound, scar.

div.head: ὠτίς
div.p: -ίδος, ἡ, bustard.

div.head: ὠφελέω
div.p: ὠφελήσω, etc. [ὄφελος, help, | advantage ], help, assist, with acc.

div.head: ὠφέλιμος
div.p: -ον [ὠφελέω], useful, advantageous.
